title: The CEO of Bank of America says that they're slowing down hiring because not enough people left the company on their own: 'We went past our target headcount'
summary: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan announced a slowdown in hiring because the company "went past our target headcount" due to a decreased attrition rate. The bank is pausing hiring for non-vital positions to manage costs and prepare for a potential mild recession in late 2023. Moynihan also addressed compensation, stating that broad-based employees would see an average increase, despite potential cuts to bonus pools in areas like investment banking.

title: JPMorgan, PNC Submit Bids to Buy First Republic in Government-Led Sale
summary: The Federal Deposit Insurance Corp. (FDIC) is reviewing bids for First Republic Bank and preparing to seize the lender following a significant deposit run. Major banks, including JPMorgan Chase & Co. and PNC Financial Services Group Inc., have submitted offers. The FDIC is expected to announce a winner before First Republic Bank opens on Monday morning.

title: Employee Financial Wellness in America
summary: A Bank of America study reveals that 66% of employees are stressed about their financial situation, with 76% believing the cost of living outpaces income growth. The 2025 study, analyzing 401(k) participants, highlights struggles with short-term expenses and long-term goals across different demographics, emphasizing the need for employers to offer tailored financial wellness programs. Key findings show disparities in retirement savings and debt burdens among various generations and income groups.

title: BankUnited Announces New Corporate Banking Team In New York
summary: BankUnited Inc. (NYSE: BKU) has announced the formation of a new corporate banking team dedicated to serving the New York Metropolitan area. The team consists of three financial executives, Matthew Gallo, Daniel Mills, and Laura Ackerman, all previously from First Republic Bank. Led by Matthew Gallo as executive vice president, managing director, corporate banking, the new team aims to deliver customized financial solutions to clients in the region.

title: Ibrahim Incoglu
summary: Ibrahim Incoglu is a Managing Director and Co-Head of the Securitized Assets Team in BlackRock's Global Fixed Income division. He also leads the Non-Agency RMBS business and chairs the BlackRock Housing-Mortgage Finance Economic Committee. His career includes significant experience in securitized products at Wachovia Securities and Bank of America Securities, focusing on trading and structuring various RMBS.

title: Bank of America Cut CEO Brian Moynihan’s Pay 6% in 2022
summary: Bank of America cut CEO Brian Moynihan's pay by 6% in 2022, reducing his total compensation to $30 million from $32 million in 2021. This reduction occurred as the company's stock price and profit declined. His 2022 compensation included a base salary of $1.5 million and restricted stock valued at $28.5 million.

title: Arizona workers to benefit as Bank of America boosts its minimum wage to $25 an hour
summary: Bank of America is increasing its minimum wage to $25 an hour by 2025, with the first raise to $23 an hour starting next month. This move will benefit an undisclosed number of workers in Arizona, particularly in metro Phoenix, as the company aims to attract and retain employees in a tight job market. The company has consistently raised its minimum wage over the past several years, emphasizing its commitment to competitive pay and employee investment.

title: Buy boomers, sell millennials: Bank of America trade recommendation exploits 'big diversion' in generational spending amid high interest rates
summary: Bank of America recommends a "buy boomers, sell millennials" investment strategy, capitalizing on the widening wealth gap between generations. High interest rates are benefiting boomers' savings and home equity, while millennials struggle with debt and high living costs. This strategy suggests investing in sectors favored by older consumers, such as health care, entertainment, and certain financial services, and avoiding those skewed towards younger, cash-strapped demographics.

title: Annual Golf Tournament and Clam Bake, Racial Unity Team: Seacoast business news
summary: This article compiles several business news items from the Seacoast region. It covers First Seacoast Bank's underwriting of Apple Harvest Day and its associated 5k race, the Greater Rochester Chamber of Commerce celebrating Peace of Mind Medicaid Consultant's anniversary, Bank of America's 2023 New Hampshire Student Leaders program, details of the 49th Annual Golf Tournament and Clam Bake, and Kennebunk Savings' significant sponsorship of the award-winning Racial Unity Team.

title: Here are Seacoast 10 to Watch young professionals winners for 2023
summary: The 2023 10 To Watch contest recognized young professionals under 40 in the Seacoast region at an awards ceremony on October 11 in Portsmouth. This year marked the 10th anniversary of the contest, presented by Catapult Seacoast and Local iQ, and sponsored by Bank of America, Heritage Home Services, and Eversource. The article details the achievements and community contributions of ten winners, including bankers, healers, marketing coordinators, housing advocates, and entrepreneurs.

title: The CEO of Bank of America is slowing down hiring and taking a pay cut but he's still making $30 million
summary: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan's total compensation for 2022 declined 6.3% to $30 million, a year marked by falling profit and stock performance. The board awarded him a $1.5 million salary and $28.5 million in stock-based incentives. This pay adjustment reflects an industry-wide focus on cost control amid a challenging economic environment, mirroring similar compensation reductions for other top banking executives.

title: CapFed tells investors the Fed's interest rate hikes are eating into Kansas bank's profits
summary: Capitol Federal reported to investors that the Federal Reserve's interest rate hikes are significantly impacting the Kansas bank's profits, with net interest margin decreasing due to the inverted yield curve. Despite an increase in total income, net income dropped to $8.3 million, and stockholder dividends of $0.085 per share ($11.3 million total) now exceed the bank's profits. The bank is raising rates for depositors to mitigate deposit runoff and projecting slower growth in home loans as higher mortgage rates affect affordability.

title: Wall Street is in an all-out war for AI talent as banks poach each others’ employees—and Goldman Sachs is losing
summary: Goldman Sachs has experienced the largest net outflow of AI talent among its major rivals, losing 60 employees to competitors like Morgan Stanley and Citigroup in the past year. This trend highlights the fierce competition for AI expertise on Wall Street, where top AI professionals can command salaries nearing $1 million in the U.S. While the departures are a small percentage of overall staff, banks are actively re-evaluating their strategies to attract and retain critical AI specialists, as seen with JPMorgan Chase's significant net increase in AI staff.

title: ETF People - Alberto Ruiz Sena
summary: Alberto Ruiz Sena is the Head of EMEA Fixed Income Index Product at ICE Data Indices, a part of Intercontinental Exchange (NYSE: ICE). He is responsible for fixed income index products in EMEA and supports sales teams with subject matter expertise. Prior to ICE, he worked at Bank of America Merrill Lynch and Dresdner Kleinwort Wasserstein.

title: Future of Qwest in Banks' Hands
summary: Qwest Communications International Inc. faces a potential Chapter 11 bankruptcy filing by year-end due to a $1.14 billion net loss in the second quarter and $5.6 billion in maturing debt. The company is in negotiations with lenders and is attempting to sell its QwestDex directory business to alleviate its cash crunch. Qwest also revised its financial guidance downwards after accounting scandals and a significant write-down related to its KPNQwest joint venture and WorldCom's bankruptcy.

title: Blackstone Sweetens $3 Billion Private Loan to Fend Off Banks
summary: Blackstone Inc. and HPS Investment Partners sweetened the terms of Guidehouse Inc.'s existing $3.075 billion private loan and $250 million revolver, including slashing the interest rate and extending maturity, to prevent banks from refinancing the debt during Guidehouse's sale to Bain Capital Private Equity. This move highlights the intensifying competition between private credit lenders and banks for buyout financing. The lenders also added a payment-in-kind option and new call protections in exchange for their concessions and Bain is injecting new equity.

title: Chase and Bank of America cap 2023 with new Pittsburgh branches, here's where
summary: Chase and Bank of America are expanding their presence in the Pittsburgh metro area by opening new branches in December 2023. This marks a continuation of the trend where the nation's two biggest banks are increasing their physical footprint in the region. The article highlights these new branch openings as significant events for the close of the year.

title: Bank of America, Lowe's CEOs optimistic about consumers' resilience in 2024
summary: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan and Lowe's CEO Marvin Ellison expressed optimism regarding consumer resilience in 2024 during the 2023 Charlotte Regional Business Alliance annual meeting. They shared their economic outlooks, suggesting confidence in the consumer's ability to navigate the upcoming year. The discussion took place on December 12th at the annual event.

title: BofA appoints 334 new managing directors, down 8% from last year
summary: Bank of America (BAC.N) promoted 334 employees to managing directors, an 8% decrease from the previous year, with over half of the group comprising women and people of color for the fourth consecutive year. This follows Goldman Sachs' (GS.N) announcement of promoting fewer managing directors for the upcoming year. BofA CEO Brian Moynihan expects the bank to outperform rivals in investment banking fees for the fourth quarter.

title: Bank of America Promotes 334 to Managing Director, 8% Fewer Than Last Year
summary: Bank of America (BAC) promoted 334 employees to managing director, which is 8% fewer than the previous year. Over half of the new managing directors are women or people of color, marking the fourth consecutive year that historically underrepresented groups constituted the majority of the class. The firm also named 75 executives in global corporate and investment banking and 65 new managing directors in global markets.

title: Subdued volatility masks ongoing uncertainty
summary: Market volatility has fallen to low levels, suggesting investors anticipate a narrow range of economic outcomes, despite ongoing uncertainty from tighter credit conditions and potential economic downside following recent banking turmoil. The article also notes China's stronger-than-expected economic growth in Q1, driven by consumption, and suggests opportunities within Chinese equities, the Australian dollar, commodities, and select European beneficiaries. UBS analysts maintain a preference for high-quality bonds over equities given the tightening credit conditions impacting growth.

title: Barclays Recognizes 81 New Managing Directors in the Corporate and Investment Bank
summary: Barclays has announced the promotion of 81 colleagues within its Corporate and Investment Bank to Managing Director, effective January 1, 2024. These individuals were recognized for their outstanding client outcomes and exemplary leadership. Paul Compton, Global Head of CIB, emphasized their crucial role in delivering Barclays' growth strategy and strengthening the company culture.

title: Bank CEOs bring Basel III battle to Congress
summary: Eight major bank CEOs testified before the Senate Banking Committee to criticize the proposed Basel III endgame capital rules, arguing they will harm the economy by unjustifiably increasing capital requirements. They claimed the proposal wasn't properly studied and that banks were not adequately consulted, emphasizing their role in mitigating the regional bank crisis without needing more stringent rules. Moderate Democrats on the committee appear sympathetic to the banks' arguments, potentially influencing Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell's decision on the proposal.

title: Bank of America CEO Moynihan Says Economy Slowing But Outlook Still Positive
summary: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan stated that there are signs of the US economy slowing down. Despite this, he expects a soft landing rather than a recession, noting that money is coming out of customer accounts and consumer spending has leveled out, indicating a normalization of the economy.

title: Bank of America will shutter nearly 150 branches nationwide this year. Here are the Maryland impacts
summary: Bank of America plans to close nearly 150 branches nationwide this year, including some in Maryland, as the banking industry shifts away from physical locations. One specific Maryland branch in Columbia is slated for closure. This move reflects a broader trend of banks reducing their physical footprints.

title: Bank of America is closing more than 100 branches this year
summary: Bank of America plans to close over 100 branches across the U.S. by the end of 2023, with more closures expected in 2024. This trend, accelerated by the pandemic and the shift to online banking, has seen 95 financial centers already shut down this year, with an additional 15 anticipated by year-end. The Charlotte-based bank foresees up to 138 branch closures in 2024, continuing a long-term strategy of rationalizing its physical footprint due to increased demand for electronic financial services.

title: BNY Mellon to raise minimum wage, add mental health benefits
summary: BNY Mellon announced it will increase its minimum wage to $22.50 an hour starting in March and expand mental health benefits for employees to cover 12 therapy sessions annually. This marks the third wage boost in three years for the bank, aiming to attract and retain top talent by offering competitive compensation and improved benefits. Other major lenders, like Bank of America, are also increasing minimum compensation for their workers.

title: Bank of America to shutter nearly 150 branches nationwide this year. Here's where.
summary: Bank of America plans to close over 100 branches across the U.S. by the end of this year, including locations in Florida. The article mentions this in the context of broader trends affecting banking and financial services.

title: Bank of America fined $12 million for mortgage disclosure violations by federal watchdog
summary: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) has fined Bank of America $12 million for violating the federal Home Mortgage Disclosure Act. The bank's mortgage officers inaccurately reported demographic data for loan applicants over a period of four years by falsely stating applicants declined to provide information such as race, ethnicity, and sex. This fine will be directed to the CFPB's victims relief fund.

title: Asia’s booming ETF markets – the next innovation frontier
summary: Asia's ETF market has experienced rapid growth in size and sophistication, with assets under management (AUM) in Asia ex-Japan rising to USD 499 billion by September 2022. The region offers a diverse range of ETF products, including equity and fixed income ETFs, as well as those tracking virtual assets and actively managed funds. HSBC has played a significant role as a pioneer in developing the ETF asset class in Asia, providing a full range of services and continuing to drive innovation and growth in the market.

title: Bank of America to close nearly 150 branches nationwide this year
summary: Bank of America plans to close nearly 150 branches across the U.S. by the end of the year, continuing a trend of branch consolidations. This includes locations it has already trimmed in the Carolinas. The closures signify the bank's ongoing strategy regarding its physical footprint.

title: Bank of America is shuttering more than 100 branches nationwide this year. Here's where
summary: Bank of America plans to close over 100 branches across the U.S. by the end of this year. This includes locations that have already been trimmed in the Carolinas. This initiative is part of a broader trend affecting financial institutions as they adapt to changing banking habits.

title: News | Three Big Banks Sue Financially Ailing Hospitality REIT To Preserve Value of Hotels
summary: Three major banks, Morgan Stanley Bank, Barclays Bank, and Bank of America, have sued Ashford Hospitality Trust for breaching contracts related to loans for 14 hotels. The banks are seeking court appointment of a receiver to preserve the hotels' value and ensure compliance with brand agreements during an anticipated months-long foreclosure process. This legal action follows Ashford Hospitality Trust's plan to hand back 19 hotels to lenders to improve its capital structure.

title: Bank of America Sees S&P 500 Hitting Record 5,000 Next Year
summary: Bank of America strategists predict the S&P 500 will reach a new high of 5,000 in 2024, as US companies have effectively navigated higher interest rates and macroeconomic challenges. The optimistic outlook is driven by the resilience of US exceptionalism, rather than anticipated interest rate cuts by the Federal Reserve.

title: 22 New Jersey bankers recognized as rising stars
summary: The New Jersey Bankers Association announced its 2023 Rising Star Awards, recognizing 22 bankers for their leadership, industry contributions, and community commitment. Honorees were nominated by their banks and selected by an independent panel of judges. The list includes individuals from various banks across New Jersey and surrounding areas, highlighting their diverse roles and impacts.

title: BBVA will transfer its New York headquarters to more sustainable offices
summary: BBVA is relocating its New York headquarters to a more sustainable building at Two Manhattan West, aiming to provide a better experience for its 350 employees and reinforce its commitment to sustainability. The new office space, powered by renewable energy, is part of BBVA's broader strategy to reduce its environmental impact through a Global Eco-Efficiency Plan. The move is planned for the last quarter of 2024, joining other major tenants in the LEED-Gold certified building.

title: Warren Buffet's latest buys and sells
summary: This article details Berkshire Hathaway's latest stock buys and sells from its third-quarter 2023 13F filing, highlighting that the company was a net seller despite a tough market quarter, leading to a record cash stake. It identifies three undervalued Warren Buffett stocks within Berkshire Hathaway’s portfolio—Bank of America, American Express, and Kraft Heinz—providing Morningstar's analysis and key metrics for each. The piece also lists the stocks Berkshire Hathaway sold entirely, including Activision Blizzard, Celanese, General Motors, Johnson & Johnson, Mondelez International, Procter & Gamble, and United Parcel Service, while noting a significant reduction in its Chevron holdings.

title: Blackrock May Be Considering an Ether ETF, Ether Price Jumps
summary: Blackrock appears to be exploring an Ether ETF, evidenced by a "iShares Ethereum Trust" filing in Delaware, which caused Ether's price to jump. This move mirrors Blackrock's actions prior to its spot Bitcoin ETF application, suggesting a similar potential path for Ether. If approved, a spot Ether ETF could significantly impact the crypto asset's regulatory standing.

title: Bank of America’s Moynihan Says Succession Plan Leaves Nothing to Chance
summary: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan stated that the company has a comprehensive succession plan in place for his eventual replacement, leaving nothing to chance. Moynihan, who also chairs Bank of America's board, emphasized that the company is always prepared for such transitions. He made these remarks at the Reuters Next conference.

title: Bank of America will lend $10 mln to veteran business fund
summary: Bank of America will provide an additional $10 million in funding to the Veteran Loan Fund, a group that supports small businesses owned by former military personnel. This new investment is part of a larger $25 million fundraising round, aiming to expand the fund to $100 million nationwide by 2027. Bank of America previously invested $5 million in the fund when it launched in 2021.

title: BofA Securities Maintains CDW Corp(CDW.US) With Hold Rating, Cuts Target Price to $170
summary: BofA Securities analyst Ruplu Bhattacharya has maintained a Hold rating on CDW Corp (CDW.US) but has adjusted the target price downwards from $225 to $170. According to TipRanks data, the analyst has a 61.2% success rate and an average return of 7.6% over the past year.

title: Korro Bio and Frequency Therapeutics Merge
summary: Korro Bio and Frequency Therapeutics announced the completion of their business combination, forming a new entity that will operate under the name Korro Bio, Inc. The combined company's shares are expected to trade on the Nasdaq Capital Market under the ticker "KRRO" starting November 6, 2023, following a $117 million private placement. This strategic move aims to fund operations and advance Korro's RNA editing platform, focusing on its lead product candidate for AATD and expanding its pipeline into 2026.

title: Bank of America says emerging markets are showing signs of capitulation
summary: Bank of America suggests that emerging markets are displaying signs of capitulation, with their stock performance relative to the U.S. reaching its worst level since 1971. The iShares MSCI emerging markets ETF (EEM) has seen a 1% decline this year, contrasting sharply with a 13% rise for the S&P 500 tracking ETF (SPY). This divergence prompts the question of whether it's an opportune time for investors to consider emerging-market equities.

title: Bank of America says emerging markets are showing signs of capitulation
summary: Bank of America indicates that emerging markets are displaying signs of capitulation, with their stock performance relative to the U.S. reaching the worst level since 1971. The iShares MSCI emerging markets ETF (EEM) has seen a 1% decline this year, starkly contrasting with the S&P 500's 13% rise, suggesting potential buying opportunities.

title: Kingsbarn Invests in REITs & BDCs With DVDN
summary: Kingsbarn Capital Management has launched the actively managed Kingsbarn Dividend Opportunity ETF (DVDN), which focuses on equities from residential and commercial mortgage REITs and business development companies. The ETF aims to provide attractive quarterly dividends and capital appreciation, leveraging the low market correlations and consistent high dividend distributions observed in these sectors. This launch comes amidst a perceived buying opportunity in the REIT space and a growing trend towards actively managed ETFs outperforming their passive counterparts.

title: Crestwood Announces Receipt of Requisite Consents With Respect to its Previously Announced Consent Solicitation
authors: Crestwood Equity Partners LP via Business Wire
summary: Crestwood Equity Partners LP has announced it received the necessary consents from holders of its 9.250% Perpetual Preferred Units to approve a proposed amendment to its partnership agreement. This amendment is in connection with its previously announced merger with Energy Transfer LP. The Proposed Amendment will increase the cash redemption price for Preferred Units during the merger and conform certain terms to Energy Transfer's existing preferred units, simplifying the capital structure post-merger.

title: 3M raises full-year profit forecast aided by cost cuts, price hikes
summary: 3M Co raised its full-year adjusted profit forecast and reported upbeat quarterly earnings, driven by price hikes and cost savings that offset slow demand. The company's shares rose over 5% despite ongoing challenges from weak consumer electronics demand and significant litigation liabilities related to earplugs and "forever chemicals." 3M now expects full-year adjusted earnings per share between $8.95 and $9.15, exceeding prior forecasts.

title: Bank of America Voted Best US Sell-Side Research Firm, Ending JPMorgan’s Reign
summary: Bank of America Corp. has been voted the best US sell-side research firm in the latest Institutional Investor survey, ending JPMorgan Chase & Co.'s seven-year reign. BofA secured 49 positions in the leaders table, with analysts Craig Siegenthaler and Julien Dumoulin-Smith receiving top honors in their respective fields. JPMorgan followed with 46 spots, and Morgan Stanley with 44.

title: Bank of America's unrealized losses on securities rose to $131.6 bln
summary: Bank of America reported an increase in unrealized losses on securities to $131.6 billion in the third quarter, compared to $106 billion in the second quarter. Despite these paper losses, the bank does not anticipate actual losses because it intends to hold these government-guaranteed securities until maturity, a strategy supported by its strong liquidity. This situation highlights the broader issue within the U.S. banking sector, which faces an estimated $650 billion in unrealized losses across securities portfolios due to rising interest rates.

title: Bank of America Q3 earnings: Net income jumps 10% at $7.8 billion
summary: Bank of America reported a robust third quarter with net income jumping 10% to $7.8 billion and revenue at its consumer banking unit surging 6% to $10.5 billion. The bank saw strong performance in investment banking and trading divisions, despite CEO Brian Moynihan's warning of slowing consumer spending due to inflation. Alongside this, the bank reported increased loan balances and significant unrealized losses on securities held until maturity.

title: Surveillance: Bank of America Shows How Wall St. Is Diverging From Main St.
summary: This article discusses how results from major US banks, particularly Bank of America (BAC), are no longer accurately reflecting the state of the average US consumer. Historically, big bank earnings served as a preliminary indicator for the broader economy, but this trend appears to be changing. The Bloomberg Surveillance newsletter offers insights into this evolving relationship between Wall Street and Main Street.

title: Goldman Sachs tops estimates on stronger-than-expected bond trading
summary: Goldman Sachs exceeded third-quarter profit and revenue estimates, driven by stronger-than-expected bond trading revenue. Despite this, the bank's profit dropped 33% year-over-year, and it faced write-downs related to its GreenSky lending business and commercial real estate. Analysts are keen for insights into the investment banking outlook and the future of its consumer efforts.

title: Bank of America reports rise in profit and revenue for Q3, surpassing analysts expectations
summary: Bank of America announced a rise in profit and revenue for the third quarter, exceeding analysts' expectations due to stronger-than-anticipated net interest income. This performance highlights the bank's ability to grow earnings year-over-year.

title: Lower headcount remains a key to Bank of America’s expense strategy
summary: Bank of America expects a continued decline in noninterest expenses, with lower headcount being a critical component of its expense management strategy. This focus on efficiency aligns with trends seen in other banks, as executives aim to maintain a tight rein on costs.

title: Bonds Have Been Awful. It’s a Good Time to Buy. (Published 2023)
summary: Despite bonds experiencing their "greatest bear market of all time," with long-term U.S. Treasuries losing significant value and some international bonds plummeting even more, the author argues that this is an excellent time to buy. The rising interest rates and resulting price declines have made high-quality bonds more attractive due to higher yields and lower prices, presenting a worthwhile investment for many.

title: Why Bank of America isn't falling in line as Truist, Wells Fargo and other rivals cut jobs
summary: While competitors like Truist and Wells Fargo are implementing job cuts and efficiency measures, Bank of America is maintaining CEO Brian Moynihan's steady approach. This article explores analysts' perspectives on Bank of America's strategy and its potential implications for the bank's stock performance.

title: What to watch as Bank of America, Truist, Wells Fargo report Q3 earnings
summary: Charlotte's three largest banks, Wells Fargo, Bank of America, and Truist, are preparing to report their Q3 earnings. Wells Fargo will report on Oct. 13, followed by Bank of America on Oct. 17, and Truist on Oct. 19. Analysts are expressing upbeat expectations as these financial institutions release their latest quarterly results.

title: Largest US Banks Grapple With Worst Write-Offs in Three Years
summary: The largest US banks are expected to report their highest write-offs of bad loans since the early days of the pandemic, totaling approximately $5.3 billion in combined third-quarter net charge-offs. This increase is attributed to prolonged high interest rates and a potential economic downturn, putting pressure on borrowers. JPMorgan Chase & Co., Citigroup Inc., Wells Fargo & Co., and Bank of America Corp. are among the banks facing these challenges.

title: Going Into Earnings, Is Bank of America Stock a Buy, a Sell, or Fairly Valued?
summary: Ahead of its Q3 earnings report, Morningstar analysts assess Bank of America's stock, focusing on net interest income outlook, fair value estimate, economic moat, and potential risks. While the stock is considered undervalued based on Morningstar's $35.00 fair value estimate, concerns exist regarding near-term NII deterioration and increased expenses. The bank maintains a wide economic moat due to cost advantages and switching costs despite macroeconomic and regulatory risks.

title: Kazakh fintech Freedom Holding is being investigated by DOJ, SEC, documents show
summary: Freedom Holding, a Nasdaq-listed Kazakh financial firm with a $5 billion market cap, is under investigation by the Justice Department and SEC regarding compliance issues, insider stock moves, and an offshore affiliate tied to sanctioned individuals. The scrutiny intensified following critical reports from short sellers Hindenburg Research and Citron Research. The probes are examining the firm's internal controls, offshore operations, and CEO Timur Turlov's claims about providing U.S. IPO access to its largely Russian client base.

title: Bank of America Corp. stock underperforms Tuesday when compared to competitors
summary: Bank of America Corp. stock (BAC) fell by 2.96% on Tuesday, closing at $25.91. This underperformance occurred on a day when the broader market also saw declines, with the S&P 500 Index dropping 1.37% and the Dow Jones Industrial Average falling 1.29%. This marks the stock's third consecutive day of losses.

title: Bank of America Whistleblower Lawsuit Dismissed by Judge
summary: A whistleblower lawsuit against Bank of America, alleging fraudulent reporting in its "Down Payment Grant Program" to receive government funding, has been dismissed with prejudice by a U.S. District Court judge. The lawsuit, filed by Realtor Scott Johnston, claimed BofA falsely reported providing no financial assistance while actually providing grants to low-to-moderate income households. The government declined to intervene in the case.

title: Capture High Yields From Long-Term Treasuries With XTEN
summary: Many fixed income investors are looking to capture higher yields from long-term U.S. Treasury bonds, which are at their highest levels since October 2007. The BondBloxx Bloomberg Ten Year Target Duration US Treasury ETF (XTEN) offers a solution by targeting U.S. Treasury securities with an average duration of roughly 10 years and an expense ratio of 0.08%. BondBloxx, a provider of precision fixed income ETFs, has seen significant demand for its Treasury bond offerings, crossing $2 billion in assets, as these bonds provide an attractive alternative to cash.

title: Navy Federal lands DOD contract to run branches, ATMs at overseas military bases
summary: Navy Federal Credit Union has secured a contract with the Department of Defense to operate branches and ATMs at overseas military bases, replacing Bank of America after its 40-year tenure. This marks a significant win for the world's largest credit union, further entrenching its presence among service members and their families. The change in contract highlights a shift in banking services available to the military community abroad.

title: BrightSpring Refiles to Go Public, Zeros in on $1 Billion Goal
summary: BrightSpring Health Services has refiled for an initial public offering (IPO) with a target of raising $1 billion, significantly higher than its previous attempt. The company, backed by KKR & Co., plans to launch trading on the NASDAQ by the end of the year, with Goldman Sachs and KKR's capital markets division as lead bookrunners. This move follows a period of M&A activity and reflects potential growth opportunities in the home health sector.

title: PayPal, USPS, Capital One, Bank of America, and MORE: Top Scams of the Week
summary: This article details prevalent phishing scams impersonating trusted brands like PayPal, USPS, Capital One, Bank of America, and Choice Bank. It provides examples of fake emails and text messages, highlighting red flags such as suspicious sender addresses and malicious links. The article also offers tips to stay safe online and recommends security tools from Trend Micro.

title: Bank of America Is Moving to Same Dallas Neighborhood as Goldman
summary: Bank of America (BAC) is relocating its Dallas operations to a new skyscraper within a half-mile of Goldman Sachs Group Inc.'s (GS) developing hub. The move entails Bank of America leasing approximately half of a 30-story building overlooking Klyde Warren Park, a significant urban green space in Dallas. This positions both banking giants in close proximity within the same Dallas neighborhood.

title: BofA Names New Co-Heads for North America Industrials Banking
summary: Bank of America Corp. has appointed Loli Wu and Bill Young as the new co-heads of its North America industrials investment-banking unit. They will be responsible for expanding the business in both the US and Canada. Wu will continue leading transportation and infrastructure, while Young will remain co-head of diversified and advanced industrials investment banking.

title: Credit Suisse, BofA debt swaps under scrutiny
summary: Debt-for-nature swaps arranged by Credit Suisse and Bank of America are under renewed scrutiny after the International Capital Market Association (ICMA) issued new labeling guidelines. These "blue bonds" were sold to finance marine conservation pledges but are now facing questions regarding their classification, as ICMA indicates their structure differs from standard blue bond definitions. The practice has raised concerns about "bluewashing" and "genuine confusion around terminology" in the nascent sustainable debt market, though some bankers are starting to adjust their labeling approach.

title: ATM receipt shows what a $100 million bank account balance looks like
summary: An ATM receipt found in East Hampton Village revealed a bank account balance of nearly $100 million. The receipt, found at a Capital One Bank ATM, showed a balance of $99,864,731.94, with a $2.75 withdrawal fee and a $400 withdrawal in June 2011. Hedge-fund manager David Tepper was identified as the possible account holder by Dealbreaker, but he denied the claims, stating he would never keep such a large sum in a low-yielding savings account.

title: Citigroup CEO sets sweeping management changes, job cuts
summary: Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser announced a major reorganization to streamline the bank, giving her more direct control by having the heads of five divisions report directly to her. This restructuring will eliminate layers of management and regional leadership roles, leading to job cuts, in an effort to improve profits and boost the company's stock price, which has lagged peers. Despite a short-term stock bump, analysts note that the bank's valuation remains low compared to competitors, indicating investors are waiting for tangible results from these changes.

title: Broadridge Appoints Paul Simpson as Vice Chairman of Global Technology and Operations Business
summary: Broadridge Financial Solutions, Inc. (NYSE: BR) has appointed Paul Simpson as Vice Chairman of its Global Technology and Operations (GTO) business. In this new role, Simpson will leverage his three decades of financial services experience to enhance client focus and accelerate go-to-market initiatives for Broadridge's capital markets and wealth management businesses. He previously served as Global Banking & Markets Operations and Regions Executive for Bank of America.

title: Contact - The Lethbridge Herald - News and Sports from around Lethbridge
summary: First Trust Advisors L.P. announced the monthly distribution for the First Trust Income Opportunities ETF (FCEF). The distribution amount is $0.1175 per share, with an expected ex-dividend date of September 12, 2023. The article also details the investment objectives, risks, charges, and expenses associated with investing in the Fund, advising potential investors to read the prospectus carefully.

title: Retiring Bank of America executive Cathy Bessant hired as CEO of Foundation For The Carolinas in Charlotte
summary: Cathy Bessant, a retiring Bank of America executive, has been hired as the new CEO of Foundation For The Carolinas. She will depart Bank of America at the end of December and begin her new role in January. The Foundation for the Carolinas is located in uptown Charlotte.

title: Bank of America most favored for activism defense in first half of 2023, LSEG data show
summary: Bank of America has emerged as the top financial adviser for companies facing activist investors in the first half of 2023, advising on 33 campaigns, according to LSEG data. This marks a significant jump from its fifth-place ranking a year ago, surpassing rivals like Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan Chase. Sidley Austin remained the leading law firm for corporations in defense, while Olshan Frome Wolosky was the busiest working for activists.

title: Dutch Bros Inc. Announces Proposed Public Offering of Class A Common Stock
summary: Dutch Bros Inc. announced a proposed underwritten public offering of $300 million of its Class A Common Stock, with an option for underwriters to purchase an additional $45 million. The offering is subject to market conditions and is being made pursuant to an automatic shelf registration statement filed with the SEC. BofA Securities, J.P. Morgan Securities LLC, and Jefferies LLC are acting as lead book-running managers.

title: $4.5B private-banking team from Bank of America leaves for Florida company Fidelis Capital
summary: A wealth management team managing $4.5 billion has departed Bank of America Private Bank to join Fidelis Capital, a Tampa, Florida-based firm. Fidelis Capital was established in 2022 by former advisors from Wells Fargo and Bank of America.

title: Why Analysts Say GE's Healthcare Spinoff Has $20 Upside
summary: GE HealthCare Technologies Inc. (NASDAQ: GEHC) is showing impressive growth following its spin-off from General Electric, with first-half revenue and EPS up 8% and 22% year-over-year, respectively. Despite a 14% stock slide after a secondary offering, Wall Street analysts maintain a bullish outlook, with a consensus target suggesting a $20 upside. The company's growth strategy focuses on acquisitions, precision medicine, and digital care, including significant investments in AI, positioning it for continued strong financial performance.

title: Citigroup’s Mason tops list of highest-paid bank CFOs
summary: Citigroup Inc. CFO Mark Mason was the highest-paid finance chief in the U.S. banking industry in 2022, earning $15 million, according to an S&P Global Market study. This compensation represents a 12.6% increase from 2021, and he outpaced Wells Fargo CFO Michael Santomassimo and Bank of America's Alastair Borthwick. The article details the compensation packages of these top CFOs and discusses the banking industry's performance in 2022 amidst geopolitical and economic turmoil.

title: Bay Street Likely To Open On Mixed Note; Bank Stocks In Focus
summary: Bay Street is expected to open on a mixed note, influenced by commodity prices and European markets, with investor caution ahead of economic data. Bank of Montreal and Bank of Nova Scotia reported their third-quarter earnings, showing varied results compared to the previous year. Additionally, CAE Inc. secured a 10-year pilot training deal with Batik Air, while global markets reacted to Chinese stimulus and Fed pause hopes.

title: Boston Scientific Takes the Lead in Pulsed Field Ablation Race
summary: Boston Scientific has taken a significant lead in the pulsed field ablation (PFA) market with positive 12-month results from its ADVENT trial for the Farapulse PFA system. Although the device showed non-inferiority to thermal ablation, analysts anticipate FDA approval in 2024, giving Boston Scientific a potential marketing advantage over competitors like Medtronic and Johnson & Johnson in the growing AF treatment market.

title: Citigroup (C) Launches Relationship Tiers, Simplifies Banking
summary: Citigroup (C) has launched new Relationship Tiers to simplify banking and enhance customer experience, retiring old account packages. These tiers are determined by a customer's Combined Average Monthly Balance from eligible deposit and investment accounts, unlocking enhanced benefits such as waived fees and professional financial planning. The initiative aims to improve customer satisfaction and is part of Citi's broader business streamlining efforts, which include exiting consumer banking in several markets.

title: Bank of America refinances $500M of Gabon’s sovereign debt as part of ocean conservation project
summary: Bank of America has refinanced $500 million of Gabon's sovereign debt as part of a debt-for-nature transaction, the first of its kind in Continental Africa. This initiative will enable Gabon to contribute $125 million to a 15-year ocean conservation project, supporting its goal to protect 30% of its natural environments by 2030. The project is managed by The Nature Conservancy and backed by political risk insurance from the U.S. International Development Finance Corp.

title: Pasadena’s East West Bancorp Earns Top Spot in 2023 Bank Director Performance Ranking
summary: Pasadena-based East West Bancorp, Inc. has been recognized as the No. 1 Performing Bank in Bank Director’s 2023 RankingBanking study for banks with $50 billion and above in assets. This marks a continued trend of strong performance, following its recognition as Best Board in 2022 and No. 1 Performing Bank in 2021. The achievements highlight the company's strong balance sheet, financial performance, and dedicated team.

title: BofA’s Warning of a ‘5% World’ Sinks in With Yields Pushing Higher
authors: Michael MacKenzie and Liz Capo McCormick
summary: Bond traders globally are acknowledging a shift away from historically low yields, a trend underscored by Bank of America's "5% World" warning. This comes as the resilient US economy, increasing debt, and expectations of sustained high interest rates by the Federal Reserve push long-dated Treasury yields to decade-plus highs. BlackRock's Boivin observes a significant repricing in the longest-maturity debt.

title: Bank of America senior exec says branches are still important in digital age - San Francisco Business Times
summary: Aron Levine, President of Preferred Banking at Bank of America, emphasized the continued importance of physical branches in the digital age, even as the bank expands into new markets. This perspective was shared during an event at one of Bank of America's historic branches in San Francisco. The article highlights how a senior executive views the role of traditional banking centers amidst ongoing technological advancements.

title: With first-of-its-kind PTC transfer, AEP sells 1.3 GW of unregulated renewables to Invenergy-led group
summary: American Electric Power (AEP) sold its 1,365-MW unregulated renewable energy portfolio to IRG Acquisition Holdings, a group led by Invenergy, for $1.5 billion. The deal included a $580 million federal production tax credit transfer with Bank of America Securities, marking the first large-scale transferability transaction since the Inflation Reduction Act in 2022. This sale aligns with AEP's strategy to focus on regulated operations and streamline its business.

title: Markets News, Aug. 15, 2023: Dow Drops More Than 350 Points on U.S. Banking Concerns, Weakening Chinese Economy
summary: U.S. stocks, including the Dow, S&P 500, and Nasdaq, fell due to concerns over the creditworthiness of U.S. banks, a potential downgrade by Fitch Ratings, and a weakening Chinese economy. The Chinese central bank cut a key interest rate, while the U.K. saw record wage growth. Individual stock movers included Amgen and Home Depot rising, while JPMorgan Chase, American Express, Goldman Sachs, Dow Inc., Caterpillar, 3M, Chevron, and Walt Disney Co. declined.

title: Inside Bank of America's rapid growth since entering the Colorado market
summary: Bank of America has significantly expanded its footprint in Colorado since 2014, adding numerous financial centers across the state. This growth highlights the North Carolina-based bank's strategy to increase its presence in the Colorado market. The article provides a preview of the number of new locations added by the bank.

title: Wheatland Bank to be acquired by Glacier Bancorp
summary: Wheatland Bank, with a branch in Pasco, is slated to be acquired by Glacier Bancorp, pending approval from shareholders and banking regulators, with an expected completion in Q4 2023. This acquisition marks Glacier's 25th since 2000, creating a combined division with $1.6 billion in assets and 23 branches under the leadership of Wheatland's current CEO, Susan Horton. The move will significantly expand Glacier's presence in eastern and central Washington.

title: Moodys downgrades ten US banks - here's what it means for you
summary: Moody's has downgraded the credit ratings of ten regional US banks and placed six others under review, citing the impact of higher interest rates on the banking system. This decision follows Fitch Ratings' downgrade of the US's long-term AAA rating. The article explains what this means for customers, emphasizing that while downgrades can signal increased risk, experts advise speaking directly with banks and spreading assets to mitigate exposure.

title: S&P Gains and Losses Today: Bank Stocks Tumble on Moody's Downgrade
summary: The S&P 500 fell 0.4% on August 8, 2023, primarily due to Moody's downgrades of several small and medium-sized banks and a warning about larger institutions. Key decliners included financial stocks like Goldman Sachs, Bank of America, and Citigroup, as well as International Flavors & Fragrances which dramatically cut its guidance. Conversely, Eli Lilly surged after strong quarterly results and optimism surrounding its diabetes drug Mounjaro for obesity treatment.

title: BofA holds No. 1 position in corporate bond underwriting, with Wells Fargo moving up to No. 2 as the overall pie shrinks
summary: BofA Securities retained its top position in corporate bond underwriting as of August 1, 2023, despite a significant decline in its handled dollar volume compared to the previous year. Wells Fargo Securities LLC ascended to the second spot, surpassing JPMorgan Chase & Co. The overall U.S. corporate debt offerings for the year-to-date experienced a sharp decrease from $137.5 billion to $65.8 billion, reflecting a slowdown in deal-making.

title: Bank of America Reversed Recession Call on Strong Jobs and Spending, CEO Says
summary: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan announced the firm reversed its recession prediction due to robust job growth and strong consumer spending. Moynihan noted that consumers are employed and actively spending, leading to a "pretty good equilibrium." He also cautioned about potential risks associated with proposed capital rules for large banks.

title: Credit Suisse: Michael Klein, the Plumber
summary: Michael Klein, a former Credit Suisse board member, is facing challenges after the collapse of Credit Suisse and the subsequent evaporation of the CS First Boston spinoff deal with UBS. His other ventures, particularly in Special Purpose Acquisition Companies (Spacs), are also experiencing a slowdown. Despite these setbacks, Klein continues to pursue deals, including the acquisition of CorpAcq through his Spac and a venture with OpenAI founder Sam Altman involving a nuclear fission company.

title: Bank of America, Lowe's, Nucor and Honeywell are only North Carolina companies on Fortune Global 500 list
summary: Bank of America, Lowe's, Nucor, and Honeywell are the only four North Carolina companies featured on Fortune's annual Global 500 list. All four of these companies are based in the Charlotte area. The article highlights their presence on this prestigious international ranking.

title: Charles Munger – Top 10 Holdings – Latest 13F
summary: This article details Charles Munger's top 10 holdings based on his latest 13F-HR filing as of June 30, 2023. His portfolio has a market value of over $163 million with a 100% concentration in his top holdings. The list includes Wells Fargo & Co., Bank of America Corp, Alibaba Group Holding Ltd, and US Bancorp.

title: Bank of America, American Express Hit with Class Actions Over Allegedly Illegal Interest Rate Charges
summary: Bank of America and American Express are facing class action lawsuits alleging they unlawfully imposed excessive interest rates on cardholders since March 2022. The lawsuits claim the banks violated the Truth in Lending Act and the CARD Act by raising rates without 45 days' notice and applying increases retroactively to existing balances, despite a variable rate exception. Plaintiffs argue the banks used the rising prime rate as an excuse for these illegal charges, which have generated significant profits.

title: Investors Move Into Invesco’s Bank ETF as Sector Rallies
summary: Invesco's KBW Bank ETF (KBWB) has seen significant inflows, with $197 million in net flows over a week and $546 million over four weeks, driven by a rebound in the banking sector after positive second-quarter earnings. The ETF's top holdings, including Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase, have outperformed the S&P 500. This inflow marks a recovery in investor interest after substantial outflows during the banking crisis in March.

title: Rithm Capital To Acquire Sculptor Capital Management
summary: Rithm Capital Corp. announced its definitive agreement to acquire Sculptor Capital Management Inc. for approximately $639 million, including $11.15 per Class A share. This acquisition aims to significantly expand Rithm's alternative asset management capabilities, combining Sculptor's $34 billion AUM with Rithm's capital to create a world-class asset management business. Sculptor will operate as a subsidiary of Rithm, with its current leadership remaining in place, and the transaction is expected to close in Q4 2023.

title: Baker Bros. Advisors Now Owns 19.99% of Neoleukin Therapeutics
summary: Baker Bros. Advisors has increased its stake in Neoleukin Therapeutics Inc. (NLTX) to 19.99%, owning 10.04 million shares, a significant jump from their previous 9.99% ownership in 2020. This move suggests a bullish outlook, supported by an analyst price forecast predicting a 107.04% upside for the company. Despite some institutional selling, other major shareholders like Lynx1 Capital Management and Redmile Group have also increased their positions.

title: White & Case Advises CION Investment Corporation on the Purchase of Substantially All Assets of David's Bridal
summary: White & Case LLP advised CION Investment Corporation on its acquisition of substantially all assets of David's Bridal. This transaction will allow David's Bridal to continue operations at up to 195 stores, preserving 7,000 jobs, with CION investing US$20 million for future growth. Additionally, Bank of America will provide a US$50 million revolving credit facility and a US$20 million term loan facility to enhance financial flexibility.

title: HDFC Merger Makes Corporate History
summary: The merger between India's largest mortgage lender, Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC), and its subsidiary HDFC Bank resulted in the creation of the world's fourth-largest bank. This $40 billion all-stock merger also made the combined entity the most valuable Indian company, boasting an approximately $157 billion market capitalization. The integration aims to leverage extensive distribution networks for cross-selling and provide mortgages to HDFC Bank customers.

title: Bank of America Auto Trust 2023-1 raises $1.17 billion in ABS
summary: Bank of America has launched its first auto loan securitization since 2012, raising $1.17 billion through the Bank of America Auto Trust (BAAT) 2023-1. The notes are backed by a pool of new and used automobile and light truck loans, with favorable characteristics such as a strong weighted-average FICO score of 792. While the initial hard credit enhancement is lower compared to prior transactions, Fitch Ratings and Moody's Investors Service have issued high provisional ratings for the notes.

title: Dow Theory Letters - First Trust Dynamic Europe Equity Income Fund Declares its Monthly Common Share Distribution of $0.07 Per Share for August
authors: First Trust Dynamic Europe Equity Income Fund
summary: The First Trust Dynamic Europe Equity Income Fund (NYSE: FDEU) has announced a monthly common share distribution of $0.07 per share for August, payable on August 15, 2023. The Fund operates under a managed distribution policy, allowing it to distribute long-term capital gains more frequently. It primarily seeks to provide a high level of current income and capital appreciation by investing in European equity securities and utilizing a dynamic currency hedging process.

title: Ramsay, Sime Darby tap Bank of America, Deutsche Bank to sell $1.3 billion Asia healthcare venture
summary: Australia's Ramsay Health Care and Malaysia's Sime Darby have hired Bank of America and Deutsche Bank to sell their $1.3 billion healthcare joint venture, Ramsay Sime Darby Health Care. The sale could launch within two months and would be the largest healthcare deal in Southeast Asia since 2019, reflecting growing investor interest in the sector despite tough economic conditions. An earlier attempt to sell the joint venture to IHH Healthcare fell through last year.

title: 5%대 금리 내건 'SOFR ETF', 달러 급락에 수익률 '마이너스'
summary: SOFR ETFS, which garnered hundreds of billions of won by promising over 5% interest and exchange rate gains from a strong dollar, have recorded losses recently due to the sudden depreciation of the dollar. Despite originally targeting a strong dollar, the shift in the US Federal Reserve's monetary policy outlook has caused the dollar's value to drop, leading to 3-4% losses for these ETFs. However, asset management companies suggest the risk is minimal for investors holding dollars, as the SOFR benchmark for dollar-denominated investments has never shown a negative return.

title: Deal Diary: BofA, Smith Anderson Work With First Citizens on SVB
summary: First Citizens BancShares Inc. engaged Smith Anderson and Bank of America Securities Inc. for legal and financial advice, respectively, on its agreement to acquire deposits and loans from Silicon Valley Bridge Bank NA from the FDIC. The FDIC, in turn, received financial advice from Piper Sandler Cos. and Guggenheim Partners LLC for the deal. The transaction involved First Citizens buying approximately $72 billion of the bridge bank’s assets at a discount and assuming $110 billion in assets, $56 billion in deposits, and $72 billion in loans.

title: Bank of America execs talk regulatory uncertainty, recent settlement and more on Q2 earnings call
summary: Bank of America executives discussed their second-quarter earnings, emphasizing their strong capital position despite anticipated higher capital requirements for the banking industry. They also addressed recent expenses and a settlement related to regulatory violations.

title: BofA profit surges on interest income, surprise investment banking gain
summary: Bank of America (BAC.N) reported a second-quarter profit that beat Wall Street estimates, driven by increased interest income from loan payments and better-than-expected investment banking and trading performance. The bank projected an 8% increase in net interest income for the year, and its stock surged 4.2% following the positive results, despite growing pressure on its net interest margin. Investment banking net income surged 76%, and sales and trading revenue also outperformed expectations with a 3% increase.

title: Bank of America tops analysts’ expectations amid higher interest rates
summary: Bank of America (BAC) reported second-quarter earnings that surpassed Wall Street expectations, with 88 cents per share against an anticipated 84 cents, and revenue of $25.33 billion exceeding the expected $25.05 billion. The strong performance was driven by higher interest income and robust Wall Street operations, including an 18% jump in fixed income trading revenue. CEO Brian Moynihan noted a healthy U.S. economy and resilient job market contributing to the bank's organic growth.

title: BAC Earnings: Key quarterly highlights from Bank of America’s Q2 2023 financial results
summary: Bank of America (NYSE: BAC) reported strong Q2 2023 earnings, with revenue increasing by 11% to $25.2 billion and net income rising 19% to $7.4 billion, or $0.88 per share, both beating expectations. Average loan balances grew 3%, while deposit balances saw a 7% decrease.

title: Bank of America surpasses analysts' expectations as Q2 earnings rise on higher interest rates
summary: Bank of America reported soaring second-quarter earnings, surpassing analysts' expectations due to a rise in both revenue and profit. This performance was driven by higher interest rates. The financial institution's strong Q2 results come amidst broader trends affecting the banking sector.

title: With Q2 Earnings Underway, Keep an Eye on the Overnight Session
summary: As Q2 earnings season begins, investors should pay close attention to the overnight trading session, which significantly impacts stock performance due to key macro and earnings reports released before market open. Many major companies announce their quarterly results during this time, and strong earnings typically lead to stock price increases. The NightShares 500 1x/1.5x ETF (NSPL) is highlighted as a way for investors to gain leveraged exposure to these overnight returns.

title: David’s Bridal will keep nearly 200 stores open under new ownership
summary: David's Bridal will keep nearly 200 stores open and preserve 7,000 jobs following the approval of its sale to asset management firm Cion Investment Corp. Cion has invested $20 million into the business, and Bank of America will provide additional financing, reducing the retailer's debt significantly. This acquisition follows David's Bridal's bankruptcy filing in April and an earlier attempt to sell the company.

title: Bank of America to pay over $250 million over junk fees, other issues
summary: Bank of America has been ordered to pay over $250 million in fines and compensation for systematically double-charging customers fees, withholding credit card perks, and opening unauthorized accounts. This settlement includes $100 million in restitution for harmed consumers and $150 million in civil penalties to the CFPB and OCC, addressing violations that began in 2012. Additionally, Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith, a financial advisory arm of Bank of America, agreed to pay $12 million in penalties for failing to file hundreds of suspicious activity reports.

title: Bank of America to Pay $250 Million to Settle US ‘Junk Fee’ Case
summary: Bank of America Corp. has agreed to pay $250 million ($150 million in fines and $100 million to customers) to settle charges of improperly charging fees, withholding rewards, and opening unauthorized credit-card accounts. The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau cited the bank for "systematically double-dipping on fees" and failing to deliver promised credit-card bonuses. Additionally, the bank enrolled customers for cards without their knowledge or authorization.

title: Bank of America ordered to pay $250 million for fake accounts, junk fees and withheld credit-card rewards
summary: Bank of America has been ordered to pay a total of $250 million for illegally charging junk fees, withholding credit-card rewards, and opening fake accounts, as announced by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau. Over $100 million of this total will go to consumers harmed by these activities. The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency also stated that the bank's practice of "double-dipping on fees" was illegal.

title: Bank of America fined $150 million for consumer abuses including fake accounts, bogus fees
summary: Bank of America has been fined $150 million by the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency for engaging in deceptive practices. These practices include charging multiple overdraft fees for single transactions, failing to issue credit card rewards properly, and opening unauthorized card accounts for customers. The bank is also required to pay $80.4 million in redress to customers, in addition to $23 million already paid for credit card award denials.

title: Sonida Senior Living Defaults on Fannie Mae Debt
summary: Sonida Senior Living has defaulted on a $427 million loan package from Fannie Mae, leading to a forbearance agreement covering more than half of its properties. The Dallas-based operator will make a $5 million payment and received loan extensions on 18 properties, with Conversant Capital providing an additional $13.5 million equity investment as a guarantee. Sonida is also negotiating to resolve "non-compliance" on $72 million in debt with Protective Life Insurance, following $54 million in losses in 2022.

title: BorgWarner spins off aftermarket business into PHINIA
summary: BorgWarner has successfully spun off its Fuel Systems and Aftermarket segments into a new, separate publicly-traded company named PHINIA, completing a key pillar of its "Charging Forward" strategy to accelerate electrification. This strategic move allows both BorgWarner and PHINIA to focus on their respective business strategies, with BorgWarner aiming for over $10 billion in eProduct revenue by 2027. The spin-off involved financial advisors Evercore and BofA Securities, Inc., and legal advisors Foley & Lardner LLP and Freshfields Bruckhaus Deringer.

title: PlainsCapital Bank Data Breach Confirmed, 16M Users At Risk
summary: PlainsCapital Bank, a subsidiary of Hilltop Holdings Inc., confirmed a data breach linked to the MOVEit vulnerability, potentially exposing the personal information of over 16 million individuals. The compromised data includes sensitive customer details such as social security and account numbers, although the bank states there's no evidence of identity theft or fraudulent activity detected so far. The Clop ransomware group exploited the MOVEit vulnerability, leading to a series of data breaches impacting numerous companies.

title: India's HDFC Bank completes $40 billion takeover of the country's largest mortgage lender. Here’s what it means
summary: India's largest private lender HDFC Bank has completed its $40 billion merger with Housing Development Finance Corporation, the country's biggest mortgage lender. This merger creates the world's fourth largest bank by market cap and is expected to drive significant growth and client expansion through synergies like lower funding costs and cross-selling opportunities. The deal also positions the new entity for potential inclusion in the MSCI Emerging Market Index, attracting more global investors.

title: Retirement People Moves
summary: This article details several significant personnel changes in the retirement and financial services industry. Key moves include Dee Sawyer succeeding Robert Higginbotham as Head of Global Distribution at T. Rowe Price, Craig Korkow becoming President of Bank of America Omaha, Kathryn Calcagno joining Northern Trust as a Senior Wealth Strategist, and promotions at Lincoln Financial Group and board changes at the Insured Retirement Institute. Ray Bellucci also takes on an expanded role at TIAA Retirement Solutions.

title: GSR II Meteora Acquisition Corp. (GSRM) Shareholders Approve Bitcoin Depot Deal
summary: GSR II Meteora Acquisition Corp. (GSRM) shareholders have approved the combination with Bitcoin Depot, with a final redemption rate of about 89%, leaving approximately $35 million in trust. The deal was bolstered by an additional $50 million in new funding through a PIPE and non-redemption agreements, exceeding the $8 million minimum cash condition. Bitcoin Depot, an Atlanta-based company with 6,440 ATM and retail payment locations, will merge in a $755 million combination initially announced in August 2022.

title: CFO working capital series
summary: This series by CFO and The Hackett Group provides an exclusive deep dive into annual working capital findings, benchmarking the performance of the 1,000 largest U.S. companies. It tracks key metrics like cash conversion cycle, days sales outstanding, days payable outstanding, and days inventory outstanding. The articles within the series analyze the factors influencing these results and the challenges organizations encounter in managing receivables, inventory, and payables to optimize liquidity.

title: Agree Realty Announces $350 Million 5.5-Year Term Loan
summary: Agree Realty Corporation announced it has secured commitments for an unsecured $350 million 5.5-year term loan. The company anticipates the interest rate on the loan to be fixed at 4.52% due to forward starting swaps. This financing bolsters Agree Realty's balance sheet and fits well into their debt maturity schedule, with no material debt maturities until 2028.

title: News | Bank of America To Expand Into Nine New US Markets by 2026
summary: Bank of America is expanding its financial center network by opening 55 new branches in 2023 and entering nine new U.S. markets over the next four years, including Nebraska, Wisconsin, Alabama, and Louisiana. This expansion includes optimizing its network, renovating existing centers, and increasing its community banking centers, aiming to serve clients with both digital and in-person banking needs. The move positions Bank of America to compete with JPMorgan Chase in branch presence across the country.

title: Frost Bank plans hiring spree, new branches in Austin
summary: Frost Bank plans to significantly expand its presence in the Austin area by roughly doubling its 17 financial centers and hiring over a hundred new employees by 2026. The bank, which last year was a top deposit holder in the region, aims to be the "best" bank rather than the biggest, emphasizing its strategy amidst recent banking challenges.

title: Bank of America to enter Wisconsin, Alabama, Louisiana and Nebraska as part of expansion plans
summary: Bank of America announced plans on June 27 to expand its presence by entering nine new markets by 2026, including opening new branches in four additional U.S. states: Wisconsin, Alabama, Louisiana, and Nebraska. This expansion aims to increase the bank's national footprint.

title: ‘Bitcoin market has matured’: WisdomTree, Invesco file for spot ETFs
summary: Investment firms Invesco and WisdomTree have refiled applications for spot bitcoin exchange-traded funds (ETFs) with the SEC, following previous rejections. Their renewed efforts come shortly after BlackRock also made a filing for a similar product. WisdomTree argues that the bitcoin market has matured to a level of efficiency comparable to established global equity, fixed income, and commodity markets.

title: Customers Bank Buys $631M Venture Loan Portfolio from FDIC
summary: Customers Bank has acquired a $631 million venture loan portfolio from the FDIC, along with 30 staff members who previously managed these loans for Signature Bank. This acquisition expands Customers Bank's venture banking services into new regions and is expected to improve its liquidity profile through the addition of low-cost, core deposits. The deal is part of the FDIC's larger sale of assets from the collapsed Signature Bank and Silicon Valley Bank.

title: This Generation's Franklin Income Strategy
summary: Franklin Templeton has launched the Franklin Income Focus ETF (INCM), an ETF version of its long-standing Franklin Income mutual fund, which has a nearly 75-year history of providing income from equity and fixed income securities. The new ETF follows the same investment philosophy and team but leverages the ETF structure's liquidity and transparency. This move reflects a growing demand for active management within the ETF framework, particularly in fixed income.

title: What Is Racial Justice Investing & Why Should You Consider It?
summary: Racial justice investing is a method of socially responsible investing (SRI) that focuses on companies actively supporting racial justice for Black, Indigenous, and People of Colour (BIPOC) communities. This approach allows investors to make a positive social impact while diversifying their portfolios, addressing issues such as racial equality in management, gun control, prison reform, and police reform. Investors can participate by directly investing in BIPOC-owned businesses, selecting companies with strong racial justice policies, or utilizing specialized ETFs and robo-advisors.

title: Inside The Global 2000: JPMorgan Is Again The World’s Largest Company As Berkshire Hathaway Falls
summary: JPMorgan Chase has reclaimed its position as the world's largest company on the Forbes Global 2000 list, driven by widening net interest margins and its role in stabilizing the banking sector. Meanwhile, Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway fell significantly in rank due to investment portfolio declines, despite strong operating profits. The article highlights the increased presence of U.S. companies on the list, contrasting with China's thinning ranks, and notes the significant market value growth of top U.S. stocks over the last decade.

title: El Itaú en "negociaciones preliminares" con el Macro
summary: Banco Itaú confirmed it is in preliminary negotiations with Banco Macro to sell its operations in Argentina. Both banks have issued statements acknowledging the discussions but emphasizing that no binding agreement has been signed yet. This potential acquisition highlights significant movement in the local banking sector, with Macro looking to expand its already extensive network.

title: MultiPlan Acquires Leading Healthcare Data and Analytics Firm Benefits Science LLC
summary: MultiPlan Corporation has acquired Benefits Science LLC (BST), a healthcare data and advanced analytics company. This acquisition aims to accelerate MultiPlan's new Data & Decision Science service line, combining its extensive claims data and industry experience with BST's advanced analytics, machine learning, and AI capabilities. The integration will provide customers with cutting-edge solutions to manage costs, improve outcomes, and optimize decision-making across various healthcare markets.

title: Hungary and the EU: A deepening divide
summary: Hungary's relationship with the European Union is increasingly strained due to rule-of-law disputes and differing views on issues like migration and the Ukraine war. While most Hungarians still favor EU membership, declining support and intensifying sanctions from Brussels are putting pressure on the Orban government. The article explores the economic ties, historical context, and current challenges that define this deepening divide, with scenarios suggesting potential future developments.

title: Bank of the West meets BMO in the Valley as $16.3B deal closes
summary: Toronto-based BMO Financial Group has completed its $16.3 billion acquisition of San Francisco-based Bank of the West, expanding its presence in the western U.S. and Central Valley. The deal, which brings nearly 1.8 million new customers and 9,300 employees to BMO, is resulting in Bank of the West branches being rebranded, with system conversion expected by September.

title: 3 EV Stocks That Are Poised to Explode in 2023
summary: The electric vehicle market is rapidly expanding, driven by increased sales and environmental goals. This article identifies three key investment opportunities for EV growth: Albemarle (ALB) for its leading position in lithium production, Lithium Americas (LAC) for its development of North America's largest lithium mine, and the Amplify Lithium & Battery Technology ETF (BATT) for diversified exposure to the lithium and battery technology sector. These stocks are positioned to benefit from the growing demand for lithium and EV adoption.

title: Bank failures make construction loans even more challenging
summary: The recent bank failures have exacerbated the difficulty for developers to secure construction loans, particularly impacting the multifamily sector. This tightening of lending standards by regional banks, coupled with higher interest rates from the Federal Reserve, is expected to significantly reduce new apartment construction starts. While private lenders are attempting to fill the void, their capacity is insufficient to fully offset the reduced lending from traditional banks.

title: Morgan Stanley to cut 3,000 more jobs by June: reports
summary: Morgan Stanley is reportedly planning to cut approximately 3,000 additional jobs by the end of June, primarily affecting its investment banking and securities divisions. These layoffs come after a previous cut of 1,600 positions in December and are attributed to subdued investment banking activities and a significant drop in M&A volumes. The moves align with a broader trend of headcount reductions across the financial industry as banks focus on expense management amidst market uncertainty.

title: Bank of America profits grow 15% in Q1, avoids industry crisis
summary: Bank of America (BofA) reported a 15% profit increase in the first quarter of 2023, reaching $8.2 billion, successfully navigating recent industry crises. The bank benefited from clients seeking safety in larger financial institutions following other bank failures, along with higher interest rates. BofA continued to grow client relationships and maintain strong liquidity despite an industry-wide decline in deposits.

title: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan says he sees a relatively mild recession
summary: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan believes the U.S. will experience a relatively mild recession due to lingering stimulus money with consumers and a gradual slowdown in consumer spending. The bank's research team anticipates an annualized GDP contraction of 0.5% to 1% in the next three quarters, followed by positive growth, supported by low unemployment and easing wage inflation. This outlook comes as Bank of America reported strong first-quarter earnings, exceeding expectations, driven by higher interest rates.

title: Amid banking industry turmoil, JPMorgan Chase profits jump 52 percent
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. reported a 52% increase in first-quarter profits, driven by higher interest rates and a significant influx of deposits following the failures of Silicon Valley Bank and Signature Bank. This strong performance, along with solid results from Citigroup and Wells Fargo, suggests stability among major financial institutions despite broader banking turmoil. CEO Jamie Dimon noted the generally healthy U.S. economy but cautioned about looming "storm clouds" given the recent industry unrest.

title: Royal Bank of Canada becomes top financier for fossil fuel industry
summary: Royal Bank of Canada has surpassed JPMorgan as the largest financier of the fossil fuel industry in 2022, providing $42.1bn in funding. Canadian banks are increasingly taking on the role of "lenders of last resort" for carbon-intensive projects, with Canadian banks having provided $862bn to fossil fuel companies since the signing of the Paris Agreement. Despite a 16% drop in overall fossil fuel financing from the world's 60 largest banks in 2022, the report highlights the continued significant role banks play in funding the industry.

title: Canada’s RBC Tops List of Banks Financing the Climate Crisis
summary: A report titled “Banking on Climate Chaos” reveals that Canada’s Royal Bank of Canada (RBC) was the world's worst funder of fossil fuel projects in 2022, providing $42.5 billion, despite its public climate commitments. Globally, the 60 largest banks have funneled $5.5 trillion to fossil fuel companies since the 2015 Paris Agreement, often using loopholes to finance projects like the Coastal GasLink Pipeline and the Willow project. The article highlights a disconnect between banks' greenwashing efforts and their continued substantial financial support for the fossil fuel industry, calling for systemic change to shift capital towards decarbonization.

title: Emerson buys NI Corp. for $8.2B
summary: Emerson has finalized a deal to acquire National Instruments (NI) Corp. for $8.2 billion, bolstering Emerson's automation portfolio with NI's test and measurement offerings. This acquisition aims to enhance Emerson's automation capabilities, diversify its end markets, and provide access to high-growth discrete markets like semiconductor, electric vehicle manufacturing, and aerospace and defense. The transaction, expected to close in the first half of Emerson’s fiscal 2024, will be financed using available cash and liquidity, including proceeds from the sale of Climate Technologies.

title: La presidenta del Banco Santander se reúne con Boric en su fugaz visita a Chile
summary: Ana Botín, president of Banco Santander, made a brief visit to Chile, where she met with President Gabriel Boric and Finance Minister Mario Marcel. Her visit aimed to reaffirm Santander's commitment to Chile and to learn about new initiatives led by Román Blanco, the new CEO in the country since August 2022. Santander's operations in Chile have been highly profitable, with utility reaching $808 million last year, representing about 8% of the holding's global profits.

title: Dan Holland, Cadence Bank
summary: This article profiles Dan Holland, Executive Vice President and head of Cadence Bank’s restaurant group. It highlights his 26 years of banking experience solely focused on the restaurant sector, detailing his previous roles at Regions Bank and Bank of America Merrill Lynch. The piece also mentions his participation as an expert panelist and his educational background.

title: Toronto-Dominion (TD) Becomes Biggest Bank Short With $3.7 Billion on the Line
