summary: Toronto-Dominion Bank has become the most shorted financial institution globally, with short sellers betting approximately $3.7 billion against the bank. This surpasses other major banks like BNP Paribas SA and Bank of America Corp. The increased bearish sentiment is attributed to factors such as merger arbitrage, TD's stake in Schwab, and concerns about the Canadian housing market.

title: PFXF: Preferreds Without Bank Sector Exposure
summary: The article discusses how investors can gain exposure to preferred securities while avoiding the financial sector volatility through the VanEck Preferred Securities ex Financials ETF (PFXF). It highlights that banks dominate the preferreds market (over 75%), posing a risk during banking crises, and explains how PFXF offers diversification, higher historical yields, and lower call risk compared to broad preferreds. The author suggests PFXF as a solution for investors seeking income potential without significant bank exposure.

title: Bank of America Pares Down Wealth Lending Unit
summary: Bank of America is reassigning approximately 200 employees from its wealth lending unit to other roles due to a slowdown in loan demand caused by higher interest rates. This move aims to realign talent with areas of greatest need, with fewer than 10 employees being let go, and salaries remain unchanged for those affected. The redeployment reflects broader industry trends where rising interest rates have cooled lending markets, prompting banks to adjust staffing and lending strategies.

title: Todd Rosenbluth Talks Ultra-Short ETFs, Active Management, and ESG on Bloomberg’s “ETF IQ”
summary: Todd Rosenbluth of VettaFi and Stephanie Pierce of BNY Mellon Investment Management discussed ultra-short ETFs, active management, and ESG funds on Bloomberg’s “ETF IQ.” They highlighted the significant increase in flows into ultra-short bond ETFs and money market funds following the banking crisis, attributing it to advisors seeking alternatives and actively managed solutions amidst market uncertainty. While concerns about the luster of ESG funds were raised, Rosenbluth argued that institutional investor moves were not necessarily a rejection of ESG but rather a shift towards quality investments.

title: Deutsche Bank tumbles as jittery investors seek safer shores
summary: Shares of Deutsche Bank plunged as investors continue to fret over the stability of the banking sector following recent collapses. Despite assurances from policymakers and analysts highlighting Deutsche Bank's strong fundamentals and profitability, concerns persist, leading to a rise in the cost of insuring its bonds and a significant drop in its share value. The turmoil also saw the wiping out of Credit Suisse's AT1 bonds, causing unease in global credit markets.

title: Veteran financials PM: There's 'amazing value' in small banks
summary: Anton Schutz, manager of the $173.6m RMB Mendon Financial Services (RMBLX) fund, sees "amazing value" in small banks despite the recent regional bank selloff. He believes community banks are generally in good shape and should not be equated with larger, more troubled institutions, and attributes some blame for recent bank collapses to regulators. Schutz's fund largely avoids larger regional names and focuses on smaller banks, which he argues have not experienced deposit runs and are seeing inflows.

title: CoolCo rings the bell at NYSE
summary: Bermudian-based Cool Company Ltd, a liquefied natural gas shipping company, celebrated its new listing on the New York Stock Exchange by ringing the closing bell. This move expands CoolCo's investor base, providing US investors access to their attractive dividends and exposure to the growing LNG transportation demand. The dual listing is expected to strengthen the company's financial flexibility and enhance shareholder value.

title: Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway speeds up stock buybacks
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc. has significantly increased its stock buybacks, repurchasing over $1.8 billion worth of its shares this year. This move suggests that Buffett and Charlie Munger believe Berkshire's stock is undervalued, following nearly $60 billion in buybacks between 2020 and 2022. The company sees repurchases as a prudent use of its substantial cash reserves, despite a proposed quadrupling of the 1% excise tax on buybacks.

title: Small banks vs. big banks: Where should you put your money?
summary: Following the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank, this article examines the debate between depositing money in big banks versus small banks. It discusses the pros and cons of each, including product offerings, fees, interest rates, technology, and personalized service, while emphasizing that federal insurance (FDIC or NCUA) makes both equally safe for deposits up to the insured limits. The article also suggests considering credit unions as an alternative.

title: Richard Rosenberg, Who Rejuvenated Bank of America, Dies at 92 (Published 2023)
summary: Richard Rosenberg, former chief executive and chairman of Bank of America, died on March 3 at the age of 92. He is credited with transforming Bank of America into the nation's second-largest bank in the 1990s through a series of strategic acquisitions and innovative marketing strategies, including the introduction of credit cards and product bundling. His leadership helped revive the bank after a period of financial difficulty.

title: BofA Gets More Than $15 Billion in Deposits After SVB Fails
summary: Bank of America Corp. gained over $15 billion in new deposits within days following the collapse of Silicon Valley Bank (SVB), as customers sought refuge in larger financial institutions perceived as "too big to fail." This influx suggests a temporary tempering of investor concerns regarding slowed net interest income growth due to rising interest rates and deposit outflows from smaller banks. Other major banks like JPMorgan Chase & Co., Citigroup Inc., and Wells Fargo & Co. also reportedly experienced significant deposit increases.

title: Ax the ‘woke’ American Express philosophy
summary: This article criticizes American Express for adopting "woke" corporate philosophies and diversity training, particularly since 2020. The author, a self-proclaimed happy AmEx customer, argues that these initiatives, which he describes as advancing Critical Race Theory and creating division, are baffling for a company named "American Express." While some companies have reportedly scaled back similar training, the article questions if AmEx has truly done so, despite the company's significant market value growth under CEO Stephen Squeri.

title: Apollo Commercial Real Estate Finance Closes Two Financing Facilities
summary: Apollo Commercial Real Estate Finance, Inc. (NYSE:ARI) announced the closure of two new financing facilities: a $300.0 million master repurchase agreement with Banco Santander and a $170.0 million revolving credit facility administered by Bank of America. These facilities are intended to diversify funding sources, enhance liquidity, and efficiently finance ARI's commercial mortgage loan origination activities.

title: Blackstone and Sixth Street Complete Sale of Kensington Mortgages to Barclays Bank UK PLC
summary: Blackstone and Sixth Street announced the completion of the sale of Kensington Mortgages to Barclays Bank UK PLC. The specialist mortgage lender, which was jointly owned by Blackstone and Sixth Street since 2015, had originated approximately £1.9 billion of mortgages in the year ended March 31, 2022. The sale, initially announced in June 2022, marks the culmination of Kensington's accelerated growth under their ownership.

title: 'Bond ladders are cool again,' says advisor. Here's how to capture higher Treasury bill yields
summary: Financial experts suggest Treasury bill ladders as a strategy to capture higher yields amidst rising interest rates. This strategy involves staggered T-bill maturities, allowing investors to reinvest at higher rates or reallocate funds. T-bills are considered a relatively safe asset, backed by the U.S. government, offering an attractive alternative to traditional savings options in the current inverted yield curve environment.

title: Arbe Robotics: Buy The Rumour (NASDAQ:ARBE)
summary: Arbe Robotics, a manufacturer of 4D radar-on-a-chip technology, is rumored to be on the verge of landing a substantial high-profile customer, potentially Tesla. Despite a recent stock drop, the company's unique market-leading product, strong funding, and manufacturing partnerships position it for high-volume demand. The latest earnings call featured guest speakers from major tier 1 OEMs, indicating strong industry interest.

title: Pinnacle Financial Partners Again Ranked Among America's Best Banks
summary: Pinnacle Financial Partners has once again been ranked among America's Best Banks by Forbes magazine, securing the No. 27 spot on the list of the country's 100 largest banks. This places Pinnacle higher than any other bank headquartered in Tennessee, North Carolina, South Carolina, or Georgia, with CEO M. Terry Turner attributing the success to the firm's focus on long-term shareholder value and associate engagement. The ranking utilized 10 metrics from S&P Global Market Intelligence, including net interest margin, return on average assets, and revenue growth.

title: Cummins Announces Filing of IPO Registration Statement for Filtration Business
summary: Cummins Inc. announced that its Filtration business, Atmus Filtration Technologies, has filed an S-1 registration statement with the U.S. SEC for a proposed initial public offering (IPO) of newly issued common stock. Atmus Filtration Technologies, founded by Cummins in 1958, plans to list its common stock on the NYSE under the symbol ATMU. The IPO is expected to proceed after SEC review and market conditions are met, with Steph Disher continuing as CEO.

title: Orrick Advises on Ally Financial’s $500 Million Debt Offering
summary: Orrick represented the underwriters in Ally Financial Inc.'s $500 million debt offering, specifically its 6.7% Subordinated Notes due in 2033. This continues Orrick's role as designated underwriters' counsel for Ally's unsecured notes program since May 2019, during which time Ally has offered and sold $6.25 billion in notes. Key individuals from Orrick, including Brett Cooper, Ken Marx, Angela Chen, and Valerie Guillard, advised on the transaction.

title: BlackRock Increases Position in Air Products & Chemicals (APD)
summary: BlackRock has increased its ownership in Air Products & Chemicals (APD) to 6.5%, now holding 14.49 million shares. Analysts project a 4.05% upside for APD shares, with an average price target of $333.50. The company also declared a quarterly dividend of $1.75 per share, representing an annualized yield of 2.18%.

title: Investors jump into European stocks at fastest pace in nearly a year as U.S. equity inflows remain muted: BofA Global
summary: Investors poured $3.4 billion into European stock funds in the week to Wednesday, marking the largest weekly inflows since February 2022. This shift is attributed to slowing inflation in Europe and China's relaxed zero-Covid policies, prompting investors to seek gains outside of U.S. equities, according to BofA Global Research. This represents the second consecutive week of inflows into European funds, following a full year of outflows.

title: Alerus pulls three bankers from American National Bank to grow commercial team
summary: Alerus Financial is expanding its commercial banking team by hiring three bankers from American National Bank, bringing a combined 70 years of experience. Leroy Benson will lead the commercial banking teams in Minnesota and Fargo, N.D. This move aims to grow Alerus' commercial banking presence.

title: Best Buy Canada reportedly laying off 700
summary: Best Buy Canada is reportedly laying off about 700 employees across its retail operations. This move comes as the company aims to support its stores and customers, and follows previous job cuts in the U.S. amid softening consumer demand and a challenging economic outlook for 2023 in the consumer electronics sector.

title: From bear to bull
summary: Most stock markets have shifted from a bear to a bull market, driven by peaking inflation, slower rate hikes, a weaker US dollar, and China's reopening. Major investment banks are bullish on China, and European markets are seen as undervalued and attractive. However, risks like sustained high inflation, higher interest rates, and the war in Ukraine could still impact this nascent global bull market.

title: FDIC, BofA go to court in deposit insurance battle
summary: Bank of America and the FDIC are set to face off in federal court over the FDIC's claim that BofA underpaid its deposit insurance obligations by $1.1 billion. The FDIC alleges BofA improperly miscalculated its exposure after a 2011 rule change, making it appear less risky and resulting in lower payments. Bank of America contends the 2011 rule was unclear and the FDIC violated the Administrative Procedure Act.

title: Capital One cuts 1,100 tech jobs
summary: Capital One has eliminated 1,100 "agile" technology roles, stating that the responsibilities will be integrated into existing engineering and product manager positions as the organization's tech transformation matures. This move follows similar workforce reductions by other major financial institutions like Morgan Stanley, Goldman Sachs, and BNY Mellon. Capital One is offering severance packages and retraining assistance to affected employees while actively hiring for other tech roles.

title: BTG, Bradesco among most exposed to Brazilian retailer Americanas
summary: Brazilian lenders BTG Pactual, Bradesco, and Santander Brasil are identified as the most exposed to the debt of retailer Americanas SA, following the discovery of nearly $4 billion in "accounting inconsistencies" at Americanas. Analysts estimate significant exposure for these banks, with BTG Pactual having the largest proportion of exposure relative to its loans. Americanas is facing potential bankruptcy protection proceedings and is being sued by multiple groups amid a sharp decline in its share price.

title: Bank of America Profit May Decline on Softer Consumer Demand
summary: Bank of America is expected to report a decline in Q4 2022 net income and adjusted earnings per share due to reduced consumer spending and lower investment banking revenues, despite an anticipated rise in overall revenue thanks to higher interest rates. The financial sector is facing a shift from "tailwinds to headwinds" as the Federal Reserve slows rate hikes, potentially impacting banks' net interest income and leading to workforce adjustments. The bank's net interest margin is a key metric, benefiting from past rate hikes, but future growth may be challenged by customer demand for higher deposit rates.

title: El millonario pago que debe hacer Fiduciaria Bancolombia por fallo en su contra
summary: Fiduciaria Bancolombia has been ordered to pay over $1.272 million to 10 individuals and legal entities by the Superintendencia Financiera due to a failed real estate project called "Balsillas de Tolú". The ruling states that the fiduciaria failed to act diligently and verify the economic solvency of the project's developers, leading to the abandonment of the construction. Fiduciaria Bancolombia plans to appeal the decision, asserting it acted according to its fiduciary contract.

title: Large Investors Dipping Their Toes Back in the Bond Markets Again
summary: Large investors are returning to bond markets, favoring debt for the first time in over a decade due to attractive yields resulting from the U.S. Federal Reserve's rate hikes. Bank of America's December survey shows investors are overweight bonds relative to other asset classes. Investors can gain broad-based bond exposure through ETFs like Vanguard Total Bond Market Index Fund ETF Shares (BND) for U.S. debt and Vanguard Total International Bond Index Fund ETF Shares (BNDX) for international diversification.

title: TD Bank to acquire First Horizon
summary: TD Bank Group announced its intent to acquire First Horizon Corporation in an all-cash transaction valued at US$13.4 billion, or US$25.00 per share. This acquisition is set to expand TD's presence in the U.S. Southeast, making its U.S. franchise a top 6 U.S. bank with approximately US$614 billion in assets. TD has committed to retaining First Horizon's client-facing bankers and contributing $40 million to a First Horizon foundation, with no planned branch closures.

title: Billionaire George Kaiser’s Bank Drills Deeper Into the Oil Patch
summary: While many lenders are pulling back from oil-and-gas financing, George Kaiser's BOK Financial is aggressively expanding its market share. The bank was a bookrunner on $2 billion in loans to U.S. oil-and-gas companies in the first quarter, ranking fifth overall, by capitalizing on the improved outlook for energy companies and other banks retreating from the sector. This strategy comes as high oil prices boost energy companies' cash flows, reducing their overall borrowing needs but creating opportunities for lenders willing to engage.

title: Goldman junior bankers are publicly threatening to leave Wall Street for tech as CEO demands full-time return to office
summary: Junior bankers at Goldman Sachs are expressing significant discontent over CEO David Solomon's mandate for a full-time return to the office, publicly threatening to leave for tech companies offering more flexibility. This comes despite increased bonuses and new benefits aimed at retaining talent, as the bank emphasizes an apprenticeship culture and the benefits of in-person collaboration. The move highlights a growing clash between traditional financial institutions' return-to-office policies and employees' desire for hybrid work arrangements.

title: More Subprime Borrowers Are Missing Loan Payments - WSJ
summary: Subprime borrowers in the U.S. are increasingly missing payments on credit cards, car loans, and personal loans, indicating a potential downturn in the previously healthy consumer lending environment. Delinquencies for subprime credit cards and personal loans have been rising for eight consecutive months and are approaching pre-pandemic levels, according to Equifax Inc. This trend suggests that borrowers with limited or troubled credit histories are struggling to keep up with their financial obligations.

title: Asesoramos en la reestructuración de pasivos financieros de San Antonio Internacional S.A. y Servicios Especiales San Antonio S.A.
summary: Bruchou & Funes de Rioja advised a consortium of banks on the financial debt restructuring of San Antonio Internacional S.A. and Servicios Especiales San Antonio S.A., totaling approximately $7 billion. The restructuring involved three distinct transactions, including debt cancellation with a write-off, a syndicated refinancing agreement, and a separate refinancing deal. The firm also provided tax advice, and other legal and financial advisors were involved in the process.

title: KKR to buy 100% stake in SK E&S' Busan City Gas for $561 mn
summary: KKR & Co. is set to acquire a 100% stake in Busan City Gas Co., a subsidiary of SK E&S Co., for 725 billion won ($560.9 million). This deal follows another transaction where SK E&S sold Busan City Gas's property for 632.8 billion won. SK E&S plans to use these proceeds to fund its transition towards eco-friendly energy solutions and green businesses, aiming for a valuation of 35 trillion won by 2035.
source: The Korea Economic Daily Global Edition
source_domain: The Korea Economic Daily Global Edition

title: BofA analysts downgrade Affirm, Discover, Synchrony
summary: Bank of America analysts downgraded Affirm, Discover Financial Services, and Synchrony Financial due to their significant exposure to consumer credit risk and lower-income consumer spending amid rising interest rates and an anticipated economic slowdown. Affirm and Synchrony were downgraded to "neutral," while Discover was downgraded to "underperform." The analysts predict increased credit losses and tighter profit margins for these companies as consumer spending becomes more conservative and unemployment rates potentially rise in 2023.

title: S&P baja la perspectiva a negativa de estable del BCP, BBVA, Scotiabank y Mibanco
summary: S&P Global Ratings revisó a negativa desde estable la perspectiva de cuatro bancos peruanos: BCP, Mibanco, Scotiabank Perú y BBVA Perú, siguiendo la revisión de la perspectiva de Perú. Esta acción se debe al prolongado estancamiento político en Perú que ha limitado la capacidad del gobierno para implementar políticas económicas. S&P señala la vulnerabilidad del país a eventos políticos adversos que podrían afectar la inversión o resultar en malas políticas económicas, impactando el desempeño y la calidad de los activos bancarios.

title: What can still go right for M&T Bank in Connecticut after early stumble
summary: M&T Bank's acquisition of People's United Bank in Connecticut has been met with customer complaints and layoffs, raising questions about its impact on the state. Despite initial struggles, M&T officials, including CEO René Jones, maintain that the bank is committed to long-term investment in Connecticut, following a model of community engagement and economic development seen in its home city of Buffalo, New York. The article explores both the criticisms leveled against M&T and the bank's efforts to rebuild trust and contribute to the local economy.

title: Sea Change
summary: The author, with 53 years in investment, identifies three "sea changes" in the investment world: the shift to risk/return thinking in the 70s, the four-decade decline in interest rates starting in the early 80s, and the current reversal of these trends. The memo details how declining rates fueled investment success and how the current environment of higher inflation and interest rates marks a significant departure from the recent past, necessitating new investment strategies.

title: DFA Lists 2 New ETFs
summary: DFA has launched two new actively managed exchange-traded funds (ETFs) focused on core equity. The DFA U.S. Core Equity ETF and the DFA World ex-U.S. Core Equity ETF aim to provide broad market exposure with a systematic investment approach. These new offerings expand DFA's suite of active ETF products.

title: Exclusive: Morgan Stanley to slash 2022 banker bonuses in Asia by up to half
summary: Morgan Stanley plans to cut investment bankers' annual bonuses in Asia by as much as 50% due to tough market conditions and declining revenue. These bonus cuts, expected to average around 30% for all investment banking teams in Asia, could lead to a significant drop in overall compensation for bankers. The reductions are part of a broader trend among Wall Street firms, including Goldman Sachs, Citigroup, and Bank of America, as a slowing economy impacts dealmaking activities and profits.

title: Morgan Stanley slashes 1,600 jobs
summary: Morgan Stanley laid off approximately 1,600 employees, or 2% of its workforce, on Tuesday, December 6, following previous warnings from CEO James Gorman about upcoming staff reductions. This move came amidst similar cautious sentiments from other major banks, with Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon forecasting "bumpy times ahead" and Bank of America's Brian Moynihan indicating a slowdown in hiring. The banking sector appears to be preparing for potential economic downturns by reducing staff and slowing recruitment, a significant shift from pandemic-era policies that saw banks avoid job cuts.

title: Wells Fargo Archives
summary: This archive of Finovate articles details Wells Fargo's digital transformation efforts, including the launch of its Vantage digital banking platform for commercial clients and the Flex Loan small dollar financing solution. It also covers Wells Fargo's participation in the Akoya Data Access Network for API-based data aggregation and historical analyses of its website design and mobile banking strategies. The collection highlights the bank's initiatives to enhance customer experience, manage short-term cash needs, and improve digital engagement.

title: Morgan Stanley cut about 2% of global staff on Tuesday, sources say
summary: Morgan Stanley cut about 2% of its global workforce, approximately 1,600 employees, on Tuesday, impacting nearly all divisions except financial advisors. This move aligns with other Wall Street firms reinstating annual culling of underperformers, a practice paused during the pandemic, as the Federal Reserve's interest rate increases have slowed deals activity. CEO James Gorman had previously indicated "modest cuts" were planned after years of growth and swelling head count.

title: Bank of Hope data breach class action settlement
summary: Bank of Hope agreed to a class action settlement to resolve claims that a 2018 data breach exposed Californians’ sensitive information. The settlement provides reimbursement for out-of-pocket expenses up to $500, two years of free identity-theft protection through Experian, and mandates cybersecurity improvements by Bank of Hope. The deadline for claims and exclusion was February 7, 2023.

title: Morgan Stanley Reels in Three Merrill Teams With Over $2.5B Combined in WA, OH
summary: Morgan Stanley successfully recruited three teams from Merrill Lynch, collectively managing over $2.5 billion in client assets. This includes a $1.7 billion team in Bellevue, Washington, and two Cleveland, Ohio teams managing approximately $550 million and $300 million respectively. The moves highlight Merrill Lynch advisors' frustrations with recent changes, particularly the "growth grid" compensation plan.

title: Digital Realty announces $350 million note offering
summary: Digital Realty has announced a $350 million note offering to fund acquisitions and operations. Separately, its Singapore-listed Digital Core REIT decided to acquire a 25 percent interest in a Frankfurt facility for approximately US$140 million, while dropping plans for a Texas facility previously considered.

title: 2023 COMP: Morgan Stanley Reworks Account-Level Bonuses, Leaves Grid Unchanged
summary: Morgan Stanley is largely keeping its core compensation grid for brokers unchanged in 2023 but is adjusting account-level bonuses to encourage asset growth and debt acquisition. Key changes include discontinuing a financial planning award, sweetening incentives for net acquired assets, and penalizing small accounts that don't demonstrate growth. The firm is also making lending less lucrative and withdrawing a 3% withholding penalty on non-resident client accounts.

title: M&T Bank Corp. stock outperforms competitors despite losses on the day
summary: M&T Bank Corp. (MTB) stock fell 1.52% to $169.52 on a generally negative trading day for the stock market, breaking a three-day winning streak. Despite its own losses, the stock outperformed several key competitors including JPMorgan Chase & Co. (JPM), Bank of America Corp. (BAC), and Wells Fargo & Co. (WFC), which experienced larger percentage drops. The stock closed $23.90 below its 52-week high, with trading volume significantly below its 50-day average.

title: Liberty Mutual Explores $1 Billion Sale of Europe Businesses
summary: Liberty Mutual Holding Co. is considering selling its businesses in Spain, Portugal, and Ireland, a divestment that could generate over 1 billion euros ($1 billion). This move aligns with a trend of American insurers retreating from the European region to streamline operations, following MetLife Inc.'s recent sale of its European life insurance operations. The company has been expanding its U.S. property and casualty insurance business, including the acquisition of State Auto Financial Corp. for approximately $2.3 billion earlier this year.

title: JPMorgan Chase bumps up parental leave to 16 weeks
summary: JPMorgan Chase is increasing its parental leave to 16 weeks for either parent, effective January 1, alongside expanded bereavement leave and up to four weeks of paid time off to care for seriously ill family members. The bank is also raising its full-time employee sick days from six to ten. These benefit enhancements aim to make JPMorgan competitive with other major banks in attracting and retaining talent.

title: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon backs spending on energy infrastructure during stop in San Antonio
summary: JPMorgan Chase CEO Jamie Dimon, during a stop in San Antonio, advocated for increased investment in energy infrastructure, stating that under-investment in oil and gas globally is causing shortages. He also commented on the recent U.S. elections, expressing hope that a divided Congress could lead to progress on issues like immigration and tax reform, and discussed the labor shortage in the San Antonio market. Dimon also reiterated his earlier warning about an impending economic "hurricane" and highlighted the war in Ukraine as the biggest geopolitical risk since World War II.

title: Meet the ETFs with the lowest tracking error
summary: This article identifies ETFs with the lowest tracking error across various categories as of October 2022, based on Cafemutual ETF Research. It highlights 10 large-cap ETFs with a tracking error of 0.03, including those from ICICI Prudential, Invesco India, Kotak, Mirae Asset, Nippon India, SBI, and UTI. The research also details top-performing ETFs in mid-cap, debt, factor, gold, international, sector, and thematic categories, providing a comprehensive overview of ETFs with minimal deviation from their underlying indices.

title: Sodexo Relocating U.S. Headquarters to Pike & Rose
summary: Sodexo is relocating its U.S. headquarters from Gaithersburg to Pike & Rose in North Bethesda, Maryland, taking 52,000 square feet in a new 276,000-square-foot office building at 915 Meeting Street. This move, set for Spring 2024, solidifies Pike & Rose's position as a prime office destination in Montgomery County, attracting other major tenants like Choice Hotels International.

title: OceanFirst and Partners Bancorp call off merger, blaming regulatory delays
summary: OceanFirst Financial and Partners Bancorp have terminated their $186 million merger agreement, citing prolonged regulatory approval processes. Both companies stated that the decision was in their best interest due to the uncertainty surrounding the deal's conclusion, with no termination fees exchanged. This event reflects a broader trend of slowed bank M&A activity attributed to increased regulatory scrutiny and staffing shortages at agencies.

title: Pending merger involving Tacoma-based bank leads to sell-off of branches across West
summary: Tacoma-based Columbia Banking System announced the sale of 10 bank branches across Washington, Oregon, and California as a condition for its pending merger with Portland-based Umpqua Holdings Corp. These divestitures, mandated by the U.S. Department of Justice, involve the sale of seven branches to 1st Security Bank of Washington and three to First Northern Bank, with all employees expected to be retained. The merger, which will keep the holding company in Tacoma and trade under Columbia's symbol (COLB), aims for closure in the first quarter of next year.

title: Atlanticus Launches Aspire® Banking Platform, New Debit
summary: Atlanticus Holdings Corporation launched the Aspire® Banking platform, a new debit product designed to provide a clear path to credit for the financially underserved. This program offers a bank account and debit card with no minimums or nuisance fees, and upon completing specific activities in as little as 90 days, customers are presented with an Aspire® Credit Card offer. The initiative aims to help the nearly 44 million unbanked or underbanked Americans establish positive financial habits and access credit.

title: Goldman Sachs seeks to impose order on expanding crypto universe with classification system
summary: Goldman Sachs, in partnership with MSCI and Coin Metrics, is launching "Datonomy," a data service to classify hundreds of digital coins and tokens for institutional investors. This system aims to standardize how the financial industry understands and invests in digital assets, providing a framework for performance tracking, risk management, and product creation in the crypto space. Datonomy will allow for more granular analysis of digital assets, similar to sector analysis in traditional equities.

title: Done deal: XPO completes spinoff of brokerage unit RXO
summary: XPO Logistics has completed the spinoff of its brokerage operation, RXO Inc., creating two independent, publicly traded companies. XPO shareholders received one share of RXO for each XPO share held as of October 20th. RXO is now a standalone, tech-enabled, asset-light company with over $5 billion in annual revenue, while XPO will become an LTL pure-play after divesting its European transportation unit.

title: Morgan Stanley Nabs $4M UBS NJ Team, $1.7M Merrill Duo in FL
summary: Morgan Stanley has successfully recruited a $4 million team from UBS Wealth Management USA in New Jersey and a $1.7 million duo from Merrill Lynch in Florida. The UBS team, led by Richard Palumbo and Robert J. D’Amato, managed approximately $750 million in assets, while the Merrill Lynch duo, Andrew L. Friedman and David G. Kuffner, generated around $1.7 million from a $300 million book. These moves highlight Morgan Stanley's continued efforts to bolster its advisor count and net new assets, contrasting with recent advisor attrition at Merrill Lynch.

title: Google Cloud AI to power Wells Fargo’s new virtual assistant Fargo
summary: Wells Fargo is partnering with Google Cloud to power its new virtual assistant, Fargo, using artificial intelligence to provide a more personalized and intuitive banking experience. The virtual assistant will help customers with various banking tasks, offer proactive financial wellness guidance through predictive analytics, and will be available in Spanish in 2023. This collaboration aims to meet the growing demand for digital banking services and enhance customer financial support.

title: Banking in 2022: Digital-first or dead last
summary: This article describes a webinar from Comscore discussing the rapid changes in the banking industry, emphasizing the need for banks to adapt to digital and social platforms to reach evolving consumer audiences. The webinar highlights the growth of online banking and neobanks, and provides insights into consumer engagement, market competition, and strategies for success in the digital banking landscape.

title: Wells Fargo taps Google AI on virtual assistant launch
summary: Wells Fargo announced its collaboration with Google Cloud to power its new virtual assistant, Fargo, which will assist customers with tasks like managing debit cards, checking credit limits, and searching transactions. This move is part of Wells Fargo's broader digital transformation strategy. Fargo will use Google's conversational AI platform, Dialogflow, and will eventually offer predictive analytics and support Spanish speakers, aiming to enhance customers' financial well-being.

title: M&T sees record profits 6 months after People's United deal
summary: M&T Bank reported record profits of $647 million in the quarter following its acquisition of People's United, despite customer service issues during the system conversion. The bank also reduced its payroll by $40 million and is now looking to fill new positions through a career fair. While M&T's deposits saw a decline, the bank is actively offering incentives to attract new customers amidst market competition.

title: Jamie Dimon Praises Blockchain, Calling the Technology "Real"
summary: JP Morgan CEO Jamie Dimon, despite being a vocal critic of cryptocurrencies, has praised blockchain technology as "real" due to its practical applications in finance. His company, JP Morgan, uses blockchain through its Onyx platform for efficient wholesale payments. The article also suggests the Amplify Transformational Data Sharing ETF (BLOK) as an active management investment option for long-term growth in blockchain technology.

title: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman: “I'm perfectly happy to see our tech spend go up”
summary: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman expressed satisfaction with increased tech spending, viewing it as crucial for efficiency and innovation, despite a 22% drop in bank revenues. He highlighted the importance of cloud technology, robo-advisors, and cybersecurity, while also reflecting on market recalibrations due to past "ridiculous" valuations and the return to fundamental economic principles. The bank's wealth management and fixed income sectors performed well, offsetting a decline in investment banking.

title: Citigroup reports $110 mln leveraged-loan loss as other banks avoid sector exposure
summary: Citigroup reported a $110 million writedown on leveraged loans in the third quarter, contrasting with other major Wall Street banks that largely avoided or reduced their exposure to the sector. This loss reflects the broader struggles in the leveraged finance market, exacerbated by rising interest rates and investor caution, which have also impacted mergers and acquisitions.

title: BlackRock Sees “Generational” Fixed Income Opportunities
summary: Robert Kapito, president of BlackRock, stated there are generational opportunities in the bond market due to rising rates and US stimulus. He highlighted that attractive yields are now available with less duration or credit risk, driving significant inflows into fixed income and bond ETFs. BlackRock also addressed its ESG strategy and Liability-Driven Investing (LDI) in the UK pension industry.

title: Harold Smith, heir of Northern Trust and ITW founders, dies
summary: Harold Byron Smith Jr., former chairman of the Illinois Republican Party and scion of the founding families behind Northern Trust and Illinois Tool Works, has died at 89. Smith played a critical role in the state GOP's success in the 1994 elections, leveraging his business connections and innovative campaign tactics. He also held significant roles at ITW and served on Northern Trust's board, helping navigate the bank through challenging times.

title: Charles Munger – Top 10 Holdings – Q3 2022
summary: This article details Charles Munger's top 10 stock holdings for Q3 2022, based on his latest 13F-HR documents. His portfolio, valued at $163,481,000, shows a 100% concentration in these top holdings, which include significant positions in Bank of America, Wells Fargo, and Alibaba Group Holding. The piece highlights the utility of 13F-HR documents for investors tracking superinvestors.

title: Despite Strong Dollar, Gold Remains the True Safe Haven
summary: Sprott's John Hathaway argues that gold, not the U.S. dollar, is the true safe haven, despite the dollar's current strength. He believes the dollar's strength is a "mirage" reflecting other currencies' weaknesses and points to rising U.S. debt interest and potential market instability. Hathaway suggests that gold and mining stocks are undervalued and poised for rediscovery as a safe haven as the Fed's inflation fight likely leads to a hard landing.

title: Experienced Trust Professional and More Join Pinnacle Financial Partners in the National Capital Region
summary: Pinnacle Financial Partners has announced the addition of experienced trust professional Justin Willis as a trust portfolio manager in the National Capital Region, alongside Marilyn Carrera as a financial advisor assistant and Anita Carter as a treasury management analyst. These new hires bring significant experience to the firm, strengthening its wealth management and client services in the region. The move underscores Pinnacle's commitment to building a full-service bank capable of meeting diverse client needs, leveraging the expertise and community recognition of its new team members.

title: «It’s Likely Going to Be a Fairly Hard Landing»
summary: Stephen Kane and Bryan Whalen, Co-Chief Investment Officers at US bond giant TCW, express concerns about a severe recession due to the Federal Reserve's aggressive monetary policy, despite current low unemployment. They predict a "fairly hard landing" for the economy, characterized by significant financial pain and potential overtightening by the Fed, and advise caution in high-yield markets while seeing opportunities in high-quality corporate and mortgage sectors.
source: The Market – Analysen und Hintergründe aus der Wirtschaft
source_domain: The Market – Analysen und Hintergründe aus der Wirtschaft

title: 5E Advanced Materials Reports Full Year 2022 Results
summary: 5E Advanced Materials reported significant milestones for fiscal year 2022, including its Nasdaq listing, Critical Infrastructure designation, and strategic partnerships with Corning Inc. and Borman Specialty Materials. The company also progressed with its Small-Scale Boron Facility and strengthened its balance sheet with a $60 million investment from Bluescape Energy Partners. 5E is strategically positioned to become a vertically integrated producer of boron and lithium, addressing global trends in decarbonization, food security, and critical material supply.

title: Tetra Tech outbids WSP for RPS
summary: Tetra Tech has outbid WSP for RPS Group with an all-cash offer of £636m, surpassing WSP's initial £625m bid. The RPS board unanimously recommended Tetra Tech's offer, prompting RPS to withdraw its recommendation for WSP's offer and postpone shareholder meetings. WSP is now considering its options regarding the acquisition.

title: CFPB fines Regions $191M on overdraft practices
summary: The CFPB has fined Regions Bank $191 million for charging "illegal surprise" overdraft fees between 2018 and 2021. The penalty includes a $50 million fine and $141 million in restitution to customers affected by "authorized-positive" fees, which the bank states it eliminated over a year ago. This action highlights ongoing regulatory scrutiny of overdraft practices, with other banks also modifying or eliminating such fees.

title: Regions Bank to repay customers $141 million in illegal overdraft fees
summary: Regions Bank has been ordered to repay $141 million to customers for illegally charging overdraft fees between 2018 and 2021, even after telling customers they had sufficient funds. This marks the second time in a decade the bank has been penalized for such practices, highlighting an ongoing issue with "surprise overdraft fees" across the financial industry. The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau also fined Regions an additional $50 million.

title: Global Retirement Partners LLC Has $206,000 Position in Fidelity Stocks For Inflation ETF (BATS:FCPI)
summary: Global Retirement Partners LLC increased its stake in Fidelity Stocks For Inflation ETF (BATS:FCPI) by 9.9% during the second quarter, bringing its total holdings to $206,000. Several other institutional investors also acquired new positions in FCPI during the same period. The ETF's stock opened at $28.28, with moving averages indicating recent price movements.

title: Questioning CEOs of America’s Largest Banks on Efforts to Block Gun Purchases, Legal Commerce
summary: Senator Kevin Cramer questioned the CEOs of major U.S. banks during a Senate Banking Committee hearing regarding their commitment to processing transactions for legal goods and services, particularly in light of pressures to block gun purchases. Senator Cramer specifically challenged the banks on a new Merchant Category Code for gun and ammunition stores and sought assurances that legal transactions would not be discriminated against. All seven bank CEOs present committed to processing transactions for legal goods and services, including guns and ammunition.

title: Truist, Bank of America post highest deposits in metro Orlando
summary: Truist and Bank of America have secured the top two positions for deposits in the metro Orlando area. The article notes that multiple banks increased their deposits in the market over the last year.

title: Banking Scams: American Express, Regions, NFCU, ICCU, and Bank of America
summary: This article details recent banking scams targeting customers of American Express, Regions Bank, Navy Federal Credit Union (NFCU), Idaho Central Credit Union (ICCU), and Bank of America. It highlights various phishing emails and SMS (smishing) messages designed to trick users into revealing their login credentials or personal information. The article also provides advice on how to protect oneself from these scams, including checking URLs and using security tools like Trend Micro ScamCheck.

title: Dallas-based Beneficient going public via SPAC in deal valuing it at $3.5 billion
summary: Dallas-based Beneficient Company Group is going public via a SPAC merger with Avalon Acquisition Inc., in a deal valuing Beneficient at $3.5 billion. The company targets the $12 trillion alternative asset market, focusing on providing liquidity and transparency for mid- to high-net-worth investors and small- to medium-sized institutions. This merger is expected to provide Beneficient with approximately $200 million in gross proceeds to fuel its growth.

title: Bank CEOs questioned on consumer protections, social issues
summary: Bank CEOs faced a second day of questioning on Capitol Hill regarding consumer protections and social issues. Senate Democrats pressed for more consumer safeguards amidst high inflation, while Republicans questioned banks' involvement in social issues. Topics included overdraft fees, Zelle fraud, and banks' stances on abortion costs, gun rights, and environmental policies.

title: US bank CEOs say they would stop working with China in event of Taiwan attack
summary: Top US bank CEOs stated they would cease operations in China if the US government instructed them to do so following a Taiwan invasion by mainland forces. This commitment was made during a House of Representatives Financial Services Committee hearing where lawmakers questioned their institutions' business ties to both Russia and China. The CEOs of JPMorgan Chase, Wells Fargo, Bank of America, Citigroup, US Bancorp, PNC Financial, and Truist were present.

title: Bank CEOs push back on capital requirements in Capitol Hill hearings
summary: CEOs from seven of the largest U.S. banks, including JPMorgan Chase, Citigroup, Wells Fargo, and Bank of America, engaged in two days of public hearings on Capitol Hill. They addressed various topics such as inflation, racial equality in home lending, regulatory burdens, and their perspectives on an impending economic slowdown. A key point of discussion was their pushback on capital requirements.

title: BNY Mellon, Warburg Group, Deutsche Bank to pay $60 mln in 'cum-ex' case
summary: BNY Mellon, Warburg Group, and Deutsche Bank will pay 60 million euros ($59.85 million) to German tax authorities related to the "cum-ex" tax scandal. This payment covers tax liabilities for the BC German Equity Special Fund from 2009. The scandal, which involves multiple banks and has cost taxpayers billions, remains under investigation.

title: Intellicheck Appoints Dondi Black and Greg Braca to Board of Directors
summary: Intellicheck, Inc. (Nasdaq: IDN) has appointed Dondi Black and Greg Braca to its board of directors, effective September 14, 2022. Both appointees bring over 30 years of extensive experience in the fintech and banking industries, which Intellicheck believes will be valuable for the company's strategic growth and adoption of its technology solutions. Black is currently Senior Vice President, Chief Product Officer at TSYS, and Braca is the former CEO and president of TD Bank.

title: Brandon Brouillard, of Worcester, sentenced for trying to buy $83,000 sports car using stolen identities
summary: Brandon Brouillard of Worcester was sentenced to nearly four years in prison for bank fraud and aggravated identity theft. He used stolen identities to open bank accounts, attempt a car loan, and successfully purchase an $83,000 Chevrolet Camaro with a fraudulent check. His scheme involved compromising an Arizona resident's bank accounts, totaling approximately $500,000 in fraudulent purchases, and he was also linked to another man's attempt to buy a $56,000 Jeep using a counterfeit check.

title: Comerica Bank Is Building a New Business and Innovation Hub at The Star in Frisco
summary: Comerica Bank is constructing a new Business & Innovation Hub at The Star in Frisco, slated to open in late 2023 or early 2024, which will house approximately 300 employees and feature an innovation center and "tech genius bar." This expansion aims to enhance cross-functional collaboration and meet evolving needs, complementing its downtown Dallas headquarters. The facility will be located in a new Class A+ tower at 17 Cowboys Way and is designed by HKS Architects.

title: Former Matrix partners mend rift, but secrets and tension between FPL, Southern Co. linger | Nate Monroe
summary: A legal battle between former partners of Matrix LLC, a political consulting firm, has ended in a settlement, but revelations about the firm's work for major power companies like Florida Power & Light (FPL) and Southern Co. have exposed ongoing tensions. The article reveals how Matrix operatives engaged in surveillance and manipulation of elections and public policy on behalf of FPL, while also attempting to undermine Southern Co.'s interests. The settlement, while quieting some immediate legal noise, highlights a bitter rivalry between FPL and Southern Co. over regional energy projects and market influence.

title: Citigroup's Russia exit removes one obstacle for CEO, but challenges remain
summary: Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser is working to simplify the bank's structure and focus on core businesses by exiting Russia and paring down consumer operations in other countries. While investors and analysts acknowledge the positive direction, Fraser faces significant challenges, including overhauling risk management systems mandated by U.S. regulators and a potentially deteriorating economic environment. Despite these hurdles, some investors are showing patience with her long-term strategy for a "simpler, sounder bank."

title: Newmark Facilitates $260 Million Financing of Iconic Plaza District Office Building in Midtown Manhattan
summary: Newmark has arranged a $260 million refinancing loan for RXR's 75 Rockefeller Plaza, a prominent mixed-use office and retail tower in Midtown Manhattan. The financing, contributed by Bank of America and Carlyle, highlights the building's strong fundamentals, including A+ sponsorship, investment-grade tenancy, and significant capital improvements. The property boasts a prime location near Rockefeller Plaza, comprehensive amenities, and flexible office spaces.

title: Atlantic Union Bank Names Sherry Williams Chief Risk Officer
summary: Atlantic Union Bank has appointed Sherry Williams as its new Chief Risk Officer, effective by October 2022. Williams will oversee the company's enterprise and regulatory risk management functions. She brings 26 years of experience from previous roles at Amalgamated Bank, PwC, SunTrust Bank, State of Georgia, and Ernst & Young LLP, holding a doctorate in business administration and several professional certifications.

title: Huntington Bancshares Inc. stock outperforms market despite losses on the day
summary: Huntington Bancshares Inc. (HBAN) saw its stock fall by 2.64% on Friday, despite a broader market downturn where the S&P 500 and Dow Jones Industrial Average experienced larger declines. The stock's performance outpaced several competitors, including Bank of America Corp., Fifth Third Bancorp, and F.N.B. Corp., even as it snapped a three-day winning streak. Trading volume for HBAN was below its 50-day average, with the stock closing $4.15 below its 52-week high.

title: JPMorgan Chase Applies to Open Its First Downtown Baltimore Branch
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co. is set to open its first downtown Baltimore branch at 100 S. Charles St. in 2023, following an application filed with the federal Office of the Comptroller of the Currency. This move is part of the bank's aggressive expansion strategy in the region, aiming to open 70 new branches across Maryland, Washington, D.C., and Virginia by the end of 2025, doubling its initial goal. The new downtown branch will be Chase's seventh in Baltimore City and contributes to 13 total in Greater Baltimore.

title: First Internet Bank launches small-business account
summary: First Internet Bank has launched a new checking account, "Do More Business Checking," specifically designed for small-business owners. This product allows business owners to earn interest, make unlimited transactions, and link various financial accounts for a comprehensive view of both business and personal finances. The initiative aims to simplify day-to-day operations for small businesses and tap into a significant market opportunity previously dominated by third-party providers and fintechs.

title: Highwoods Properties Closes $203M Buy of Legacy Union SIX50 in Charlotte
summary: Highwoods Properties, Inc. has acquired the Legacy Union SIX50 building in Charlotte, NC for $203 million. The 18-story, 367,000-square-foot property is currently 79% leased and sits within the Charlotte CBD's Legacy Union mixed-use development, adjacent to Highwoods-owned Bank of America Tower. Lincoln Harris and Goldman Sachs Asset Management were the sellers, with Lincoln Harris retaining management and leasing responsibilities.

title: US, European banks could lose over $5bn from risky buyout loans
summary: Top US and European banks face potential losses of over $5 billion from leveraged and bridge loans due to rising interest rates and a slowdown in the leveraged buyout market. Banks like Bank of America are particularly exposed, having committed to financing large buyout deals, while difficulties in offloading debt to investors are forcing underwriters to sell at a discount. The market disruption is primarily attributed to the Federal Reserve's aggressive monetary policy tightening to combat inflation.

title: Wells Fargo plans retreat from mortgage business
summary: Wells Fargo & Co. is planning to significantly reduce its mortgage business after years of regulatory scrutinized and changes in leadership. The bank, which once held a dominant share of the U.S. home loan market, aims to focus on lending to existing customers and scale back operations like correspondent mortgage lending and third-party servicing. This strategic shift reflects a broader industry trend among large banks to moderate their mortgage exposure following the 2008 financial crisis and ongoing regulatory challenges.

title: PNC Drops Another Type of Fee After Overhauling Overdraft Policy
summary: PNC Financial Services Group Inc. has eliminated non-sufficient fund (NSF) fees, joining other large banks in removing charges that have drawn criticism from politicians and consumer advocates. These fees were previously charged when a transaction was returned due to insufficient funds in a customer's account. PNC had already removed NSF fees from its Virtual Wallet Spend feature and is now extending this policy to other personal checking-account options.

title: JPMorgan Chase Avoided Public Punishment From CFPB Under Trump After Discovery of Alleged Fake Accounts
summary: JPMorgan Chase (JPM) allegedly avoided public sanctions from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) during the Trump administration for creating fake accounts, despite the agency identifying serious instances at four banks after the Wells Fargo scandal. The CFPB's enforcement unit investigated Chase for several years but closed the matter in early 2020. This incident highlights a broader trend during the Trump administration where financial institutions like TD Bank (TD) also faced private reprimands instead of public penalties for similar misconduct, drawing criticism from lawmakers like Senator Elizabeth Warren.

title: Archroma to Acquire the Textile Effects Business of The Huntsman Corp.
summary: Archroma has agreed to acquire the Textile Effects business from Huntsman Corp. The terms of the deal were not disclosed, but the acquisition is expected to close in the first half of 2023. This merger aims to create a powerhouse in sustainable and innovative textile solutions, combining the rich legacies of several industry pioneers.

title: Morgan Stanley to pay $200 million to resolve U.S. record-keeping probe
summary: Morgan Stanley has agreed to pay $200 million to U.S. regulators to settle investigations into its record-keeping practices, specifically regarding unapproved messaging platforms used by employees. The bank will pay $125 million to the SEC and $75 million to the CFTC. This settlement follows similar issues faced by other major banks like Bank of America, Citigroup, and Barclays, as regulators crack down on the logging of employee communications during the shift to remote work.

title: ESIX Could Be Great for ESG, Small-Cap Rebounds
summary: The SPDR S&P SmallCap 600 ESG ETF (ESIX) is highlighted as a potentially strong performer for investors seeking exposure to small-cap equities with ESG principles, especially given anticipated small-cap rebounds and economic forecasts. Despite ESG funds and small-caps lagging in early 2022, analysts are bullish on small-cap prospects due to better earnings guidance and recession preparedness. ESIX offers a balanced mix of growth and value stocks within the small-cap segment, historically a rewarding combination.

title: My Experience Visiting A Capital One Cafe
summary: The author shares their first experience visiting a Capital One Cafe, highlighting its unique blend of a coffee shop and bank. They found it to be a quiet place to work, offering 50% off beverages for Capital One cardholders, and noted the presence of "Cafe Ambassadors" for banking questions without sales pressure. The article concludes that these cafes present a pleasant alternative to traditional coffee shops like Starbucks, especially for Capital One customers.

title: MasTec Acquires IEA for Wind, Solar Energy Infrastructure Expertise
summary: MasTec has entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Infrastructure and Energy Alternatives Inc. (IEA) in a cash-and-stock transaction valued at $14 per IEA share, totaling approximately $1.1 billion. This acquisition aims to expand MasTec's service capabilities in renewable energy infrastructure, particularly wind and solar projects, and is expected to close in late Q4 2022. The deal combines IEA's expertise in utility-scale wind and solar projects with MasTec's existing infrastructure services, anticipating increased scale and capacity to meet growing demand for renewable power generation.

title: Bank of Montreal Taps North Texas for its Newest Tech Hub
summary: The Bank of Montreal (BMO) is establishing a new tech hub in North Texas, planning to hire 50 new employees to add to its existing 250-person DFW workforce. This move is part of BMO's strategy to expand its U.S. operations and follows similar investments by other major banks like JPMorgan Chase, Bank of America, and PNC Bank in the Dallas-Fort Worth region. The Irving tech hub will be BMO's first outside of Toronto and Chicago, focusing on areas like cybersecurity and engineering.

title: Bank of Montreal establishes tech hub in Irving to fuel U.S. expansion
summary: The Bank of Montreal (BMO) is establishing a new tech hub in Irving, Texas, to support its U.S. expansion and upcoming acquisition of Bank of the West. The new hub will initially hire 50 tech and operations employees and will be located in BMO's existing Irving office. Dallas-Fort Worth was chosen over other cities like Charlotte and Atlanta due to its rapid tech growth and BMO's existing presence in the area.

title: 5 Best Joint Checking Accounts [2025 ]
summary: This article reviews the five best joint checking accounts for 2025, highlighting options like Ally Bank for overall convenience, Capital One for parents and kids, and Axos Bank for various features. It also details key features to look for in a joint account, such as interest rates and fees, and provides steps for getting approved and improving personal finances.

title: State Street Corp. stock underperforms Wednesday when compared to competitors
summary: State Street Corp. (STT) stock underperformed on Wednesday, July 20, 2022, falling 0.53% to $66.97, despite a generally positive trading session for the broader market. The stock closed significantly below its 52-week high and lagged behind some of its key competitors like JPMorgan Chase & Co., Bank of America Corp., and Citigroup Inc. Trading volume for State Street Corp. was also below its 50-day average.

title: Front-running scandal rocks a $31 billion investing giant
summary: India's $465 billion mutual fund industry is facing scrutiny after Axis Asset Management Co., one of the nation's largest asset managers and partly owned by Schroders, sacked two employees, including its chief dealer, amidst a front-running scandal. Regulators are investigating potential breaches of securities law and the case highlights increased compliance challenges in the booming Indian investment sector. The probe has led to a lawsuit for wrongful termination by one of the former employees and raised questions about compliance during pandemic work-from-home periods, predicting tighter regulations for fund managers.

title: Truist is the latest bank to raise its minimum wage. Here’s how much workers will make.
summary: Truist Financial announced it will raise its minimum wage nationwide to $22 per hour starting October 1, impacting about 14,000 employees. This move positions Truist's new minimum wage among the highest in the banking industry and follows similar increases by other Charlotte-based banks like Bank of America, Wells Fargo, Ally Financial, and Fifth Third Bancorp, amidst a competitive labor market.

title: News | Google in Talks To Buy Chicago’s Thompson Center
summary: Google is in negotiations to purchase the James R. Thompson Center in Chicago's Loop business district, a move that could significantly boost the area. This deal is the latest in Google's history of strategic real estate acquisitions in Chicago, and it could provide space for thousands of additional employees. The acquisition could also influence Prime Group's redevelopment plans for the building and the state of Illinois's prior agreement to buy back office space.

title: Are Bank Stocks Undervalued?
summary: Despite fears of a potential recession driving down bank stock prices, many high-quality banks appear undervalued, trading at a significant discount compared to historical recession lows. Rising net interest margins due to Federal Reserve rate hikes could provide a tailwind, which analysts believe is not being fully priced into current valuations. Long-term investors may find attractive opportunities in these undervalued bank stocks, particularly those with wide economic moats like Wells Fargo, JPMorgan Chase, U.S. Bancorp, and Bank of America.

title: Katrina Evans
summary: Katrina Evans, Executive Vice President at KeyCorp, is highlighted for her 30-plus years of adventurous leadership and significant contributions to the company. She has spearheaded growth in marketing, communications, and analytics, orchestrated expansion of a multibillion-dollar community benefits plan, and fostered diversity, equity, and inclusion initiatives. Her leadership style emphasizes authenticity and empowering others.

title: JPMorgan, Citi, Goldman, Wells Fargo and Bank of America will cover out-of-state abortion costs for employees
summary: JPMorgan Chase & Co., Bank of America Corp., Goldman Sachs Group Inc., Wells Fargo & Co. and Citigroup Inc. have all announced that they will cover out-of-state travel expenses for employees seeking abortions. This decision comes in the wake of the U.S. Supreme Court's ruling to overturn Roe v. Wade. These major banks join other large corporations in offering such benefits.

title: How JPMorgan Chase, Target, Citi, Bank of America, and PayPal are Reporting on Their Complex, Big-Dollar Racial Equity Commitments
summary: This article examines how major corporations like JPMorgan Chase, Target, Citi, Bank of America, and PayPal are reporting progress on their substantial racial equity commitments, ranging from $535 million to $30 billion. It details the specific actions and investments each company has made to advance racial equity, such as supporting Black-owned businesses, increasing affordable housing, and investing in diverse suppliers. The piece emphasizes the importance of transparent reporting on these complex, multi-year pledges.

title: Southern First rolls out new HQ to customers, community
summary: Southern First Bank has unveiled its new five-story, 107,000-square-foot headquarters in Greenville, designed to be warm, welcoming, and progressive, aiming to redefine traditional bank architecture. The new building provides ample space for employees, clients, and community events, reflecting the bank's commitment to its community and its future growth. CEO Art Seaver emphasizes the building as a statement of belief in the future and a tool for recruiting top talent, affirming the bank's long-term vision and client-first mentality.

title: Virtual reality and indoor ‘tree houses’: Truist unveils banking tech center in uptown
summary: Truist Bank has opened a new 100,000-square-foot Innovation and Technology Center in uptown Charlotte, aiming to fuse tech and finance for a better banking experience. The center features virtual reality labs, "tree houses," and collaborative spaces, intending to propel Truist into the future of digital banking despite recent low rankings in consumer satisfaction for its digital services. The bank also launched an "Innovators in Residence" program with partners like Verizon and Amazon Web Services to explore new technologies.

title: Visa Inc. completes €3.0bn cross-border offering of senior notes | Vietnam | Global law firm
summary: Visa Inc. has completed a €3.0 billion cross-border offering of senior notes, facilitated by Norton Rose Fulbright's Toronto office. The offering included notes due in 2026, 2029, and 2034, with net proceeds intended for general corporate purposes. The issuance involved a syndicate of underwriters including major financial institutions.

title: EXCLUSIVE Baidu in talks to sell majority stake in iQIYI, China's answer to Netflix -sources
summary: Baidu Inc is reportedly in talks to sell its controlling stake in iQIYI Inc, China's equivalent of Netflix, in a deal that could value iQIYI at approximately $7 billion. Baidu aims to divest its entire 53% holding as it considers iQIYI a non-core asset and shifts focus to AI and autonomous driving. The potential sale has garnered interest from entities like PAG and China Mobile despite iQIYI's recent stock performance amid a broader Chinese tech sell-off.

title: Netflix stock downgraded to ‘Sell’ by Goldman Sachs analysts
summary: Goldman Sachs analysts have downgraded Netflix (NFLX) stock to 'Sell' amidst a significant year-to-date plummet and broader market sell-offs affecting growth stocks. The article discusses the differing opinions among analysts regarding whether investors should buy the dip or sell, highlighting concerns about free cash flow and content spending versus the potential for future growth initiatives like cracking down on password sharing and an ad-supported model.

title: Talkspace CFO: Cerebral's Controlled Substances Pivot Could Create More Daylight in Virtual Mental Health Market
summary: Talkspace CFO Jennifer Fulk believes that Cerebral's pivot away from prescribing controlled substances could create new opportunities for Talkspace in the virtual mental health market. Talkspace has never prescribed controlled substances and sees Cerebral's recent issues as a potential advantage due to its focus on a full-stack behavioral health care platform. The article also touches on Talkspace's financial turnaround plan and analyst speculation about it being an acquisition target.

title: Lucid Unveils Lucid Financial Services with Bank of America
summary: Lucid Group, Inc. launched Lucid Financial Services, a new digital platform offering flexible financing options including lease and loan purchases for Lucid Air customers, in partnership with Bank of America. This service provides a seamless online experience for financing applications and aims to transform vehicle financing with a fully digital journey. The program is initially available to U.S. customers receiving Lucid Air Grand Touring models, expanding to Touring and Pure models later in the year.

title: PNC Financial Services Group Inc. mixing tech and comfort at automated branches
summary: PNC Financial Services Group Inc. is integrating technology with comfort in its automated branches, adapting to evolving customer banking habits. The article highlights PNC's strategy of tweaking space usage to better serve modern banking needs. This approach reflects a broader trend among banks to enhance customer experience through technological advancements and reconfigured physical spaces.

title: PNC changing 1,000-plus branches to automated model
summary: PNC Financial Services Group Inc. is converting 60% of its branches, over 1,000 locations, to an automated model. This conversion is already underway and is projected to be completed by the end of 2026. This strategic shift will impact how customers interact with branches and reflects a broader trend toward automation in banking.

title: Lowe’s jumps Bank of America as top Fortune 500 company in Charlotte area
summary: Lowe's Cos. Inc. has surpassed Bank of America Corp. as the highest-ranked Fortune 500 company in the Charlotte area. Despite dropping four spots overall to No. 35, Lowe's recorded $96.2 billion in revenue, outperforming Bank of America, which placed at No. 36 with $93.8 billion in revenue. This marks a significant shift in the regional corporate landscape.

title: UGA honors companies that hired the most UGA grads
summary: The University of Georgia recognized the top 25 employers of its Class of 2021 at an event in Sanford Stadium. These companies hired graduates across various industries, from technology and finance to retail and healthcare. UGA's Career Center provides resources for employers to connect with its diverse talent pool.

title: Ocwen, Freddie Mac, Deephaven make leadership appointments
summary: This article details numerous leadership appointments across the mortgage industry, including key promotions and new hires at companies like Ocwen, Freddie Mac, Deephaven, Xactus, Academy Mortgage, Better, Freedom Mortgage, BSI Financial, Mid America Mortgage, Vice Capital Markets, Movement Mortgage, Mortgage Connect, Open Mortgage, Incenter, and Guaranteed Rate. These changes involve various roles such as CFO, head of multifamily, chief sales officer, CTO, president, head of capital markets, head of strategy, chief people officer, and director of diversity lending, highlighting a dynamic period of executive shifts in the sector.

title: The Thought Process Behind Humana’s Kindred at Home Transactions
summary: Humana's Kindred at Home transactions, including its acquisition and partial divestiture of the hospice segment, were driven by the belief that more care will shift to the home and the potential for significant cost savings. Despite the complexities of a fragmented industry and labor pressures, the deals aimed to leverage Kindred's national platform and capitalize on high hospice M&A valuations. The company plans to use proceeds from the sale for debt repayment and share repurchases, anticipating continued growth in its home-care business.

title: PE giant Brookfield buys Watermark REIT for $3.8B
summary: Brookfield Real Estate Funds has acquired non-traded REIT Watermark Lodging Trust for $3.8 billion in an all-cash transaction. Watermark's portfolio comprises 25 luxury and upper upscale hotels, including Ritz-Carlton properties, located in U.S. drive-to leisure destinations and gateway urban cities. The acquisition reflects confidence in large-scale hotel deals despite recent interest rate increases and debt capital market volatility.

title: The Old Tech FAANG Is Dulled, But a New Version Has Promise
summary: Bank of America strategists have introduced "FAANG 2.0," a new grouping of sectors designed for a world facing inflation, war, and geopolitical shifts, replacing the underperforming original tech FAANG stocks. This new version, comprising fuels, aerospace and defense, agriculture, nuclear and renewables, and gold and metals/minerals, has shown significantly better market performance year to date compared to both the S&P 500 and the original tech FAANG stocks. The article highlights the rationale behind this shift, citing energy security, increased military spending, rising food prices, and gold's role as a refuge asset in the current global climate.

title: Scoping Out Scope 3 Emissions
summary: A report by Citi Research's Anita McBain highlights the growing importance of Scope 3 emissions as new reporting requirements aim to improve transparency in emission reporting across global value chains. The article discusses the complexities of disclosing Scope 3 emissions compared to Scope 1 and 2, and the significant business benefits companies can achieve by addressing them. It also examines current Scope 3 disclosure trends by country, noting that while the U.S. has the largest volume of disclosed emissions, a smaller proportion of its companies consider Scope 3 relevant compared to Japan.

title: Georgia Power issues landmark Equality Progress Sustainability Bond
summary: Georgia Power has issued the first-ever corporate Equality Progress Sustainability Bonds (EPSBs) totaling $800 million as part of a larger $1.5 billion senior unsecured bond offering. These EPSBs are designed to advance racial equality, economic opportunity, and environmental sustainability, with at least 50% of net proceeds allocated to social spending primarily benefiting minority- and/or female-owned suppliers. This initiative aligns with Southern Company's "Moving to Equity" framework and Georgia Power's commitment to increase spending with diverse suppliers to 30% by 2030, reinforcing their leadership in ESG-bond issuances.

title: Frank Sorrentino III Of ConnectOne Bank On The Future Of Money and Banking
summary: Frank Sorrentino III, Chairman, CEO, and Founder of ConnectOne Bank, discusses the evolving landscape of banking and money, emphasizing the role of digitalization and technology in serving small to mid-market clients. He shares insights on ConnectOne Bank's journey, including its IPO and recent Fintech acquisitions, and offers advice for a successful career in the modern finance industry. Sorrentino highlights the importance of innovation balanced with regulation and envisions significant growth in payments and digital asset custody.

title: First Internet Bank Appoints Genevieve Lua As VP
summary: First Internet Bank announced the appointment of Genevieve Lua as Vice President, Business Development Officer, to its Small Business Administration Lending team. Lua brings extensive lending experience from Bank of America and JPMorgan Chase, and will help entrepreneurs navigate the SBA loan process. First Internet Bank emphasizes providing flexible financial solutions for small businesses.

title: Charles Schwab (SCHW) Q1 revenue down 1%; earnings miss estimates
summary: The Charles Schwab Corporation reported lower earnings and revenues for the first quarter of 2022, missing Wall Street's forecasts. Total revenues decreased 1% to $4.67 billion, and adjusted net profit dropped to $0.77 per share. The company's stock experienced a decline following the earnings release.

title: Where Bank of America execs see growth potential despite growing economic uncertainties
summary: Bank of America executives are focusing on growth opportunities in a post-Covid economy despite increasing uncertainties. The article highlights the bank's strategy amidst recent financial results and broader economic shifts, emphasizing areas where they anticipate continued expansion.

title: Fidelity Investments Launches Crypto, Metaverse ETFs — Says 'We Continue to See Demand'
summary: Fidelity Investments has launched two new exchange-traded funds (ETFs) focused on the crypto and metaverse sectors. The company stated that it continues to observe strong demand for digital asset exposure and innovative technologies like the metaverse. This move by Fidelity allows investors to gain exposure to these emerging markets through traditional investment vehicles.

title: RBB President and CEO Resigns After Internal Investigation
summary: Royal Business Bank's (RBB) president and CEO, Alan Thian, has resigned immediately following an internal investigation that found he violated bank policies, particularly concerning personnel decisions. The violations, while not having a financial impact, negatively affected employee morale. This departure, combined with the earlier exit of the chief lending officer, may also complicate RBB’s planned acquisition of Gateway Bank.

title: Li Lu Top 10 Holdings – Q4 2021, Buys FB, BAC
summary: This article details superinvestor Li Lu's top 10 holdings as of Q4 2021, derived from his 13F-HR documents. His portfolio, valued at over $2.6 billion, shows significant investments in Micron Technology, Bank of America, and Facebook, alongside other major tech companies. The report also highlights his new buys, Facebook and Bank of America, and his sell in Pinduoduo.

title: Constellation Brands to repurchase $500M of its own stock
summary: Constellation Brands announced an accelerated share repurchase program with Bank of America to buy back $500 million of its stock, which is expected to increase existing shareholders' ownership concentration. This move comes as the company reported a rise in fourth-quarter net income and acquired the remaining interest in Austin Cocktails. The company also confirmed its plans to move its headquarters to downtown Rochester, bringing hundreds of jobs.

title: Dave & Buster’s Announces Acquisition of Main Event for $835 Million; Chris Morris to become CEO of Combined Entity Upon Closing
summary: Dave & Buster's Entertainment, Inc. announced its acquisition of Main Event from Ardent Leisure Group Limited and RedBird Capital Partners for $835 million. Chris Morris, the current CEO of Main Event, will become CEO of the combined entity upon closing. This acquisition aims to expand Dave & Buster's demographic reach by targeting families with younger children while also creating significant growth opportunities for both brands.

title: Putnam’s Collins Draws On Nature For ESG Investing Inspiration
summary: Katherine Collins, head of sustainable investing at Putnam Investments, integrates biomimicry and insights from nature, specifically honeybees, into her ESG investment strategies. After a career in traditional finance and a master's degree from Harvard Divinity School, Collins applies a unique lens to identify companies demonstrating leadership in sustainability. Her approach focuses on balancing risk and opportunity, evidenced in her co-management of Putnam Sustainable Leaders (PNOYX) and Putnam Sustainable Future (PMVYX) funds.

title: Hancock Whitney to drop overdraft and other charges, following banking drift away from fees
summary: Hancock Whitney Bank is eliminating fees for nonsufficient funds and some overdraft charges by the end of 2022, expecting to cut about $11 million in charges.
