This move aligns with a broader industry trend where major banks like Citibank, Capital One, and Bank of America are also dropping such fees, driven by consumer protection scrutiny and advancements in digital finance. The bank also plans to introduce services allowing earlier access to pay to help customers avoid overdrafts.

title: Banking & Finance Roundup: Seacoast to acquire Miami’s Apollo Bank
summary: This article covers the banking and finance news roundup for the week, highlighting Seacoast's acquisition of Apollo Bank in Miami. It also lists other related articles about regional banking news, including Pitcairn hiring a local executive and Amerant Bank joining a blockchain network.

title: Arkansas Eyes Upon Texas Lending
summary: Arkansas banks are increasingly expanding their operations into Texas, drawn by its larger banking market and growth opportunities. Major players like Home BancShares (Centennial Bank), Simmons First National Corp., and Bank OZK have made significant acquisitions and branch expansions. Other banks like Farmers Bank & Trust, Encore Bank, Bodcaw Bank, and Diamond Bank are also establishing a presence, utilizing both acquisitions and new branch development.

title: Trucking Companies Bet on Intermodal Growth
summary: Trucking companies are increasingly investing in intermodal operations as a key growth strategy, driven by factors such as unwinding supply chains, rising fuel costs, and environmental initiatives. Analysts anticipate a market share shift from truck to domestic intermodal, supported by improving railroad operations. Major players like J.B. Hunt, Schneider National, Hub Group, and Knight-Swift Transportation are expanding their intermodal fleets and services to capitalize on this trend and diversify their revenue streams.

title: Dakota Gold Corp. Announces Merger Closing as Part of a Specific Focus on Revitalizing the Homestake District in Lead, South Dakota
summary: Dakota Gold Corp. announced the completion of its merger between Dakota Territory Resource Corp. and JR Resources Corp., focusing on revitalizing the Homestake District in Lead, South Dakota. The company's common stock is expected to begin trading on the NYSE American under the symbol "DC" on or about April 5, 2022, following a significant expansion of its land package and establishment of an ESG fund. This strategic move aims to leverage the Homestake District's 145-year gold mining legacy for new discoveries and opportunities.

title: An Inclusive Leader, Korn Ferry Senior Advisor Has Had a Career of Firsts
summary: Caroline Nahas, a senior advisor to Korn Ferry and UCLA Anderson's first woman board chair, reflects on her pioneering career filled with "firsts" in leadership. She discusses her inclusive leadership style, the importance of fostering a supportive environment for employees, and her philanthropic philosophy shaped by a personal experience of generosity during her college years. Nahas emphasizes the rich diversity of Los Angeles and her commitment to bringing UCLA Anderson to greater levels of excellence.

title: Capital One Is one of the 2022 TIME100 Most Influential Companies | TIME
summary: Capital One has been named one of the 2022 TIME100 Most Influential Companies primarily for its decision to eliminate overdraft and insufficient-fund fees. This move, which accounted for $150 million of its $30.4 billion revenue last year, has influenced other major U.S. banks like Bank of America, Wells Fargo, and Citigroup to follow suit amidst regulatory pressure. The article highlights the significant impact of these fees on financially vulnerable families and Capital One's role in shifting industry standards.

title: Alaska Air Group provides update on long-term growth strategy
summary: Alaska Air Group is hosting its Investor Day to outline its long-term growth strategy, emphasizing successful pandemic recovery, industry outperformance in guest experience, and financial strength. The company plans to grow 4-8% annually through 2025 by deepening its network, transitioning to a single, more efficient fleet, and enhancing its loyalty program through an extended partnership with Bank of America. They also reiterate commitments to sustainable practices and provide a positive full-year 2022 outlook with specific financial metrics.

title: Goldman Sachs CEO Says Ostracizing Russia Isn’t the Finance Industry’s Job
summary: Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon stated that it is not the finance industry's job to ostracize Russia, but rather to follow government sanctions. He emphasized that businesses should implement policies set by the government, agreeing with the sanctions against Russia's actions in Ukraine. Despite this stance, the article highlights Goldman Sachs's historical involvement in Russia's economic policy and its mixed record on activism.

title: Russia risks "imminent" default on its debt, Wall Street analysts say
summary: Russia is facing an "imminent" default on its debt due to groaning under Western sanctions, according to credit ratings agencies and Wall Street firms. Fitch downgraded Russia's debt for the second time in a week, citing the high likelihood of default and the impact of sanctions on its ability and willingness to repay. With $700 million in payments due in March and a 30-day grace period, a default could occur as early as mid-April, further isolating Russia from international financial flows.

title: Regulators put UnitedHealth-Change Healthcare Merger on Life Support
summary: The Department of Justice has filed a lawsuit to block UnitedHealth Group's $13 billion acquisition of Change Healthcare, Inc., disagreeing with the companies' claim that the merger would benefit consumers through streamlined healthcare processes and reduced costs. The DOJ argues that the deal would allow UnitedHealth to gain unfair access to competitors' sensitive information and control healthcare technology innovations, highlighting a shift in antitrust enforcement under the Biden administration.

title: Safehold Announces Public Offering and Concurrent Private Placement
summary: Safehold Inc. announced a public offering of 1,750,000 shares of its common stock, with underwriters having an option to purchase an additional 262,500 shares. Concurrently, Safehold will sell shares to iStar Inc. in a private placement. The net proceeds will be used for additional ground lease investments, to repay borrowings, and for general corporate purposes.

title: SunTrust Bank Permanently Closed
summary: The SunTrust bank branch at 8700 Georgia Ave. in downtown Silver Spring has permanently closed following the consolidation of operations into Truist after BB&T Bank acquired SunTrust in 2019. This closure is part of Truist's "core conversion" process, which has led to some customer issues, including temporary loss of access to debit cards and bank accounts. These conversions are affecting all former BB&T and SunTrust customers as they transition to Truist products and digital platforms.

title: List of Banks and Lenders with SBA Loan Guarantee Agreements
summary: This article provides a comprehensive list of banks and lenders in New Hampshire that offer small business loans under SBA loan guarantee agreements. It details contact information including addresses, phone numbers, and websites for each institution. The list serves as a valuable resource for small businesses seeking financing options in the region.

title: Zevia Announces Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2021 Results
summary: Zevia PBC reported strong financial results for the fourth quarter and full year 2021, with net sales increasing by 23% and 26% respectively, driven by broad-based volume gains. The company outlined its strategic plan for continued growth, including channel expansion and innovation, and provided optimistic net sales guidance for 2022. Despite inflationary pressures impacting gross margin, Zevia maintained its commitment to providing affordable, zero-sugar, plant-based beverages and demonstrated significant progress in its ESG metrics.

title: Bank of America, Capital One Rake In Billions While Denying Customers COVID Hardship Relief
summary: Bank of America and Capital One are facing class-action lawsuits for allegedly denying customers COVID-19 hardship relief despite promising assistance. The lawsuits claim the banks continued to charge late fees and interest while generating billions in revenue, breaching good faith and violating consumer protection laws. Plaintiffs seek restitution for fees and damages, arguing the banks failed to provide meaningful financial aid during the pandemic.

title: Waterstone Mortgage Review: Home Purchase Loan Experts Who Strive to Close On Time
summary: This article reviews Waterstone Mortgage, highlighting its unique position as a subsidiary of a large bank with a local feel, offering an expansive range of loan products. It emphasizes their expertise in home purchase loans, especially in competitive markets, and their commitment to timely closings while noting the absence of online rate disclosures as a potential drawback.

title: Celanese to buy DuPont’s materials arm for $11 billion
summary: Celanese Corp. has agreed to acquire the majority of DuPont de Nemours Inc.'s mobility and materials arm for $11 billion in cash, marking Celanese's largest-ever acquisition. This strategic move aims to establish Celanese as a leading global specialty materials company, expecting to generate significant synergies and boost earnings per share by 2026. DuPont plans to use the proceeds to fund its acquisition of Rogers Corp. and other M&A opportunities, as it transforms into a company focused on electronics, automotive, and water and industrial technologies.

title: MoneyGram Enters into Agreement to be Acquired by Madison Dearborn Partners
summary: MoneyGram International, Inc. announced a definitive agreement to be acquired by funds affiliated with Madison Dearborn Partners, LLC for $11.00 per share in an all-cash transaction valued at approximately $1.8 billion. This acquisition aims to accelerate MoneyGram's digital growth strategy and strengthen its market-leading cross-border capabilities. The transaction is expected to close in the fourth quarter of 2022, after which MoneyGram will become a private company.

title: Axis Bank set to buy Citigroup’s India retail unit
summary: Axis Bank is reportedly close to acquiring Citigroup Inc’s retail banking business in India for an estimated $2.5 billion. The agreement is expected to be announced within weeks, pending RBI approval, with Axis Bank prioritizing job security for current Citigroup employees. This acquisition follows Citigroup's announcement last year to exit its consumer banking business in India as part of a global strategic review.

title: WSJ News Exclusive | Regulators Probe Block Trading at Morgan Stanley, Goldman, Other Wall Street Firms
summary: Federal investigators, including the SEC and Justice Department, are probing block trading practices at Wall Street firms like Morgan Stanley and Goldman Sachs. The investigation focuses on whether bankers improperly tipped off hedge-fund clients about large share sales before public disclosure. Regulators are examining communication records and trading activities to determine if funds benefited from such insider information.

title: Axis Bank set to buy Citigroup’s India retail unit
summary: Axis Bank is nearing a deal to acquire Citigroup’s India retail banking business for an estimated $2.5 billion. The agreement, expected to be announced in the coming weeks, is contingent on approval from the Reserve Bank of India and would include a cash component of less than $2 billion after accounting for liabilities. This move is part of Citigroup CEO Jane Fraser's restructuring efforts to exit retail banking in 13 countries and focus on high-growth businesses.

title: Australia drops landmark cartel case against Citi, Deutsche Bank
summary: Australian prosecutors have dropped a landmark cartel case against Citigroup and Deutsche Bank, along with several former executives, concluding there were no longer reasonable prospects of conviction. The case, which centered on a 2015 share issue worth $1.8bn, would have been the country's biggest white-collar criminal trial and challenged the practices of investment banks in capital raisings. The banks and individuals involved maintained their innocence, stating they acted responsibly and in the interest of clients.

title: Pinnacle Expands to North Fulton County in Atlanta
summary: Pinnacle Financial Partners is expanding its operations to North Fulton County in Atlanta, establishing a temporary presence and planning a full-service location for summer. The firm has hired a team of banking veterans, led by Scott Jordan as area manager, to serve clients in North Fulton, Gwinnett, and Forsyth Counties. This expansion is part of Pinnacle's broader growth strategy in Atlanta, building on its entry into the market two years prior.

title: JPMorgan Chase: Driving Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
summary: JPMorgan Chase is leveraging its supply chain to drive diversity, equity, and inclusion, particularly focusing on supporting Black, Hispanic, and Latino suppliers through a US$30bn commitment to close the racial wealth gap. The firm aims to increase diverse supplier spend by US$6bn, with US$1.2bn dedicated to Black, Hispanic, and Latino-owned businesses, and is developing initiatives like a cyber-readiness program with TruSight and a grant program to help diverse businesses meet industry requirements. These efforts demonstrate JPMorgan Chase's commitment to making diversity an integral part of its procurement strategy and fostering inclusive growth within the business community.

title: JPMorgan Chase: Driving Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
summary: JPMorgan Chase is leveraging its supply chain and a US$30 billion commitment to enhance diversity, equity, and inclusion, particularly for Black, Hispanic, and Latino suppliers. The firm aims to increase spending with diverse businesses, requiring its top suppliers to do the same, and is addressing barriers such as cyber-readiness and access to capital through new programs and partnerships. These initiatives are designed to foster economic inclusion and drive cultural shifts across the business community.

title: OCC approves national bank charter applications of fintech company
summary: The Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC) has conditionally approved applications from Social Finance Inc. (SoFi) to establish SoFi Bank, National Association. This move brings SoFi under federal bank regulatory supervision, subjecting it to comprehensive regulations including the Community Reinvestment Act. The approval requires the new bank not to engage in crypto-asset activities, and SoFi Technologies is seeking to become a bank holding company.

title: Survey: Financial Advisors Increasingly Allocating to Crypto
summary: A new survey by Bitwise Asset Management and ETF Trends reveals that financial advisors are increasingly integrating crypto into client portfolios, with 15% already doing so and an additional 14% planning to this year. The trend is driven by high client interest, as 94% of advisors fielded crypto questions in 2021, and personal crypto holdings by nearly half of advisors. Despite concerns about volatility and regulatory uncertainty, many advisors anticipate significant growth in Bitcoin's value and prefer spot Bitcoin ETFs over futures-based alternatives for investment.

title: Truist reduces overdraft fees, joining other big banks
summary: Truist Bank announced it is reducing overdraft fees and implementing new checking account options to better serve vulnerable customers, expecting to save customers $300 million annually by 2024. This move follows similar actions by other major banks like Bank of America, Wells Fargo, Capital One, and Ally Bank, indicating an industry-wide shift away from reliance on overdraft fees. The bank plans to introduce a new checking account with a $100 buffer and a line of credit, along with a product for unbanked individuals that prevents overdrawing.

title: NewcrestImage portfolio sale completed; Aimbridge to manage
summary: Summit Hotel Properties Inc. has completed the initial closing of its portfolio acquisition from NewcrestImage affiliates, with NewcrestImage transferring hotel management rights to Aimbridge Hospitality and gaining a minority stake in Aimbridge. This collaboration aims for growth, with NewcrestImage developing new hotels and Aimbridge expanding its operator services. The transaction involved 26 hotels initially, totaling $776.5 million for the portfolio, and is expected to be immediately accretive to adjusted FFO per share for Summit.

title: JANELLE CURTIS NAMED CHIEF ENTERPRISE TRANSFORMATION OFFICER FOR WARNER MUSIC GROUP
summary: Janelle Curtis has been appointed as Chief Enterprise Transformation Officer for Warner Music Group. Her role will focus on driving tech-enabled evolution across the company's global corporate operations, business structures, processes, and digital solutions. Curtis brings extensive experience from Bank of America and Goldman Sachs to her new position.

title: These 14 bank stocks are in the best position to benefit from rising interest rates
summary: This article identifies 14 bank stocks poised to benefit from rising interest rates, based on a screen of various banks. It highlights Huntington Bancshares Inc. (HBAN) as a top performer expected to significantly increase its earnings per share through 2023, outpacing the S&P 500 Index. The piece delves into why these select few banks are projected to achieve double-digit earnings growth.

title: Bank OZK to Offer Peachtree Branch in Atlanta
summary: Bank OZK of Little Rock is expanding its presence in Atlanta's $115 billion-deposit market by opening its second full-service branch at 3215 Peachtree Road NE. Despite minimal deposits in Atlanta, Bank OZK holds the 10th-biggest total in Georgia with $5.7 billion and operates 68 full-service locations in the state, second only to Arkansas. Concurrently, Bank OZK is selling its Magnolia office to Peoples Bank of Magnolia for approximately $7.1 million.

title: Citigroup prepares to fire unvaccinated employees at the end of January. (Published 2022)
summary: Citigroup announced it will dismiss unvaccinated employees by the end of January, requiring all U.S. staff to submit proof of vaccination by January 14 or face unpaid leave and termination by January 31. This mandate is among the strictest on Wall Street, with over 90% of Citi's U.S. employees already complying, while other major banks have varying policies. The decision comes amidst broader discussions about vaccine mandates for large employers, with some employees resisting the policy.

title: Subsidiarias de peruana Urbanova reciben préstamo de 190 millones de dólares
summary: Subsidiaries of the Peruvian real estate company Urbanova secured a $190 million secured loan from a syndicate of banks to refinance a previous credit. The beneficiaries, Inmuebles Limatambo, Inversiones San Borja, and Urbanizadora Jardín, used the funds to repay an earlier loan and backed the new credit with a mortgage on their properties. Legal counsel for the transaction included Simpson Thacher & Bartlett and Rodrigo, Elías & Medrano Abogados for Urbanova, and Clifford Chance and Garrigues for the syndicate of banks led by Banco Santander.

title: Analyst Coverage | Investor Relations | Workday
summary: This Workday Investor Relations page lists the research analysts who cover the company. It explicitly states that analyst opinions, estimates, and forecasts are their own and do not represent Workday's views or endorsement. The page provides a comprehensive list of firms and their respective analysts covering Workday.

title: Pinnacle Financial Partners Opens Full-Service Office in Huntersville
summary: Pinnacle Financial Partners has opened a new full-service office in Huntersville, NC, expanding its presence in Mecklenburg County with a team of veteran financial services professionals. The new office at 16633 Birkdale Commons offers a full range of banking and financial services, building on Pinnacle's significant growth in the greater Charlotte MSA. The team includes new additions and experienced advisors, solidifying Pinnacle's commitment to community-focused service with comprehensive financial solutions.

title: Cementos Pacasmayo recibe préstamo por 214,6 millones de dólares
summary: Cementos Pacasmayo has secured a medium-term loan of up to $214.6 million (860 million soles) from Scotiabank del Perú and Banco de Crédito del Perú. Miranda & Amado Abogados advised Credicorp Capital Servicios Financieros and Scotiabank del Perú as structuring agents. The company, a major cement producer in northern Peru, did not disclose the intended use of the funds.

title: Regions Financial Corp. stock rises Tuesday, outperforms market
summary: Regions Financial Corp. (RF) saw its stock rise 4.46% on Tuesday, closing at $23.68, outperforming the mixed market performance where the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose and the S&P 500 Index fell. The stock also surpassed several competitors and closed just below its 52-week high, with trading volume exceeding its 50-day average. This marks the second consecutive day of gains for the company.

title: Leveraged Muni Funds Face Losses as Bond Rout Drags On
summary: Leveraged municipal bond funds are experiencing double-digit losses due to the worst bond rout in decades. Rising interest rates are impacting fund-share prices and reducing income payouts to investors. High net worth households had previously invested in these closed-end muni mutual funds, which hold approximately $60 billion, seeking tax-free income.

title: 36% of Americans Took On Holiday Debt, Averaging $1,249
summary: A LendingTree survey found that 36% of Americans accumulated holiday debt in 2021, averaging $1,249, a 10% decrease from the previous year, despite a higher percentage of borrowers. Parents with young children and millennials were the most likely to incur debt, and credit cards remained the most popular method for borrowing, though buy now, pay later options also saw significant use. The article also provides advice on how to pay off holiday debt, suggesting budgeting, balance transfer credit cards, and personal loans.

title: Goldman Sachs will require U.S. employees to get booster shots
summary: Goldman Sachs will require its U.S. employees and visitors to receive COVID-19 booster shots to enter its offices starting next year. The bank will also mandate twice-weekly COVID testing for staff beginning in January. This policy comes amidst a surge in COVID-19 infections across the United States.

title: Capital One Is Nation’s No. 1 Bank in Customer Satisfaction, Says JD Power
summary: Capital One has been named the top retail bank in the US for overall customer satisfaction for the second consecutive year by J.D. Power, outscoring eight other national banks. The study highlights convenience, tailored account offerings, and helping customers save time or money as core drivers of satisfaction, with Capital One's elimination of overdraft fees cited as a key personalizing move. The bank achieved a score of 692 out of 1,000, performing highest in digital channels, helping customers save money, and flexible banking options.

title: The ultimate 2022 safety play could be in this unusual place, traders say
summary: In 2022, some traders believe the high-yield bond market could be a surprising safe haven, with Tocqueville Asset Management's John Petrides suggesting short-duration high-yield corporate bond ETFs like SHYG. However, Inside Edge Capital Management's Todd Gordon is more cautious, proposing an options strategy involving SPY with puts and calls to balance market participation with downside protection. The discussion comes as traditional safe havens like gold have underperformed, and new fears regarding inflation and the omicron variant emerge, although recent studies suggest lower hospitalization risks.

title: Goldman Sachs, Lincoln Harris, Honeywell JV Sells Newest Charlotte Legacy Union Office Building
summary: A joint venture involving Goldman Sachs, Lincoln Harris, and Honeywell has sold the Honeywell Global Corporate headquarters building at Charlotte Legacy Union to real estate investment management company PRP. The newly completed 23-story building, which houses Honeywell's global headquarters, features 330,000 square feet of Class A office space and an array of modern amenities and technologies. This sale highlights Charlotte's appeal for major corporations, further evidenced by Honeywell's positive remarks on its relocation to the city.

title: Wells Fargo delays plans for employee return to office amid Omicron surge
summary: Wells Fargo has delayed its plans for employees to return to the office due to the spreading Omicron variant, becoming the latest bank to adjust its pandemic-era staffing strategies. The bank, which had previously set a mandatory return date of January 10 for many employees, stated it would announce new plans for a full return in the new year. Other financial institutions like Bank of America and Citigroup have also allowed New York City employees to work from home during the holidays, while Goldman Sachs initially maintained its in-office policy.

title: Goldman Sachs Asset Management, Lincoln Harris and Honeywell Sell 374,000-Square-Foot Honeywell Global Corporate HQ at Charlotte's Legacy Union to PRP Real Estate Investment Management
summary: A fund managed by Goldman Sachs Asset Management's Real Estate business, Lincoln Harris, and Honeywell International Inc. have sold the 374,000-square-foot Honeywell Global Corporate Headquarters at Charlotte's Legacy Union to PRP Real Estate Investment Management. The 23-story building, which opened earlier this year, is the global headquarters of Fortune 100 technology company Honeywell International Inc., which is in the first year of a 15-year lease. Lincoln Harris will continue to manage and lease the property, which is located in a prime Charlotte location.

title: Bank of America says New York employees may work from home over holidays
summary: Bank of America announced that its New York-based employees can work from home during the holidays due to the spreading Omicron variant. The bank will also provide free COVID-19 test kits and offer booster shots, following similar measures by other financial firms like Citigroup and JPMorgan Chase. This comes as financial institutions adjust plans amid rising coronavirus infections and the World Health Organization warns about the Omicron variant's rapid spread.

title: Bank of America Tells NYC Staff They Can Work From Home Over Holiday Weeks
summary: Bank of America has informed its New York-based employees that they have the option to work from home during the upcoming holiday weeks amidst a new surge in Covid-19 outbreaks. The bank is also providing free Covid-19 tests to staff and promoting safety precautions as Wall Street deals with the evolving pandemic situation.

title: Credit Suisse hires new global power and renewables head from BofA
summary: Credit Suisse has appointed Mike Dunne from Bank of America Corp as its new global head of power and renewables investment banking. Dunne, previously a managing director at Bank of America Merrill Lynch, will be based in New York and report to Rob Santangelo and Randy Bayless. This hiring follows Credit Suisse's recent $5.5 billion loss from its exposure to Archegos.

title: WSFS launches $2.3M ad campaign for Bryn Mawr deal, despite it not yet closing
summary: WSFS Financial has initiated a $2.3 million advertising campaign for its planned merger with Bryn Mawr Bank Corp., even though the deal has not yet closed. The campaign targets major transit hubs indoors. Justin Dunn, WSFS chief marketing officer, stated that Bryn Mawr Trust will be the prominent brand for the combined bank's wealth management division.

title: Libya launches asset hunt to restore billions of dollars, authorities say it could be largest in history
summary: The Libyan government has sought permission to subpoena records from several major US banks, including JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Citigroup Inc., in an effort to recover billions of dollars allegedly looted by former dictator Mummar Al Qaddafi. The Libyan Asset Recovery and Management Office (LARMO) estimates that tens of billions of dollars remain missing and states this could be the largest international asset recovery in history. LARMO, established in 2017 with UN and EU support, aims to track money stolen through corrupt deals and embezzlement during Qaddafi's era.

title: How market shift is hitting jobs at Bank of America
summary: Bank of America is adjusting its employee headcount due to market shifts, changing client preferences, and a need for efficiency in the post-pandemic era. These adjustments impact jobs at the Charlotte-based financial institution.

title: Bank of America exec reflects on decades-long career, major accomplishments and what follows retirement
summary: Andrea Smith, the outgoing chief administrative officer at Bank of America, recently discussed her long banking career and future plans as she approaches retirement. She reflected on her major accomplishments during her tenure and what she plans to do next. Smith was also recognized with the 2021 Citizen of the Carolinas Award for her contributions.

title: How Bank of America's leadership changes, tech investments have set it up for a big year in 2022
summary: Bank of America is positioned for significant growth in 2022 due to strategic leadership changes and continued substantial investments in technology. The bank anticipates benefiting from rising interest rates, which are expected to positively impact its margins while expanding its diverse loan and investment portfolio.

title: Metro Phoenix Bank, one of the few banks based in Arizona, to be acquired by North Dakota chain
summary: Metro Phoenix Bank (MPHX), one of the few banks headquartered in Arizona and founded in 2007, is set to be acquired by North Dakota's Alerus Financial Corporation (ALRS). This acquisition by an out-of-state bank continues a long-standing pattern of financial institutions gaining a foothold in the growing Phoenix market through such deals. The transaction is anticipated to conclude in early 2021.

title: Bank of America Takes Loyalty to New Levels with Expanded Preferred Rewards, New Premium Rewards Elite Credit Card and Partner Rewards Program
summary: Bank of America has announced significant enhancements to its loyalty programs, introducing new Diamond and Diamond Honors tiers to its Preferred Rewards program for high-net-worth clients. The bank also launched the new Premium Rewards Elite credit card offering luxury travel and lifestyle benefits, and is expanding its Loyalty and Rewards Program with a new Partner Rewards initiative for exclusive merchant discounts. These updates aim to provide greater value, personalized experiences, and more choices for clients across their banking relationships.

title: Volatility Strikes Bank Stocks, but Optimism Remains
summary: Despite recent volatility caused by the Omicron variant, bank stocks are poised for a strong performance in 2022 due to the prospect of rising interest rates and inflation. The MSCI ACWI Banks Industry index is up 23% for the year, with the KBW Nasdaq Bank Index significantly outperforming the S&P 500. Investors can leverage this optimism with ETFs like the Direxion Daily Financial Bull 3X ETF (FAS).

title: CEMEX recibe financiamiento sindicado vinculado a la sostenibilidad por 3.250 millones de dólares
summary: CEMEX secured a $3.25 billion syndicated sustainability-linked financing, comprising a term loan and a revolving credit facility, both with five-year terms. This financing will be used to repay a previous loan and fund general corporate purposes, marking a significant step towards CEMEX's investment-grade objective and its carbon-neutral strategy. The deal involved 21 financial institutions and multiple legal advisors for both CEMEX and the lenders.

title: Board Approves New and Interim Investment Sub-Advisory Agreements for First Trust Enhanced Equity Income Fund
authors: First Trust Advisors L.P. via Business Wire
summary: The Board of Trustees for the First Trust Enhanced Equity Income Fund has approved a new investment sub-advisory agreement with Chartwell Investment Partners LLC, subject to shareholder approval, due to Chartwell's parent company, TriState Capital Holdings, being acquired by Raymond James. An interim agreement was also approved to prevent service interruption during the transition, with both agreements being substantially similar to the existing one. The acquisition is not expected to affect the fund's daily operations or portfolio managers.

title: This big bank is getting rid of overdraft fees, saving customers $150 million a year
summary: Capital One Bank announced it will eliminate overdraft fees and penalties for non-sufficient funds on all its accounts, effective early next year. This move makes Capital One the first major bank to do so, potentially saving customers $150 million annually. The decision comes amidst increased scrutiny by the U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and consumer groups regarding overdraft fee practices, which disproportionately affect low-income customers.

title: Santander Chile es destacado a nivel local como “Mejor Banco del Año” por The Banker
summary: Santander Chile was named "Best Bank of the Year" by The Banker, an award also received by other Group entities in Brazil, Argentina, and Portugal, as well as a continental award for America. The British magazine highlighted Santander's commitment to financial inclusion and digitalization in Latin America, recognizing initiatives like Superdigital and the success of Santander Life in Chile. The bank's leadership emphasized working towards progress for people and companies, improving processes, and focusing on effective solutions, as well as its significant role in financing renewable energy projects and sustainable initiatives across the region.

title: Capital One is the first big bank to get rid of overdraft fees
summary: Capital One became the first major US bank to eliminate all overdraft and non-sufficient funds fees, effective immediately. This move makes Capital One, the sixth-largest retail bank, a pioneer among top-tier financial institutions in ending these charges, which have drawn criticism from consumer advocacy groups and lawmakers for burdening vulnerable customers. The decision is expected to put pressure on other large banks to follow suit or risk regulatory action, as these fees have historically generated billions in revenue for the industry.

title: No More Overdraft Fees? Capital One Becomes First Large Bank To Pledge End To Fines
summary: Capital One announced it will eliminate all overdraft fees for retail customers, becoming the largest bank to do so. This move is expected to cost the company $150 million in lost revenue but aligns with pressure from critics and smaller banks to end practices that disproportionately affect vulnerable consumers. Other banks like Ally have also ended overdraft fees, while some, such as PNC and Bank of America, have introduced features to help prevent overdrafts.

title: Tompkins Mahopac Bank Adds Surprise Gift to Banksgiving Donations
summary: Tompkins Mahopac Bank celebrated its annual "Banksgiving" by donating $7,500 to three Hudson Valley nonprofits focused on food insecurity: Dutchess Outreach, Feeding Westchester, and Second Chance Foods. This year, the bank added three surprise $1,000 donations to nonprofits chosen by its employees, namely Sparrow’s Nest of Wappingers Falls, Pawling Resource Center, and Gullotta House of Briarcliff Manor. These additional gifts aim to support causes important to their employees and further help communities during a challenging time.

title: Is UWM’s plan to shed the “meme stock” label?
summary: United Wholesale Mortgage (UWM) is reducing the Ishbia family's ownership stake to 90.6% by selling 50 million Class A common shares. This move aims to increase public float, attract long-term institutional investors, and shed the "meme stock" label, despite potential short-term stock price decline. The company also announced plans to borrow $500 million and continues its stock buyback program to maintain investor confidence and stability.

title: Banks that helped GE, others bulk up now profit from break-ups
summary: A Reuters analysis reveals that some Wall Street banks, including Goldman Sachs, JPMorgan, and UBS, are now profiting from the break-ups of conglomerates like GE, Toshiba, and Johnson & Johnson, after previously advising them on acquisitions. Banks have earned over $1 billion from global spin-offs this year, nearly doubling last year's figures. The article highlights how these banks are paid to undo deals they once helped create, prompting questions about independent advice and the incentives within the banking industry.

title: Expensify Announces Closing of Initial Public Offering and Exercise in Full of the Underwriters’ Option to Purchase Additional Shares
summary: Expensify, Inc. announced the closing of its initial public offering of over 11 million shares of its Class A common stock, including the full exercise of the underwriters' option to purchase additional shares. The shares were offered at $27.00 per share and are listed on The Nasdaq Global Select Market under the ticker symbol "EXFY." J.P. Morgan Securities LLC, Citigroup Global Markets Inc., and BofA Securities acted as joint lead bookrunning managers for the offering.

title: U.S. Bank pledges net-zero emissions by 2050, in a first among regionals
summary: U.S. Bank has pledged to achieve net-zero greenhouse-gas emissions by 2050, including financed emissions, becoming the first large regional bank in the U.S. to do so. The bank also committed $50 billion by 2030 for environmentally positive projects and joined the Partnership for Carbon Accounting Financials to standardize carbon footprint measurement. This initiative aligns U.S. Bank with larger financial institutions already committed to similar environmental goals.

title: Gen Z Set to Adopt Fintech Apps at Record Rates: 155% Growth from 2020 to 18.9 Billion Sessions in 2022
summary: Gen Z is rapidly adopting fintech apps, with usage growing 155% from 2020 to 18.9 billion sessions in 2022. Cryptocurrencies are a significant driver of this increase, with Robinhood, Coinbase, and Wellbull Stocks being top crypto-trading apps among US Gen Z and Millennial users. This presents an unprecedented opportunity for financial institutions to engage mobile-first Gen Z users and cultivate loyalty as they approach financial independence.

title: Whittier Daily News: Local News, Sports, Things to Do - Expensify Announces Pricing of Initial Public Offering
summary: Expensify, a payments superapp, announced the pricing of its initial public offering, offering 9,730,776 shares of Class A common stock at $27.00 per share. The company expects to raise approximately $70.4 million from its portion of the offering, with shares set to trade on Nasdaq under the ticker "EXFY" starting November 10, 2021. J.P. Morgan Securities LLC, Citigroup Global Markets Inc., and BofA Securities are lead bookrunning managers for the offering.

title: Bank of America to shutter three local branches next year as it reassesses footprint
summary: Bank of America Corp. is set to close three of its local branches in the Charlotte area, as part of a larger closure of seven branches across North Carolina. The financial institution is reassessing its physical footprint, indicating a strategic shift in its branch operations. This move comes as the bank continues to be headquartered in Charlotte.

title: Methanex Egypt Announces the Early Settlement of its Joint Venture Financing Facility
summary: Methanex Egypt has announced the full and early settlement of its US$530 million EMethanex Joint Venture project financing facility. This collaboration spanned 15 years with an international and local banking consortium, enabling a US$1 billion investment in Damietta for their methanol production plant. The early settlement marks a significant milestone, highlighting the venture's successful financial management despite economic challenges.

title: Trii ofrece gratis 1.500 transacciones del fondo bursátil Hcolsel de Global X en la bolsa
summary: Trii is offering 1,500 free transactions for the Hcolsel ETF from Global X on the Colombian Stock Exchange, along with cashbacks and referral codes. This initiative follows the recent authorization for Trii to allow trading of international stocks in Colombia, including major US and Chilean companies. The Hcolsel ETF itself is composed of significant Colombian companies like Ecopetrol and Bancolombia.

title: Avidia Bank welcomes new branch manager for newest location | Hudson
summary: Avidia Bank has appointed Dominique Jean-Pierre as the new manager for its recently opened Hudson branch at 196 Washington St. Jean-Pierre brings eight years of management experience from Bank of America and is involved in community efforts with the Boys and Girls Clubs of MetroWest and the Hudson Food Pantry. This new location, a relocation from 221 Washington St., offers various banking services and maintains familiar staff.

title: Schwab CEO Defends PFOF, Claims It Nets Investors Better Pricing
summary: Charles Schwab CEO Walt Bettinger defended his firm's use of payment for order flow (PFOF), asserting that it has resulted in better pricing for investors and lowered commissions, despite concerns about conflicts of interest raised by SEC Chairman Gary Gensler. Bettinger argued that PFOF provides economic value and that outlawing it would merely transfer that value elsewhere. Gensler, however, remains focused on potential conflicts, especially regarding how PFOF might incentivize increased trading or steer investors toward riskier accounts.

title: Jefferies hires senior bankers for financials investment banking -memo
summary: Jefferies Financial Group has bolstered its investment banking unit by hiring senior bankers from rivals such as JPMorgan Chase & Co and Barclays PLC. Matthias Kristol will lead asset and wealth management investment banking globally, and Aaron Bruker will head sidecars and third-party capital. These hires are part of Jefferies' strategy to capitalize on record-breaking mergers and acquisitions activity.

title: First Horizon Corporation to Participate in the Bank of America 2021 Banking and Financials Conference
summary: First Horizon Corporation announced that its President of Regional Banking and interim Chief Financial Officer, Anthony Restel, will participate in the Bank of America 2021 Banking and Financials Conference on November 9, 2021. A live webcast and audio replay of the event will be accessible via their investor relations website. The company also provided an overview of its operations and financial standing, emphasizing its commitment to various stakeholders.

title: Bank of America to seek approval for securities firm in China - Bloomberg News
summary: Bank of America is reportedly planning to file an application to establish a securities firm in China as part of its strategy to expand into the country's growing financial services market. This move follows similar actions by other major Western banks like JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs, leveraging China's loosened rules for foreign banks to operate fully-controlled businesses. The expansion into China's multi-trillion-dollar financial sector is driven by lucrative underwriting fees and the prospect of full ownership of business units.

title: Citigroup is the first big U.S. bank to mandate vaccination for its workers. (Published 2021)
summary: Citigroup has become the first major U.S. bank to mandate Covid-19 vaccination as a condition of employment for its workers. The decision was prompted by the bank's business with the federal government, requiring compliance with President Biden's executive order, and a desire to ensure employee health and safety. While Citi will consider medical and religious exemptions, other large banks have only required vaccination for office entry, not as a condition of employment.

title: BofA Launches Account Validation To Assist Clients With Fraud Prevention
summary: Bank of America has launched Account Validation, a new fraud prevention service designed for corporate and public sector clients. This service allows clients to verify the status of an account and authenticate the account owner before initiating electronic credit or debit payments, aiming to combat rising fraud and misdirected payments. The solution, supported by Early Warning Services, LLC, responds to inquiries in near real-time and helps companies comply with industry rules.

title: Document
summary: Phillips 66 announced its agreement to acquire all publicly held common units of Phillips 66 Partners in an all-stock transaction valued at approximately $3.4 billion. Each outstanding PSXP common unitholder will receive 0.50 shares of PSX common stock for each PSXP common unit. This acquisition is expected to streamline governance and corporate structure, with the transaction anticipated to close in the first quarter of 2022.

title: Goldman Sachs, Harvard team up with Al Gore’s investment firm
authors: Tasneem Brogger and Alastair Marsh and Bloomberg
summary: Al Gore's investment firm, Generation Investment Management LLP, is partnering with Goldman Sachs Asset Management, Microsoft Climate Innovation Fund, and Harvard Management Co. to launch "Just Climate." This new venture aims to channel capital into companies and projects focused on decarbonizing the economy, with the goal of limiting global warming to 1.5 degrees Celsius. The initiative highlights a shift from traditional ESG investing, which is seen as insufficient to address the urgent climate crisis, towards more direct "climate-led investing."

title: UBS CEO Unveils Plans for Self-Directed Channel in U.S.
summary: UBS Group AG CEO Ralph Hamers announced plans to launch a new self-directed service in the U.S. aimed at younger, mass affluent investors with $250,000 to $2 million in assets. This initiative targets employees served by UBS's corporate stock plan and retirement business, aiming to eventually transition them to full-service brokers. The move follows similar strategies by competitors and comes as Wealth Management Americas reported record third-quarter profits.

title: CEO Says Bank of America is a Technology Company
summary: Bank of America CEO Brian Moynihan stated at Yahoo Finance’s All Markets Summit that he views the bank as a financial technology company due to its extensive digital operations and significant technology investments. The company has seen substantial growth in digital banking users and transactions, incorporating features like Zelle and virtual assistant Erica. Bank of America's commitment to digital innovation has contributed to an 80% stock increase over the past three years.

title: BofA Appoints Three to Lead Global Mobility Investment Banking
summary: Bank of America Corp. has appointed Marco Chisari, Mark Garcia, and Patrick Steinemann to jointly lead its global mobility group. This trio will collaborate with other senior bankers, including Ray Wood, global head of natural resources investment banking, as part of the firm's strategic focus.

title: Choice Hotels Headquarters to Occupy Nearly Half of Upcoming Building in Pike & Rose
summary: Choice Hotels International, Inc. has signed a long-term lease for 105,000 square feet in the upcoming 915 Meeting Street building at Pike & Rose in North Bethesda, Maryland. This 276,000-square-foot trophy office building, targeting LEED Gold certification, will house approximately 400 Choice Hotels corporate employees starting December 2023. The move highlights the demand for office space in Federal Realty's mixed-use developments, which offer convenient locations and world-class amenities.

title: MainStreet Bank Unveils Avenu™ Platform to Serve Fintech Partners
summary: MainStreet Bank has launched its new Avenu™ platform, a technology solution designed to provide "Banking as a Service" (BaaS) for fintech partners. Avenu™ aims to streamline banking and payment needs for fintechs, helping them manage risk, meet compliance, and accept deposits. This initiative leverages MainStreet Bank's decade of experience in BaaS to serve the growing fintech market.

title: Deutsche Bank v Busto: The latest chapter in the Italian swaps saga
summary: The English High Court ruled that interest rate swaps between Deutsche Bank AG London and the Italian municipality Comune di Busto Arsizio were valid and binding, obliging Busto to continue payments until 2031. This decision is significant as it's the first time an English court has considered the application of the Italian Supreme Court's "Cattolica" decision on the validity of swaps under Italian law to an English law contract. The court addressed key issues including the capacity of Italian public bodies to execute swap contracts and the interpretation of the Cattolica decision.

title: Warren Buffett, Berkshire Hit $9 Billion Gain on Amex Stock This Year
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway has seen its investment in American Express (Amex) increase by $9 billion this year, bringing its total unrealized gain on the stock to $26 billion. Berkshire owns 19% of Amex, a position it has held since 1998, having only invested $1.3 billion initially. Amex is the third-largest holding in Berkshire's US stock portfolio, following Apple and Bank of America.

title: PAI Said Set to Hire BofA, Goldman, JPMorgan for Refresco Exit
summary: PAI Partners is reportedly preparing to hire Bank of America Corp., Goldman Sachs Group Inc., and JPMorgan Chase & Co. to advise on exit options for its bottling business, Refresco. The private equity firm may explore a U.S. initial public offering for Rotterdam-based Refresco as early as next year. PAI is also considering bringing in additional banks to assess various exit strategies, including a potential sale of the €6 billion bottler.

title: Minas Buenaventura emite bonos por 550 millones de dólares con el apoyo de García Sayán, Miranda & Amado y Milbank
summary: Compañía de Minas Buenaventura SAA, la principal minera de metales preciosos en Perú, ha emitido pagarés senior no garantizados por 550 millones de dólares. Los fondos se utilizarán para prepagar la deuda tributaria de la empresa y fortalecer su perfil crediticio, reduciendo costos y liberando líneas de crédito. La operación contó con el asesoramiento legal de Milbank LLP y García Sayán Abogados para Buenaventura, y Cleary, Gottlieb, Steen & Hamilton LLP y Miranda & Amado para los coordinadores globales de la emisión.

title: JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs start earnings season strong. (Published 2021)
summary: JPMorgan Chase and Goldman Sachs both significantly exceeded analysts' earnings expectations in the second quarter, signaling a strong start to earnings season. JPMorgan reported a profit of $11.9 billion, while Goldman Sachs earned nearly $5.5 billion, buoyed by increased consumer spending, robust business conditions, and a hot market for mergers and acquisitions. Both banks released significant funds from loan loss reserves, reflecting confidence in the economic rebound.

title: Goldman Sachs’s profit surges on record merger activity. (Published 2021)
summary: Goldman Sachs reported a significant surge in profit for the third quarter, fueled by record merger and acquisition activity and strong performance in equities trading. The Wall Street giant's earnings of $5.38 billion, or $14.93 a share, surpassed analysts' expectations, similar to other major banks like Bank of America, Morgan Stanley, Citigroup, and JPMorgan. CEO David M. Solomon highlighted strategic acquisitions and expressed optimism for an ongoing economic rebound despite lingering economic uncertainties.

title: Bank of America execs tout promising outlook as net interest income, loans start to improve
summary: Bank of America executives expressed confidence in the bank's year-end performance, driven by improving net interest income and quarterly progress in loans across various business lines. This positive outlook follows strong third-quarter results that surpassed analyst expectations.

title: BofA Tops Estimates as Surge in M&A Boosts Advisory Fees
summary: Bank of America (BofA) exceeded analysts' earnings estimates in the third quarter of 2021, primarily driven by a significant increase in investment-banking advisory fees. These fees surged by 65% to a record $654 million due to a robust period for mergers and acquisitions. Overall investment-banking fees for BofA rose by 23% to $2.2 billion.

title: Dallas firm Kosmos Energy sinks $550 million into buying Occidental’s Ghana oil assets
summary: Dallas-based Kosmos Energy Ltd. is partnering with Ghana National Petroleum Corp. to acquire Occidental Petroleum Corp.’s oil assets in Ghana for a combined $750 million, with Kosmos contributing $550 million. The deal allows Occidental to reduce debt and is expected to generate significant free cash flow for Kosmos. The article also discusses broader oil market dynamics, including OPEC's revised demand estimates and forecasts for crude prices.

title: Fidelity's HSA business grew 50% in a year
summary: Fidelity Investments Inc. saw its Health Savings Account (HSA) business grow by 50% over the past year, reaching $12 billion in assets by June, making it the third-biggest player in the market. The HSA market as a whole grew significantly, with total assets increasing by 26% to $92.9 billion, driven by strong market returns and increasing adoption of HSAs as investment vehicles. Despite growth and improvements, the report from Morningstar Inc. suggests there is still room for progress in reducing fees and improving investment options within HSAs.

title: Bitcoin and Crypto off to a Powerful Start In October
summary: Bitcoin and the broader cryptocurrency market are experiencing a strong recovery in October, driven by institutional adoption from major banks like Bank of America and U.S. Bank. The increasing popularity of decentralized finance (DeFi) and non-fungible tokens (NFTs) also contributes to this growth, attracting significant trading volumes and investor interest. The article highlights the Bitwise Crypto Industry Innovators ETF (BITQ) as a way for investors to gain exposure to the crypto ecosystem.

title: Opinion: Signage will deface Atlanta's second-tallest building, a Portman landmark
summary: An opinion piece discusses the controversial addition of large Truist bank signage to the former SunTrust Plaza, Atlanta's second-tallest building and a landmark designed by John Portman. The author and an anonymous industry observer express concern that these new, brightly lit signs are part of a growing trend that detracts from the architectural integrity of city skyscrapers. The article highlights similar signage controversies in Atlanta and Charlotte, advocating for stricter city regulations on building-top signage.

title: A Conservative Fund Targets Investors Who Want To Avoid ‘Woke’ Companies
summary: An investment professional created the American Conservative Values ETF (ACVF) for investors seeking to avoid "woke" companies, boycotting those deemed hostile to conservative values. Despite boycotting 27 companies, the ETF has nearly matched the S&P 500's performance in its first 11 months. The fund is considering expanding into bond and international funds, as well as mid-cap and small-cap options.

title: Bank of America names first president for Greater Cincinnati
summary: Bank of America has appointed Mark Ryan as its first market president for Greater Cincinnati, a move prompted by the company's significant growth in the region. This appointment highlights Bank of America's increasing presence and investment in the Cincinnati market.

title: Life Time Announces Pricing of Initial Public Offering - Oct 6, 2021
summary: Life Time Group Holdings, Inc. announced the pricing of its initial public offering of 39,000,000 shares of common stock at $18.00 per share. Shares are expected to begin trading on The New York Stock Exchange under the symbol "LTH" on October 7, 2021. The offering is expected to close on October 12, 2021, and includes a 30-day option for underwriters to purchase an additional 5,850,000 shares.
source: Life Time Healthy Way of Life
source_domain: Life Time Healthy Way of Life

title: Merrill workers who return to office and confirm vaccination can get $200
summary: Bank of America is offering $200 to Merrill Lynch Wealth Management branch employees who return to the office and confirm they are fully vaccinated against Covid-19. The incentive applies to client associates, administrative support, and operations staff who work in the office at least eight times between early October and mid-November. While not a mandate, the policy encourages vaccination and office return, with over 80% of Merrill's 25,000 employees already having volunteered their vaccination status or returned.

title: Bank of America raises U.S. minimum hourly wage to $21
summary: Bank of America announced on Wednesday a raise in its U.S. minimum hourly wage to $21, moving towards its promise of increasing pay to $25 an hour by 2025. This increase is part of a broader trend among major companies to boost employee wages, spurred by pandemic-fueled discussions on fair pay and competitive pressures. The bank has also urged its vendors to adopt a $15 an hour minimum wage, setting a higher standard compared to some competitors.

title: At a $2 Trillion Market Value, Saudi Aramco Races Apple for Most Valuable Company
summary: Saudi Aramco is nearing Apple Inc.'s market valuation, reaching $2 trillion due to surging energy prices, while Apple's value stands at $2.3 trillion. This shift reflects broader economic changes, with increasing oil demand benefiting Aramco and rising bond yields impacting tech stocks like Apple. Analysts suggest oil prices could climb further, potentially pushing Aramco's valuation even higher.

title: American Express American Airlines Business Extra Corporate Card review
summary: The American Airlines American Express® Business Extra Corporate Card offers benefits for business owners and employees who frequently fly American Airlines. While it lacks a generous welcome bonus, it provides a 6% rebate on eligible American Airlines airfares, Business Extra points, and airfare discounts, particularly appealing to companies without existing corporate contracts. The card's $75 annual fee can be easily offset by American Airlines airfare purchases, making it a valuable option for companies loyal to the airline.

title: As Interest Rates Rise, Leverage Financial Sector Strength
summary: The article discusses investment opportunities within the financial sector as the Federal Reserve signals rising interest rates in 2022. It highlights how rising rates benefit banks and the financial sector, suggesting the Direxion Daily Financial Bull 3X ETF (FAS) for leveraged plays. Despite potential dampening effects on mortgage demand, a hot housing sector and rising home prices could lead to larger loan amounts, balancing out this impact.

title: BofA Outage Shuts Out Thousands Online, Service Now Restored
summary: Bank of America (BAC) experienced a significant online banking outage on Friday, October 1, 2021, locking thousands of customers out of their accounts for several hours. The service disruption began in the morning and was fully resolved by 2 p.m. New York time, with both the website and app returning to full capacity.

title: AlphaSense Raises $180 Million Series C Led by Viking Global and Goldman Sachs, Joined by Morgan Stanley, Citi, Bank of America, Barclays, Wells Fargo, Cowen, AllianceBernstein
summary: AlphaSense, a leading market intelligence and search platform, announced a $180 million Series C financing round led by Viking Global Investors and Goldman Sachs, with participation from major financial institutions. This capital infusion will be used to further invest in product development, content expansion, customer support, and drive both organic growth and acquisitions. The company's AI and NLP-driven platform helps professionals make critical business decisions, and its customer base now includes a majority of S&P 500 companies.

title: Have Confidence in Treasury Notes Amid Rising Yields With VGSH
summary: As U.S. Treasury yields rise, fixed income investors are advised to consider strategies like shortening duration. The Vanguard Short-Term Treasury ETF (VGSH) is presented as a suitable option, offering exposure to short-term government bonds maturing in one to three years, thereby mitigating interest rate risk. Analysts predict continued increases in the 10-year Treasury yield, making short-duration ETFs like VGSH an attractive safe haven.

title: AES-Siemens joint venture Fluence joins raft of storage firms moving to go public
summary: Energy storage company Fluence, a joint venture between Siemens and AES, has filed for an initial public offering (IPO) to be listed on Nasdaq under "FLNC". This move follows increased investor interest in battery startups and marks Fluence's significant growth since its 2018 launch, including its AI platform and a recent $125 million investment from Qatar's sovereign wealth fund. The company joins several other storage firms that have recently gone public, capitalizing on the rising demand for energy storage solutions.

title: Instinct® FX - Forex Trading Platform & Solutions
summary: Instinct® FX is Bank of America's e-trading platform designed for sophisticated foreign exchange markets, offering a suite of FX e-trading solutions with algo strategies for efficient liquidity access and optimized execution. It emphasizes seamless integration of electronic and voice execution, deep liquidity from a diverse global franchise, and tools to minimize market impact. The platform provides adaptive and intuitive e-trading solutions, including algorithmic trading strategies, a dedicated execution desk, real-time TCA, and full-order functionality for swaps and options, supported by Bank of America's extensive financial expertise.

title: U.S. Bank Launches Full Service ESG Practice, Grows Sustainable Finance Team
summary: U.S. Bank has launched a new full-service ESG practice within its Fixed Income and Capital Markets business, driven by increasing demand for sustainable financing solutions. The bank also hired Ade Adedeji as Director for ESG FICM, and the new practice will be led by Marcus Martin, who emphasizes customized ESG solutions for clients. This move expands on U.S. Bank's previous ESG financing efforts and aims to increase positive impact with customers and society.

title: Fintech and traditional banks: competition or… symbiosis?
summary: This article examines the relationship between fintechs and traditional banks in the UK, questioning if it's competition or symbiosis. It analyzes customer usage of digital-only services versus traditional banking platforms, highlighting that while fintechs are growing, they often complement rather than replace traditional banks, especially among younger demographics. The author suggests that traditional banks still hold a massive audience and can leverage cross-selling strategies, indicating a more complex interaction than simple competition.

title: FreshWorks lists; valued at $13 billion
summary: Freshworks debuted on Nasdaq, with its shares surging 28% above the IPO price to reach a market value of $13 billion. This makes Freshworks the first India-born software-as-a-service firm to trade on a US exchange, setting a new valuation benchmark for Indian startups. The successful listing and strong investor interest highlight a new era for similar Indian companies looking to go public in the US.

title: At U.S. Bank under Cecere, doing a giant deal takes 'discipline'
summary: U.S. Bank CEO Andrew Cecere greenlit the company's largest deal in two decades: the $8 billion acquisition of MUFG Union Bank. Cecere emphasized a disciplined approach to mergers and acquisitions, stressing the importance of meaningful opportunities and aligning with U.S. Bank's growth strategy, particularly in the faster-growing West Coast market. The acquisition is expected to increase U.S. Bank's size by 20% and includes plans to integrate MUFG Union Bank's customer activity onto U.S. Bank's systems, despite initial IT risk management concerns.

title: Inside Wells Fargo’s multicloud strategy
summary: Wells Fargo is implementing a decade-long multicloud strategy, partnering with Microsoft and Google to modernize its technology infrastructure for public cloud operations. This approach, while different from some competitors, aims for portability, resilience, and avoids vendor lock-in, addressing the challenges of migrating highly regulated data and upskilling its workforce. The financial institution plans to progressively move existing applications to the public cloud, prioritizing impact over speed, with the ultimate goal of moving away from traditional data centers.

title: ON THE MOVE: Northern Trust Names Manioudakis CIO; Goldman Sachs Promotes Coleman to CFO
summary: Northern Trust Asset Management has appointed Angelo Manioudakis as its new Chief Investment Officer, bringing his extensive experience from other global financial firms. Concurrently, Goldman Sachs has promoted Denis P. Coleman III to Chief Financial Officer, succeeding Stephen M. Scherr who is set to retire. The article also details several other significant personnel changes across various financial institutions, including Crédit Agricole CIB, Triad Securities, BNY Mellon, OCC, Broadway Technology, and Canoe Intelligence.

title: Nueva simplificación de Grupo Aval en Centroamérica
summary: Grupo Aval is simplifying its structure in Central America by spinning off 75% of Leasing Bogotá S.A. Panamá (LBP), a subsidiary of Banco de Bogotá. This move will require a capital increase and is aimed at making decision-making more efficient and generating shareholder value. LBP plans to list its shares on the Colombian Stock Exchange, pending regulatory approvals.

title: Banking on the future
summary: Charlotte's largest banks are increasing their investments in diversity and inclusion, aiming to steadily add more women and minorities to executive teams and implement programs that promote internal talent. These efforts also include strategies to attract new, diverse candidates. The article highlights key figures from Bank of America, Fifth Third, and Truist involved in these initiatives.

title: Great Western Bank sells to competitor for $2B
summary: Great Western Bank, which operates two branches in the Kansas City area, has agreed to an all-stock merger with another regional bank, First Interstate Bank, in a deal valued at $2 billion. The combined entity is projected to hold more than $32 billion in assets, positioning it similarly in size to UMB Bank and Commerce Bank. This acquisition highlights ongoing consolidation within the regional banking sector.

title: Customer Care Giant TTEC Hit By Ransomware
summary: TTEC, a major customer care company for global brands, is experiencing network disruptions caused by a ransomware attack. The incident, believed to be from the Ragnar Locker group, has impacted thousands of employees and raised concerns about potential data exposure, though TTEC states client data generally is not maintained on their systems. Updates confirm the ransomware attack and the company's efforts to restore systems following the cybersecurity incident.

title: Analysts give take on Bank of America's management shake-up and what it means for CEO role
summary: Analysts are weighing in on Bank of America's recent management shake-up, which involved the most significant changes in over a decade. They believe these changes signal a strategic move for growth and the ascendance of the bank's next generation of executives, potentially impacting the future CEO role.

title: MetLife Names Michael Roberts as Chief Marketing Officer
summary: MetLife, Inc. announced the appointment of Michael Roberts as executive vice president and chief marketing officer, effective November 2, 2021. Roberts previously served as chief marketing officer for The Vanguard Group's Retail Investor Group and held leadership roles at Bank of America’s Merchant Services. He will be responsible for leading Global Brand and Marketing to advance MetLife's customer relationships and strategy.

title: RumbleOn closes on business combination with RideNow
summary: RumbleOn, a major powersports vehicle retailer, has completed its business combination with RideNow, acquiring 100% of its dealership portfolio. This merger aims to create the first omnichannel customer experience in powersports, leveraging RideNow's footprint and RumbleOn's technology to make powersport vehicles more accessible nationwide. The deal was funded through a public offering, a term loan from Oaktree Capital Management, and the issuance of RumbleOn Class B shares to RideNow equity holders.

title: Bank of America Overhauls Top Management Ranks - WSJ
summary: Bank of America announced a significant overhaul of its top leadership team, the largest in over a decade. The changes include installing new finance, technology, and legal chiefs, and adding three women to its senior ranks. This reshuffling follows the retirements of two longtime executives and aims to make room for a fresh batch of leaders.

title: Bank of America: Capital is beginning to abandon technology stocks and go to energy, materials and real estate
summary: A Bank of America Research Report indicates a shift in investor capital away from technology stocks and towards energy, materials, and real estate sectors. This shift is driven by rising inflation, with investors favoring these three sectors that are expected to benefit from inflationary pressures. Energy stocks attracted the most capital, while technology stocks experienced the largest outflows based on client fund tracking.

title: Bank of America taps new CFO, promotes three women to top roles
summary: Bank of America announced a significant management shake-up, replacing longtime CFO Paul Donofrio with Alastair Borthwick and promoting three women to senior leadership positions. CEO Brian Moynihan also indicated his intention to remain at the helm until the end of the decade. These changes come as Wall Street banks face pressure to diversify their top ranks.

title: Bank of America shakes up management team with C-level changes, new roles for local execs
summary: Bank of America Corp. announced significant changes to its management team, including C-level changes and new roles for local executives. The Charlotte-based bank made these announcements on September 10, 2021.

title: Dell launches highly rated, $1.2 billion equipment finance securitization
summary: Dell Inc. has launched a $1.21 billion asset-backed security deal, Dell Equipment Finance Trust 2021-2 (DEFT), backed by commercial leases and loans from Dell Financial Services. This transaction, structured into six tranches with high ratings, aims to mitigate concentration risk and follows a similar securitization earlier in the year. Fitch Ratings highlighted the high credit quality of the underlying collateral, with obligor concentrations notably lower than previous deals.

title: State Street expands with buyout of Brown Brothers’ custody unit for $3.5 billion
summary: State Street has announced an agreement to acquire the investor services division of Brown Brothers Harriman & Co. for $3.5 billion, aiming to expand its custody assets and enhance efficiency. This acquisition is expected to make State Street even larger globally, especially in Japan and Latin America, and integrate BBH's communications platform and 24/7 operating model. The deal is projected to yield $260 million in annual cost savings starting in the third year, despite a 3.7 percent drop in State Street's shares on the day of the announcement.

title: How she keeps Bank of America ahead of the curve on tech, innovation
summary: Cathy Bessant, chief operations and technology officer at Charlotte-based Bank of America Corp., discussed how technology impacts financial services and how the company maintains its innovative edge. She is the 2021 recipient of the CIO of the Year Awards’ Leadership ORBIE Award. Bessant shared insights with the Charlotte Business Journal regarding the factors influencing the bank's technology decisions.

title: Morgan Stanley bumps first-year pay to $110K to match Goldman Sachs
summary: Morgan Stanley is raising the salaries of first-year analysts in its institutional securities division to $110,000, matching Goldman Sachs for the highest entry-level pay among major banks. This marks the second pay increase in a month for first-year investment banking and global capital markets analysts, and second-year analysts will also see their pay rise to $125,000. The move comes as other banks, including JPMorgan Chase, Citi, Barclays, Deutsche Bank, Bank of America, and Wells Fargo, have also increased junior banker salaries following concerns about work-life balance.

title: Hedge Fund and Insider Trading News: David Rosen, Bill Ackman, Jana Partners, Magnetar Capital, Millennium Management, Alden Global Capital, America’s Car-Mart, Inc. (CRMT), Restaurant Brands International Inc (QSR), and More
summary: This article reports on several key hedge fund and insider trading activities, including Jana Partners urging Vonage to explore strategic alternatives, Bill Ackman's Pershing Square purchasing an additional stake in Universal Music Group, and Magnetar Capital appointing Stuart Davies as head of Business Development for Systematic Investing. It also highlights David Rosen's Rubric Capital's significant bet on natural gas and discusses how COVID-19 is reshaping the infrastructure market.

title: PNC raises hourly minimum wage to $18 amid labor shortage
summary: PNC Financial Services Group Inc. announced it will raise its hourly minimum wage to $18 from $15, effective November 22, 2021, to address labor shortages. This increase will also apply to staff from Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria SA who will join PNC after its acquisition of the Spanish bank's U.S. business in October. With this acquisition, PNC is set to become the fifth-largest U.S. bank.

title: Bank of America vice chairman to move into a new role
summary: Anne Finucane, vice chairman at Bank of America, will be moving into a new role. She has been with Bank of America and its predecessor, Fleet Bank, for 26 years.

title: EagleBank’s Ryan Riel, Tony Marquez Discuss Bank’s Role in DC Region
summary: EagleBank's Ryan Riel and Tony Marquez discuss the bank's role as a community builder and cornerstone lender in the Washington D.C. region's commercial real estate market. They detail their lending philosophy, recent notable deals, the impact of the pandemic on lending, and their bullish outlook on affordable housing and multifamily projects. The executives emphasize EagleBank's commitment to the community through development and revitalization efforts.

title: Two top execs at Bank of America to retire at year’s end
summary: Bank of America's Vice Chairman Anne Finucane and Chief Operating Officer Thomas Montag will retire from their positions at the end of the year. Both executives will take on advisory roles within the bank after their retirements; Finucane will become non-executive chairman at Bank of America Europe and Montag will join the Global Advisory Council. Succession plans for their current roles are expected to be announced in the coming weeks.

title: Bank of America vice chair and chief operating officer to retire at year’s end
summary: Bank of America announced on Thursday that its vice chairman and chief operating officer will both retire at the end of the year. These departures mark two senior changes within the bank's upper echelon. The company plans to name their successors in the coming weeks.

title: Para el CEO de Galicia, en Argentina el sistema financiero es ‘raquítico’ y ‘no hay moneda’
summary: Fabián Kon, CEO of Grupo Financiero Galicia, states that Argentina's financial system is "rickety" due to macroeconomic instability, high inflation, and lack of a stable local currency for savings. He emphasizes the need for a sustained economic plan focused on fiscal balance to revive credit to the private sector, which currently stands at less than 20% of GDP. Kon also discusses the challenges faced by banks through regulated rates, the need for financial inclusion, and the potential for a revaluation of Argentine assets given a credible economic plan.

title: Dutch Bros Inc. Announces Public Filing of Registration Statement for Proposed Initial Public Offering
summary: Dutch Bros Inc. announced the public filing of a registration statement on Form S-1 with the SEC for its proposed initial public offering of Class A common stock. The company intends to list its Class A common stock on The New York Stock Exchange under the symbol "BROS". BofA Securities, J.P. Morgan Securities LLC, Jefferies LLC, Barclays Capital Inc., and Piper Sandler & Co. are acting as lead book-running managers for the offering.

title: Citi Hires BofA M&A Banker, Moves LatAm Head of Equity to Brazil
summary: Citigroup Inc. is expanding its investment-banking and equity teams in Brazil due to a booming dealmaking market. Fabio Gheilerman, Citigroup's head of Latin America equities sales and trading, is relocating to Sao Paulo from New York, and Daniel Coradi joined as an M&A banker from Bank of America Corp. Citi also hired Claudia Guimaraes from Banco Bradesco SA to bolster its investment-banking team.

title: 5 reasons why AMD stock could rally more than 20% from here, according to Bank of America analyst
summary: A Bank of America analyst, Vivek Arya, believes AMD stock could rally more than 20% due to several factors, including the company's potential to expand gross margins and double earnings per share within the next two to three years. This projection comes after AMD shares have already seen a significant surge of over 50% in the last three months, and the stock is considered undervalued compared to other tech companies with similar growth.

title: Triumph Bancorp outgoing CFO Bryce Fowler reflects on a decade of building a bank
summary: Bryce Fowler, the outgoing CFO of Triumph Bancorp, reflects on his decade-long tenure building the bank since its establishment in 2010. Fowler is set to retire effectively September 1st. The article highlights his significant role in the company's development during his time as CFO.

title: Bank of America Closing Gap With JPMorgan in Asia Deals Race
summary: Bank of America Corp. is significantly closing the gap with JPMorgan Chase & Co. in investment banking fees in Asia-Pacific after a three-year strategic rebuild. The bank is now "neck-and-neck" with the third-ranked JPMorgan in the region, focusing on securing major deals. This progress follows the hiring of six managing directors to bolster its investment banking team.

title: BofA banker charged with murder in Michelle Avan's death
summary: A Bank of America commercial banker, Anthony Turner, has been charged with the murder of Merrill Lynch veteran Michelle Avan, his former girlfriend.
