Hershey will work with organizations like the World Cocoa Foundation and plans to release a comprehensive forestry plan by the end of 2018 to achieve its goals.

title: Saudi Sovereign-Wealth Fund Buys Stakes in Facebook, Boeing, Cisco Systems
summary: Saudi Arabia's $300 billion Public Investment Fund has acquired minority stakes in major American corporations, including Facebook, Walt Disney Co., Marriott International Inc., and Cisco Systems Inc. This move is part of Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman's strategy to diversify Saudi Arabia’s economy beyond hydrocarbons. The fund also invested in financial stocks such as Citigroup and Bank of America, capitalizing on the financial fallout from the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Warren Buffett dumps Goldman Sachs holdings
summary: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway Inc. significantly reduced its holdings in Goldman Sachs Group Inc. during the first quarter. This sale marks the winding down of an investment initiated during the 2008 financial crisis when Berkshire invested $5 billion to support the bank. The terms of this deal had been renegotiated five years after the initial investment.

title: CoStar buying Ten-X Commercial to move commercial real estate deals online
summary: CoStar Group is acquiring Ten-X Commercial for $190 million to expand its online commercial real estate transaction capabilities. This acquisition aims to create an end-to-end platform by combining LoopNet and CoStar's buyer audience with Ten-X's online auction expertise, particularly in anticipation of a surge in distressed properties. This deal focuses solely on Ten-X Commercial, with private equity firm Thomas H. Lee Partners retaining ownership of Auction.com.

title: Citi Snags Barclays Equity Trading Chief After Year in Role
summary: Citigroup Inc. has hired Fater Belbachir from Barclays Plc to lead its global equities trading operation, less than a year after he joined Barclays in the same role. This move aims to boost Citi's standing in equities trading, an area where it has struggled with revenue and lagged behind competitors. Belbachir's departure follows a leadership shakeup at Barclays' investment bank last year.

title: Staying a move ahead: CEO Alan Trefler positions Pegasystems for the long game in customer engagement
summary: Pegasystems CEO Alan Trefler discusses how the company has adapted and reinvented itself five times over the years, mirroring his chess philosophy of thinking several moves ahead. The article highlights Pegasystems' focus on AI-driven customer engagement, its approach to empathy in automation, and its successful navigation of the robotic process automation (RPA) market, leading to a 25% revenue increase in the first quarter of 2020. Trefler emphasizes the increasing need for digital infrastructure changes post-COVID-19, benefiting platforms like Pegasystems.

title: Nevada’s mining giants are raking it in and we should raise their taxes a lot
summary: This article argues that Nevada should significantly raise taxes on its mining industry giants, Newmont Corp. and Barrick Gold Corp., due to their substantial profits during the coronavirus pandemic. The author highlights the companies' soaring stock prices and increased net incomes amid rising gold prices, contrasting this with Nevada's severe budget cuts affecting essential services. The piece suggests practical ways to increase mining taxes, such as removing deductions or increasing the commerce tax, to help address the state's financial crisis.

title: South African Rand to Hold April Ranges, Avoid New Lows Major Bank Says
summary: The South African Rand is expected to remain within its April trading ranges and avoid new lows, with global factors continuing to be the primary influence on its direction against the Dollar, according to Credit Suisse. Domestically, the Rand faced pressure from Eskom's R2.5bn loss due to reduced mining consumption, a R5.5bn government injection into South African Airways, and warnings of a potential 17% economic contraction. However, Credit Suisse believes domestic risks like political instability or a failure to secure international loans are unlikely enough to push the Rand significantly lower.

title: 8 Investments to Protect Against an Inflation Spike
summary: This article identifies eight investment strategies to protect financial portfolios against inflation, ranging from real assets like real estate and commodities to financial instruments like Treasury Inflation-Protected Securities (TIPS) and growth-oriented stocks. It explains how different assets inherently maintain or increase value during inflationary periods and also advises on debt management by converting variable to fixed interest rates. The article concludes by emphasizing personal investment in skills and earnings potential as the most crucial defense against inflation.

title: Vornado: Regus Backing Out Of $66M Project In Which Trump Owns 30% Stake
summary: Vornado Realty Trust is taking legal action against Regus for allegedly attempting to terminate a 15-year lease and a $90M guarantee for a coworking space project at 345 Montgomery St. in San Francisco. The project, which involves a building complex where President Donald Trump's company owns a 30% stake, has seen its estimated costs rise from $45M to $66M. Vornado is suing to enforce the lease while continuing redevelopment work despite Regus's purported termination.

title: Credit Karma cites virus in slashing pay ahead of Intuit deal
summary: Fintech company Credit Karma is cutting employee pay by 15% to 50% ahead of its $7.1 billion acquisition by Intuit, citing the economic impact of the coronavirus. The company is also freezing promotions and moving its headquarters, offering a buyout plan for employees unwilling to accept the changes. This move contrasts with some major banks that have pledged no layoffs for the year.

title: BofA gets approval for $24.9 billion in small-business loans
summary: Bank of America Corp. received approval for 265,500 small-business loans totaling $24.9 billion from the Small Business Administration’s Paycheck Protection Program. The bank has become the top lender in the program's second round of funding, with 98% of applications from companies with fewer than 100 employees. Bank of America also pledged to use net proceeds from PPP fees to support small businesses, communities, and nonprofits.

title: Valero sees $1.9 billion loss in first quarter
summary: Valero Energy Corp. reported a $1.9 billion loss in the first quarter of 2020, primarily due to slashed demand for fuel caused by stay-at-home orders and travel restrictions. Despite the substantial loss, the company plans to maintain its stock dividend and has taken steps to increase liquidity through new bonds and a credit facility. Analysts are divided on Valero's prospects, with some expressing concern about the dividend payout and potential future COVID-19 outbreaks affecting demand recovery.

title: Bausch Health To Participate at 2020 Bank of America Merrill Lynch Global Healthcare Conference
summary: Bausch Health Companies Inc. announced that its Chairman and CEO, Joseph C. Papa, and SVP of Investor Relations, Arthur J. Shannon, will participate in the virtual Bank of America Merrill Lynch Global Healthcare Conference on May 12, 2020. A live webcast and audio archive of their presentation will be available on the company's Investor Relations website. Bausch Health is a global healthcare company focused on eye health, gastroenterology, and dermatology products.

title: Vietnam ETF Has Been a Standout Emerging Market Play
summary: The VanEck Vectors Vietnam ETF (VNM) has shown strong performance amidst the global pandemic, surging 23.8% in the past month, as Vietnam was one of the first countries to ease social distancing measures. Despite optimism, the International Monetary Fund projects Vietnam's economy to grow 2.7%, down from 6.8% last year, and warns about the impact on tourism and the country's limited fiscal response to the crisis.

title: Sasol to Divest Stake in $13B US Chemical Plant
summary: Sasol Ltd. is seeking to sell a significant stake in its $13 billion Lake Charles chemical complex in the U.S. to address its substantial debt and financial struggles exacerbated by the oil market downturn. The South African energy producer has hired Bank of America Corp. to find a buyer, ideally an industrial partner, for a minority stake, aiming to finalize a deal by June. This move is part of Sasol's broader strategy to raise $6 billion through asset sales and potential share offerings to reduce its approximately $10 billion net debt.

title: Bank of Hawaii sets aside $33.6M for possible loan defaults amid coronavirus shutdown
summary: Bank of Hawaii reported a 40.9% drop in net income for the first quarter, setting aside $33.6 million for potential loan defaults due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The bank also suspended stock buybacks but declared a quarterly dividend of 67 cents a share. Despite the challenges, Bankoh processed numerous Paycheck Protection Program loans and made significant loan modifications, highlighting its strong financial position to support customers through the crisis.

title: Santiago de Sousa es el nuevo CMO de BBVA Argentina
summary: Santiago de Sousa has been appointed as the new Chief Marketing Officer of BBVA Argentina, while also retaining his role as head of digital sales & UX/UI design. He replaces Santiago Sanguinetti, who moved to a brand strategy director position for Latin America at BBVA Creative. Additionally, Marcelo Parada is now the marketing strategy manager for BBVA Argentina.

title: Investors are cashing in from following the Fed this chart shows
summary: Investors are profiting by aligning their strategies with the Federal Reserve's actions, particularly its asset purchasing and emergency lending programs initiated during the coronavirus pandemic. This trend is evident in the narrowing yield spread between BBB-rated corporate bonds (lowest investment-grade) and BB-rated corporate bonds (highest non-investment-grade or "junk" bonds). This indicates that following the Fed's lead has been a successful strategy for investors.

title: $446M Sale of Hearst Tower/Truist Center Is Complete | Charlotte Office
summary: The sale of Hearst Tower in Uptown Charlotte to Truist Financial Corporation has been completed for $455.5 million. The 47-story building, soon to be renamed Truist Center, will serve as the new bank's corporate headquarters. This transaction follows the merger of BB&T Corp. and SunTrust Banks Inc. to form Truist.

title: Square and PayPal finally have a chance to prove they can beat the banks
summary: Fintech companies like PayPal, Square, and Intuit have been approved by the SBA to distribute Paycheck Protection Program (PPP) loans, presenting a significant opportunity. BTIG analyst Mark Palmer believes this allows them to demonstrate their superior speed and reach compared to traditional banks in lending to small businesses during the COVID-19 crisis. This designation is seen as the chance these fintech firms have been awaiting to prove their capabilities.

title: Barrick paid CEO Bristow US$17.4-million in 2019
summary: Barrick Gold Corp. paid CEO Mark Bristow US$17.4-million in 2019, making it one of the largest compensation packages ever awarded by the company. His pay included a salary, share awards, and a bonus, while executive chairman John Thornton received US$5.5-million. The total compensation for Barrick's top five executives reached US$39.44-million, and shareholders will vote on executive pay at an upcoming virtual annual meeting.

title: Moody's places IndusInd Bank's issuer ratings on review for downgrade
summary: Moody's Investors Service has placed IndusInd Bank Ltd’s domestic and foreign currency issuer ratings under review for downgrade due to risks to asset quality stemming from the deteriorating macroenvironment and financial market volatility. The review reflects concerns over the bank's higher proportion of microfinance and vehicle finance loans, which are vulnerable to economic shocks, and its weaker funding compared to peers. Moody's also revised outlooks for ICICI Bank and Axis Bank to negative from stable, and for IDBI Bank to stable from positive, citing a negative outlook for the Indian banking system due to the COVID-19 outbreak.

title: Valley National Bank Among Banks Investigated for Improper Overdraft Fee Practices
summary: Valley National Bank is among several financial institutions under investigation for allegedly improper overdraft fee practices. The article details how overdraft fees work, ways consumers can avoid them, and deceptive practices banks may use, such as reordering transactions or displaying inaccurate online balances. Consumers who believe they have been subject to improper overdraft fees are encouraged to seek legal consultation.

title: WSJ News Exclusive | A Top Occidental Petroleum Executive Is Out as Company Grapples With Oil Rout
summary: A top executive at Occidental Petroleum Corp., Oscar Brown, has been "forced out" of the company amid challenges from an ill-timed acquisition, declining crude prices, and substantial debt. Brown, who was a key lieutenant to CEO Vicki Hollub and instrumental in the Anadarko Petroleum acquisition, served as senior vice president over strategy, business development, and supply chain. The $38 billion Anadarko deal included a costly $10 billion investment from Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway.

title: Associated Bank, Town Bank work with EDBC on grants for small businesses harmed by COVID-19
summary: Associated Bank is joining Town Bank in providing relief grants to small businesses through the Ethnic and Diverse Business Coalition to help those impacted by COVID-19. To qualify, businesses must have an annual income under $1 million and be a member in good standing with one of the chambers. This initiative aims to support local small businesses facing financial difficulties during the pandemic.

title: Morgan Stanley's CEO says downturn is 'exactly the kind of reason' for E-Trade deal
summary: Morgan Stanley CEO James Gorman stated that the recent market downturn validates the bank's acquisition of E-Trade, emphasizing the online broker's robust technology and the deal's ability to diversify Morgan Stanley's revenue streams toward more stable wealth management. He noted that E-Trade handled the rapid market pullback "brilliantly" and provides crucial technological capabilities, especially as more people deal remotely. Gorman expressed satisfaction with the all-stock deal, despite both companies' stock price movements since the February 20th announcement.

title: 'This is the right thing' — PayPal is the latest company to take a no coronavirus-layoffs pledge
summary: PayPal CEO Dan Schulman announced that the company will not lay off any employees due to the coronavirus pandemic, joining other major companies in making a similar pledge. Schulman emphasized PayPal's commitment to supporting its employees' health and finances, as well as providing flexibility to small business customers struggling during the economic downturn. He stressed that financially strong companies have a responsibility to assist both employees and customers during the crisis.

title: Coronavirus causing 'unprecedented' US dollar strength
summary: Despite a recent weekly decline, the U.S. dollar continues to show unprecedented strength early in the current recession, driven by its role as a safe-haven asset amidst global economic turmoil caused by COVID-19. Analysts at JPMorgan Chase & Co. and Bank of America suggest further upside for the dollar, citing historical recessionary strength and bullish technical indicators, despite its recent dip and coordinated central bank actions to provide dollar liquidity.

title: Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd. (RCL) Bolsters Liquidity
summary: Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd. (RCL) has secured a $2.2 billion 364-day secured term loan to significantly enhance its liquidity, bringing its total liquidity to over $3.6 billion. This financial move comes as the cruise industry faces unprecedented disruption, with RCL having suspended all cruises from U.S. ports for 30 days. The company expects to resume service on April 11 and remains focused on protecting its financial position and long-term plans.

title: Fed announces unlimited bond purchases in unprecedented move aimed at preventing an economic depression
summary: The Federal Reserve announced an unprecedented move to make unlimited bond purchases to prevent an economic depression caused by the coronavirus outbreak. This effort aims to keep money flowing to companies, households, and cities, addressing the severe disruption expected in the economy. The Fed's actions are designed to support the economy as the crisis threatens to surpass the Great Recession.

title: Citigroup is giving some employees a $1,000 bonus for working through the coronavirus pandemic
summary: Citigroup announced it is giving a $1,000 bonus to some employees, particularly those earning $60,000 or less, to help ease the financial burden of working during the coronavirus pandemic. This initiative will provide special compensation to over 75,000 colleagues globally and applies to various roles including tellers and call center workers. The bank is also offering other support such as paid time off flexibility and transportation assistance for site-dependent staff.

title: 2019 Annual Report
summary: Goldman Sachs' 2019 Annual Report details the firm's financial performance of $36.55 billion in net revenues and a 10.0% return on average common shareholders’ equity, alongside a strategic outlook for growth and increased efficiency. The report highlights the firm's commitment to core values, diversity, and sustainability, while acknowledging the profound impact and uncertainty caused by the COVID-19 pandemic on the global economy. David M. Solomon emphasizes the firm's resilience, client focus, and ongoing efforts to strengthen existing businesses and invest in new opportunities.

title: Biggest U.S. Banks Halt Buybacks to Free Up Capital for Coronavirus
summary: The biggest U.S. banks have temporarily suspended share buybacks to free up capital, aiming to support consumers and businesses impacted by the rapid economic slowdown caused by the novel coronavirus outbreak. This decision was announced by the Financial Services Forum shortly after the Federal Reserve reduced its benchmark interest rate to near zero. The move underscores the financial industry's response to an "unprecedented challenge" posed by the pandemic to the global economy.

title: JPMorgan, Bank of America, Citigroup and other major banks suspend stock buybacks due to pandemic
summary: Major U.S. banks including JPMorgan, Bank of America, and Citigroup announced they would suspend stock buybacks through the second quarter of 2020 due to the coronavirus pandemic. This decision, made by members of the Financial Services Forum, aims to preserve capital and liquidity to support individuals, small businesses, and the broader economy through lending and other services during the "unprecedented challenge." Bank stocks have seen significant declines since the start of 2020 as the virus spread globally.

title: As Wall Street dives, what’s the plan at Wells Fargo Advisors?
summary: The article discusses how Wells Fargo Advisors is trying to navigate an intense market sell-off and emerge from past scandals, contrasting its situation with competitors Merrill Lynch and Morgan Stanley. Despite challenges and adviser departures, Wells Fargo Advisors' new leadership aims to focus on financial planning, banking referrals, and leveraging the parent bank's strengths to find new clients, similar to strategies employed by its rivals. The piece highlights the scrutiny new CEO Charles Scharf and president Jim Hays will face as they try to make up for lost time amid a bear market.

title: ‘Rent-a-Banks’ Defy States’ Growing Efforts to Curb High-Cost Lending
summary: Lenders are employing "rent-a-bank" schemes to circumvent state-level interest-rate caps, enabling them to offer high-cost loans despite new regulations. For instance, OppLoans is charging 160% interest in California by partnering with a Utah bank, although the state aims to cap rates at 37%. This practice is sparking calls for tighter federal regulation to address the ongoing defiance of state efforts to curb predatory lending.

title: Fifth Third employees opened fake accounts to meet sales goals, US government says
summary: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (CFPB) has filed a lawsuit alleging that Fifth Third Bank employees opened fake accounts to meet aggressive sales goals, mirroring practices seen at Wells Fargo. Fifth Third Bank denies the allegations, stating their compensation structure does not reward unauthorized accounts and that they had already identified and addressed a small number of fraudulent accounts internally. The bank also asserted that the CFPB did not identify any additional fake accounts beyond what their internal investigation uncovered.

title: US Foods Buying Smart Foodservice for $970M
summary: US Foods Holding Corp. has announced its definitive agreement to acquire Smart Foodservice Warehouse Stores for $970 million in cash from affiliates of Apollo Global Management, Inc. This acquisition aims to expand US Foods' multi-channel strategy, particularly in the growing cash and carry segment, and is expected to be accretive to Adjusted Diluted EPS in the first year. Smart Foodservice operates 70 cash and carry stores across seven western states, serving small and mid-sized restaurants and other food businesses.

title: Gary Borjan Joins Community West Bank
summary: Gary Borjan, Jr. has joined Community West Bank as Vice President and Community Banking Manager for their San Luis Obispo branch. His appointment is expected to strengthen customer service and business banking in the area, leveraging his prior experience at Bank of America and Pacific Premier Bank. Borjan's community involvement and leadership are highlighted as crucial for the bank's growth in San Luis Obispo.

title: Expedia Group, Booking Holdings spent more than $11B on marketing (mostly to Google) in 2019
summary: Expedia Group and Booking Holdings collectively spent over $11 billion on marketing in 2019, with a significant portion going to Google. Expedia Group increased its marketing spend by 6% to $6.03 billion, while Booking Holdings maintained a nearly flat spend at $4.97 billion. The article highlights how Google's growing presence in online travel forces OTAs to increase advertising to maintain visibility.

title: Banking vet Mitch Feiger stepping down as Fifth Third Chicago chair
summary: Mitch Feiger, chair of the Chicago region for Fifth Third Bancorp and former CEO of MB Financial, is stepping down to join the bank's board. He will be succeeded by Mark Hoppe, who was his second-in-command at MB Financial. This change comes after Fifth Third's acquisition of MB Financial, a move that significantly boosted Fifth Third's presence in the Chicago market.

title: LendingTree CEO sees risk of a fintech bubble after E-Trade, Credit Karma sales
summary: LendingTree CEO Doug Lebda believes there's a risk of a fintech bubble forming due to too much capital chasing too few deals, despite recent mega-acquisitions like E-Trade and Credit Karma. While LendingTree is not explicitly for sale, Lebda is focused on growth through smaller acquisitions and maintaining the company's position as an online lending marketplace. He also discussed his compensation structure, which is heavily aligned with shareholder returns, and his civic involvement in Charlotte.

title: Increasing Signs of Gender Diversity on Corporate Boards
summary: The article discusses the increasing representation of women in executive officer roles and on corporate boards in the Morningstar US Market Index, noting a significant spike since 2010. It highlights policy changes, such as those in California, as key drivers, but also points out that many women are "double dipping" on boards, while also noting an increase in first-time female directors and the role of asset managers in promoting gender diversity.

title: How JPMorgan Chase Became the Doomsday Bank
summary: JPMorgan Chase is identified as the largest lender to the fossil-fuel industry globally, having lent $196 billion since the Paris Agreement. The article details the bank's historical ties to fossil fuels and its CEO Jamie Dimon's public statements on climate change versus the bank's substantial investments in environmentally damaging projects. It highlights a national campaign of civil disobedience aimed at forcing Chase to change its course, noting potential opportunities for change at the bank's annual investor day.

title: With new digital bank, RBC joins crowded field
summary: Royal Bank of Canada (RBC) plans to launch a digital-only bank in the U.S. later this year, aiming to build its funding base by offering high-yielding accounts to affluent households. This move comes as RBC's U.S. subsidiary, City National Bank, is experiencing deposit growth lagging loan growth, pushing the bank into an already crowded digital banking market. RBC will face significant competition from established digital banks and new digital offerings from other financial institutions, raising questions about its ability to differentiate itself and attract sticky customer relationships beyond deposits.

title: JPMorgan Chase in talks to launch digital bank in UK
summary: JPMorgan Chase is reportedly in talks with London regulators to launch a digital bank in the UK by the end of the year. This move could significantly impact the UK retail banking market, following Goldman Sachs' successful launch of its digital bank, Marcus, two years prior. The new operation is expected to offer savings and lending products and represents a notable international expansion for Chase, especially as other banks consider shifting operations due to Brexit.

title: Wells Fargo to pay $3 billion to U.S., admits pressuring workers in fake-accounts scandal
summary: Wells Fargo has agreed to pay $3 billion to resolve criminal and civil probes into fraudulent sales practices, admitting to pressuring employees in a fake-accounts scandal. The settlement, which includes penalties to the U.S. Justice Department and SEC, marks a significant step for the bank in moving past the scandal. The bank acknowledged that between 2002 and 2016, employees were coerced to meet unrealistic sales goals, leading to millions of unauthorized accounts.

title: Can a Bank Be Bigger and Better – But Not Impersonal?
summary: Valley Bank's President and CEO, Ira Robbins, discusses the challenge of balancing growth and technology with personalized customer relationships in the banking industry. Following the acquisition of Oritani Bank, Valley Bank aims to leverage its size and digital advancements while retaining a community-focused approach. Robbins highlights the importance of understanding individual customer needs amidst significant digital disruption in banking.

title: This Growth ETF Continues Winning
summary: The article discusses the continued outperformance of growth stocks over value stocks in early 2020, driven by technology and consumer discretionary sectors. It highlights the SPDR Portfolio S&P 500 Growth ETF (SPYG) as a strong performer, noting its impressive year-to-date gains compared to the broader S&P 500 and S&P 500 Value Index. The piece also contrasts growth and value investing strategies and mentions significant inflows into SPYG.

title: Green Bay financial services firm to acquire Commerce State Bank
summary: Nicolet National Bank, a Green Bay financial services firm, is expected to acquire Commerce State Bank. The transaction is projected to close in the third quarter of the year. This acquisition will expand Nicolet National Bank's presence, integrating Commerce State Bank's operations.

title: Despegar.com launches co-branded credit card in Brazil in partnership with Santander and Visa to complement its loyalty program
summary: Despegar.com's Brazilian subsidiary, Decolar, has partnered with Visa and Banco Santander (Brasil) S.A. to launch a co-branded credit card in Brazil. This new "Passaporte Decolar" card enhances Despegar's loyalty program, allowing customers to redeem accumulated points for travel products and services and offering online approval before the first travel purchase. This initiative aims to deepen customer engagement and expand brand awareness by rewarding customer loyalty.

title: Capital One Doubles Down on Chatbot with New Features and Marketing
summary: Capital One is significantly enhancing its chatbot, Eno, with new features like sophisticated fraud alerts, transaction monitoring, and free-trial reminders. The bank is backing these updates with a national multi-media advertising campaign to raise awareness and drive user adoption for the three-year-old virtual assistant. Capital One aims to differentiate Eno in the competitive banking chatbot landscape, highlighting its unique functionalities and proactive assistance despite not having a voice response feature currently.

title: Global Financial Giants Swear Off Funding an Especially Dirty Fuel (Published 2020)
summary: Major financial institutions, including The Hartford, Sweden's central bank, and BlackRock, have begun divesting from oil production in the Canadian province of Alberta's oil sands due to environmental concerns. This move highlights a growing trend among global investment houses to pull away from fossil fuel investments amid pressure to combat climate change. While foreign investors are withdrawing, local Canadian banks and pension funds continue to support the industry, and some divesting companies still invest in oil projects elsewhere.

title: Schrödinger Announces Closing of Initial Public Offering
summary: Schrödinger, Inc. announced the closing of its initial public offering, raising approximately $232.3 million from the sale of 13,664,704 shares of common stock at $17.00 per share. This includes additional shares purchased by underwriters. The company's stock began trading on Nasdaq under the ticker symbol "SDGR" on February 6, 2020.

title: Remitly Launches Passbook – Banking Designed for Immigrants
summary: Remitly has launched Passbook, a new banking solution specifically designed for immigrants in the U.S. Passbook offers an online, no-fee account that eliminates common barriers to financial services, such as the need for a social security number, and includes immigrant-friendly features like global usability and customizable Visa Debit Cards. The service aims to transform banking for the over 44 million first-generation adult immigrants in the U.S., building on Remitly's mission to support this community.

title: Google, Microsoft and the strange world of corporate greenwashing
summary: This article examines the prevalence of corporate greenwashing, especially among major companies like Google and Microsoft, who announce ambitious net-zero targets but often rely on creative accounting and carbon offsets. It highlights how companies obscure their environmental impact by excluding supply chains or purchasing credits, a practice that receives criticism from environmental groups and investors. The piece concludes that increasing pressure from investors and activists may encourage more genuine action from corporations beyond mere pledges.

title: Goldman Sachs Investor Day: ‘Embracing the bank model,’ but which bank?
summary: Goldman Sachs held its first-ever Investor Day, outlining ambitious goals to expand its consumer banking, transaction services, and wealth management, aiming for significant deposit and loan growth by 2025. Despite these growth initiatives, the event was largely met with a lack of excitement from investors and analysts, who noted concern over the risk associated with new revenue streams and compared Goldman's new strategy to that of commercial banks like Citigroup or JPMorgan. The bank also detailed cost-cutting measures and targets to boost its return on tangible equity, though its stock performance since October 2018 lagged competitors.

title: Sallie Mae reverses course on personal loan origination
summary: Sallie Mae has decided to discontinue new personal loan originations less than two years after starting them, opting to focus on its core strategic priorities. The company also plans to sell off $3 billion in student loans and use the proceeds to buy back $600 million of its stock, which is intended to offset the impact of a new accounting standard (CECL) requiring increased loan loss reserves. Despite previously expanding into personal loans as a logical extension of its student loan business, Sallie Mae's CEO stated the decision had "nothing to do with CECL" and that the personal loans were profitable.

title: One of Pittsburgh's biggest banks cutting 15 branches
summary: F.N.B. Corp., one of Pittsburgh's largest banks, is set to close 15 branches, adding to the trend of branch closures. This early 2020 tally already accounts for 60% of the total closures seen in 2019. The move includes the relocation of the Mount Washington office into the South Side branch, formerly Iron & Glass Bank.

title: South State and CenterState to Combine in Merger of Equals to Create Leading Southeast Regional Bank
summary: CenterState Bank Corporation (NASDAQ: CSFL) and South State Corporation (NASDAQ: SSB) announced an all-stock merger of equals valued at approximately $6 billion. The combined entity will form a leading Southeast regional bank with approximately $34 billion in assets, operating under the South State Bank name with its ticker SSB. Robert R. Hill, Jr. will serve as Executive Chairman, and John C. Corbett as CEO of the new company, which is expected to generate over 20% EPS accretion for South State shareholders.

title: Fifth Third customer gets $250 for opening an account, then receives tax form in the mail: Money Matters
summary: A Fifth Third Bank customer received a $250 bonus for opening an account and was surprised to get a 1099-INT tax form, making the bonus taxable income. The article clarifies that cash incentives from banks are considered interest income and are reportable to the IRS. It also addresses an unrelated reader question about doctors' offices requiring a credit card on file, offering a solution using a prepaid debit card for anonymity.

title: Optimistic about new consumption Goldman Sachs raised Lexin's target price to $18.3
summary: Goldman Sachs Group has raised its target price for LexinFintech Holdings Ltd. to US$18.30, citing optimism about the company's new consumer platform strategy. Several other investment banks, including Bank of America Merrill Lynch and China Renaissance Holdings Ltd., also reiterated "buy" ratings for LexinFintech, with some expecting significant transaction volume growth in 2020. The company's new "Leka" consumer brand and successful user acquisition strategies have contributed to its strong financial performance and asset quality.

title: Fortune poll: Wells Fargo is the big bank that investors like least
summary: Wells Fargo is considered the most disliked large financial firm by investors, according to a Fortune/Civis Analytics survey, despite a recent marketing campaign. The bank's reputation continues to suffer years after its fraudulent accounts scandal, compounded by significant legal fees and fines. However, 44% of investors still rate it favorably.

title: Wells Fargo loses more than 450 advisers in 2019
summary: Wells Fargo Advisors' head count dropped by 456 financial advisers, or 3.3%, in 2019, bringing their total to 13,512. This decline occurred amidst increased expenses for Wells Fargo Advisors and a 63% drop in net income for its Wealth and Investment Management group compared to the previous year. The company's image continues to be affected by past scandals, despite efforts to rebrand.

title: Wells Fargo owes $103 million in second mobile banking case vs. USAA
summary: A federal jury ordered Wells Fargo to pay $102.8 million to USAA for infringing on its mobile deposit system patents, marking the second such verdict against Wells Fargo. This brings the total amount Wells Fargo owes USAA to approximately $303 million across two separate patent infringement cases. Wells Fargo disputes the verdict and is considering an appeal, while USAA emphasizes its pioneering role in mobile banking innovation.

title: Southwest could receive over $1.2B from Boeing
summary: Southwest Airlines Co. is expected to receive over $1.2 billion from Boeing as compensation for the 737 Max grounding, according to an analyst estimate. This compensation comes after a settlement was announced regarding income Southwest lost in 2019 due to the grounding. Further delays are anticipated as Boeing now recommends simulator training for 737 Max pilots, a move that could significantly increase Boeing's payout to Southwest due to a prior agreement clause.

title: Truist unveils logo that emphasizes high-touch, high-tech focus
summary: Truist Financial, formed by the merger of BB&T and SunTrust Banks, has unveiled a new purple logo designed to emphasize customer experience and technology. The logo, featuring two connected "T"s, symbolizes the personal touch of employees, technology offerings, and the coming together of the two institutions. Truist plans a "boom and echo" marketing strategy, largely digital, to promote its new brand and integrate it across branches and sports venues over the next 18 to 24 months.

title: ‘We Need to Be a Technology Company.’ Wells Fargo Struggles With Aging Systems.
summary: Wells Fargo is facing challenges with its outdated technology systems, hindering its ability to meet regulatory requirements and impacting key business operations. Despite being a pioneer in online banking, the company has fallen behind in recent years. An incident where a fire-extinguisher system knocked out power to servers, causing an hours-long outage for online and mobile banking, highlights the fragility of their current infrastructure.

title: Target is taking the market share in women’s clothing that Kohl’s is losing
summary: Target Corp. is gaining market share in women's apparel, primarily at the expense of Kohl's Corp. This shift has led to multiple downgrades for Kohl's from financial analysts. Bank of America recently downgraded Kohl's to neutral from buy and reduced its price target to $50 from $55.

title: Iran’s Cyber Attack on Billionaire Adelson Provides Lesson on Strategy
summary: This article discusses Iran's history of cyberattacks, exemplified by the 2014 attack on Sheldon Adelson's Las Vegas Sands casino networks following his provocative comments. It details how the U.S. faces a potential surge in Iranian digital warfare after a recent airstrike, with concerns focusing on critical infrastructure. Experts weigh in on Iran's evolving cyber capabilities and the potential for a "dramatic" response.

title: Is U.S. Bancorp’s Stock Fairly Priced?
summary: This article analyzes U.S. Bancorp's (NYSE: USB) stock valuation despite its recent rally, driven by better-than-expected performance in 2019. Trefis estimates the fair value of U.S. Bancorp's stock to be $57 per share, which is roughly 5% below the current market price, due to macroeconomic headwinds and rate cuts impacting growth potential. The analysis details revenue growth drivers, net income expectations, and the impact of share repurchases on EPS.

title: Bank of America Profit Falls 16%
summary: Bank of America's profit decreased by 16% in the third quarter compared to the previous year, although the bank stated it is well-prepared for the ongoing coronavirus recession. The Charlotte, N.C., lender reported earning $4.88 billion in the July-to-September period. This marks a decrease from $5.78 billion a year ago, but an increase from $3.53 billion in the prior quarter.

title: Bank of America Profit Falls 16%
summary: Bank of America Corp.'s profit saw a 16% decrease in the third quarter, reporting $4.88 billion compared to $5.78 billion a year prior. Despite the decline, the bank indicated preparedness to handle the coronavirus recession. This news follows a week of various bank earnings reports.

title: Bank of America Profit Falls 16%
summary: Bank of America (BAC) reported a 16% decrease in its third-quarter profit, although the bank indicated it is well-prepared to handle the economic challenges posed by the coronavirus recession. The Charlotte, N.C. based lender's earnings fell to $4.88 billion from $5.78 billion in the same period last year. This news follows a week of multiple bank earnings reports.

title: Bank of America Profit Falls 16%
summary: Bank of America reported a 16% decrease in profit for the third quarter, earning $4.88 billion compared to $5.78 billion a year ago. Despite the drop, the lender stated it is well-prepared to navigate the ongoing coronavirus recession. This announcement comes amid a week of various bank earnings reports.

title: First Citizens to Buy CIT Group
summary: First Citizens BancShares Inc. announced plans to acquire CIT Group Inc. in an all-stock deal valued at approximately $2.2 billion, creating a regional bank with over $100 billion in assets. The new entity will retain the First Citizens name and CEO. This merger aims to strengthen commercial lending by leveraging First Citizens' low-cost deposits, addressing a common challenge for regional banks struggling against larger national competitors and low interest rates.

title: Bank of America Profit Falls 16%
summary: Bank of America's prophet dropped 16% in the third quarter, reporting $4.88 billion compared to $5.78 billion a year prior. Despite the decline, the bank stated it is well-prepared to navigate the coronavirus recession. This announcement comes amid a week of various bank earnings reports.

title: Bank of America Profit Falls 16%
summary: Bank of America reported a 16% decrease in profit for the third quarter, earning $4.88 billion compared to $5.78 billion a year ago. Despite the drop, the Charlotte, N.C., lender indicated it is well-prepared to navigate the economic challenges of the coronavirus recession. This financial update came amidst a week of various bank earnings reports.

title: Bank of America Profit Falls 16%
summary: Bank of America's profit decreased by 16% in the third quarter, reporting $4.88 billion, though the bank stated it is well-prepared for the coronavirus recession. The bank's provision for loan losses significantly reduced to $1.39 billion, compared to the previous two quarters. Despite the profit fall, CEO Brian Moynihan noted a return to fundamental economic health, contingent on resolving the healthcare crisis.

title: Bank of America Profit Falls 16%
summary: Bank of America reported a 16% drop in profit for the third quarter, earning $4.88 billion compared to $5.78 billion a year ago. Despite the decline, the bank indicated that it is well-prepared to handle the economic challenges posed by the coronavirus recession.

title: Bank of America Profit Falls 16%
summary: Bank of America's profit decreased by 16% in the third quarter, reporting $4.88 billion compared to $5.78 billion a year ago. Despite the drop, the bank stated it is well-prepared to manage the coronavirus recession. This news followed a week of various bank earnings reports.

title: Bank of America Profit Falls 16%
summary: Bank of America's profit decreased by 16% in the third quarter, reporting $4.88 billion compared to $5.78 billion a year ago. Despite the drop, the bank expressed confidence in its preparedness for the coronavirus recession and noted increased customer spending. Provisions for loan losses were significantly lower than previous quarters, aligning with other major banks which are also holding off on major reserve builds.

title: Bank of America Profit Falls 16%
summary: Bank of America reported a 16% decline in profit for the third quarter, earning $4.88 billion compared to $5.78 billion a year ago. Despite the drop, the Charlotte, N.C., lender stated it is well-prepared to handle the coronavirus recession. This news came amidst a week of various bank earnings reports.

title: Morgan Stanley to Buy Eaton Vance for $7 Billion - WSJ
summary: Morgan Stanley is set to acquire fund manager Eaton Vance Corp. for $7 billion, marking a significant step in the bank's strategy to shift towards more stable businesses like money management. This acquisition follows closely on the heels of its $11 billion takeover of E*Trade Financial Corp., furthering CEO James Gorman's decadelong effort to reduce risky trading operations and bolster wealth and asset management. The deal will nearly double the assets Morgan Stanley manages for institutional clients.

title: Seventh Circuit Splits With Eleventh on CAFA Jurisdictional Discovery
summary: The Seventh Circuit recently diverged from the Eleventh Circuit regarding the allowance of jurisdictional discovery in cases removed under the Class Action Fairness Act (CAFA). In *Dancel v. Groupon, Inc.*, the Seventh Circuit held that specific allegations of minimal diversity are required and that jurisdictional discovery can be used to prove it, even where the Eleventh Circuit previously prohibited such discovery. This decision is significant for parties arguing federal subject matter jurisdiction under CAFA, particularly in the Seventh Circuit.

title: Tesla Secures $1.29 Billion Loan from Chinese Banks for Shanghai Factory
summary: Tesla Inc. has secured a secured term loan facility of up to 9 billion yuan ($1.29 billion) and an unsecured revolving loan facility of up to 2.25 billion yuan from Chinese banks. These loans are designated for its Shanghai car plant, which is crucial for increasing sales in the Chinese auto market and avoiding import tariffs. The funds will also be used to repay existing debt.
source: VOA - Voice of America English News
source_domain: VOA - Voice of America English News

title: Hombre más rico de Colombia suma US$3.000 millones a su fortuna
summary: Luis Carlos Sarmiento Angulo, Colombia's richest man, has seen his fortune increase by approximately US$3 billion due to the strong performance of his companies on the Colombian stock exchange. His financial conglomerate's firms, including Corficolombiana and Banco de Bogotá, led the Colcap index's gains in 2019, benefiting from robust consumer demand. This marks a significant turnaround from the previous year when the companies faced investor scrutiny over an investigation.

title: Peapack-Gladstone Bank’s Kennedy elected to New York Fed board
summary: Douglas Kennedy, President and CEO of Peapack-Gladstone Bank, was elected to the board of directors of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York for a three-year term. He will serve as a Class A director representing banks with capital and surplus between $40 million and $2 billion. Kennedy brings over four decades of financial industry experience to his new role.

title: A Meeting of Values: American Heating Talks Trust, Partnerships & Growth
summary: American Heating, a Portland-based design-build firm with 45 years in the industry, recently partnered with Banner Bank after facing a crossroads with their previous bank of over 20 years. This article highlights American Heating's commitment to trust and long-lasting partnerships, attributes they found reflected in their new banking relationship. The collaboration with Banner Bank, known for its agility and deep contracting-sector expertise, has enabled American Heating to secure better financial terms and pursue continued growth and diversification in its projects.

title: An ETN Strategy Designed to Capitalized on a Steepening Yield Curve
summary: This article discusses an ETN strategy designed to capitalize on a steepening yield curve, focusing on the iPath US Treasury Steepener ETN (STPP). The ETN benefits from widening spreads between short-term and long-term Treasury yields, a trend recently observed as the U.S. Treasury yield curve hit its steepest point in over a year. The piece explains how STPP tracks a notional investment in Treasury futures contracts and examines the factors contributing to the current steepening, including Federal Reserve policy easing and improving economic figures.

title: Bank of America Names Cannon to Succeed Rizzo as Europe IB Head
summary: Bank of America Corp. has appointed Matt Cannon as the new head of investment banking for Europe, the Middle East, and Africa. Cannon will replace Luigi Rizzo, who is leaving the firm. He will assume his new London-based role from his previous position running U.K. and Ireland corporate and investment banking.

title: Private Prison Finds Friendly Banker in Nomura After Bank of America Bails
summary: CoreCivic Inc., a major for-profit prison operator, faced financial challenges after Bank of America Corp. ceased doing business with the private prison industry following a proposal by Elizabeth Warren to ban private prisons. Japanese lender Nomura stepped in to provide CoreCivic with a $250 million loan deal. This highlights the dwindling financing options for the private prison industry among traditional U.S. banks.

title: In a tough market to do deals, investment bankers try old and new tricks
summary: Investment bankers in Houston's energy sector are facing a tough market for deals, with the value of energy deals in Texas dropping significantly. This downturn has led to layoffs and reduced compensation for bankers, who are now focusing more on debt advisory and restructuring rather than traditional M&A. Despite the challenges, firms like Lazard and Evercore are finding opportunities in helping companies manage liquidity and debt, and there's a growing shift towards renewable energy investments.

title: Amid regional slowdown, Houston small businesses temper 2020 expectations
summary: A report by Bank of America indicates that Houston entrepreneurs are concerned about rising healthcare costs and the strength of the U.S. dollar as they look towards 2020. These factors are leading to tempered expectations among small businesses in the region.

title: Park Place Dealerships sold to Georgia-based retailer in $1B transaction
summary: Park Place Dealerships has agreed to an all-cash $1 billion sale of 14 of its luxury car dealerships to Georgia-based Asbury Automotive Group Inc. The transaction, which excludes vehicle inventory, will see Asbury acquire 17 new vehicle franchises, primarily in the DFW metroplex, while founder Ken Schnitzer will retain two dealerships and a body shop in Grapevine. The deal is expected to close in Q1 2020 and significantly expands Asbury's presence in Texas.

title: BofA Adding Merchant-Related Information for Cardholders to Its Erica Digital Assistant
summary: Bank of America is enhancing its AI-powered digital assistant, Erica, with new features to provide cardholders with merchant-related information. These enhancements will inform users which merchants store their card numbers and alert them to possible duplicate charges, streamlining updates for replacement cards and facilitating charge disputes. The features are expected to go live in early 2020, building on Erica's already extensive capabilities and its significant user base.

title: Allstate, Bank of America, Cox, Kaiser Permanente and T-Mobile Top Consumer Satisfaction Rankings
summary: Verint Systems Inc. announced the results of its latest Verint Experience Index, which benchmarks customer satisfaction with contact center experiences across 25 leading brands. Allstate, Bank of America, Cox, Kaiser Permanente, and T-Mobile ranked highest in their respective industries, with the research also highlighting significant potential savings for companies that improve digital self-service options. The study emphasizes the critical link between issue resolution, customer loyalty, and the financial benefits of delivering excellent customer experiences.

title: XP Inc. Announces Pricing of Initial Public Offering
summary: XP Inc. announced the pricing of its initial public offering of 72,510,641 Class A common shares at $27.00 per share. Trading is expected to begin on the Nasdaq Global Select Market on December 11, 2019, under the symbol "XP." The offering is set to close on December 13, 2019, with Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC, J.P. Morgan, Morgan Stanley, XP Investments, and Itaú BBA acting as Global Coordinators.

title: Morgan Stanley is cutting about 1,500 jobs
summary: Morgan Stanley is cutting approximately 1,500 jobs, representing over 2% of its workforce, primarily in technology and operations roles. These layoffs are a response to global economic uncertainty and pressure on Wall Street firms to control spending amidst low interest rates and slow economic growth. The bank expects to incur a charge of $150 million to $200 million due to the job cuts.

title: BB&T, SunTrust finish merger to become Truist in ‘seamless’ change. Here’s what’s next
summary: BB&T and SunTrust have finalized their $66 billion merger, officially becoming Truist Financial Corporation, the sixth-largest bank in the U.S. The integration process is expected to take 18-24 months, with branding rollout early next year, and the new headquarters will be in Charlotte's Hearst Tower, bringing 2,000 employees. The merger faced regulatory scrutiny and a trademark lawsuit, but the bank has also committed $60 billion to community investments.

title: BB&T-SunTrust Merge to Form 6th Biggest Bank Truist Financial
summary: BB&T Corp and SunTrust Banks have merged to form Truist Financial Corp, creating the sixth largest commercial bank in the United States with over $450 billion in assets. The all-stock deal, approved by federal regulators, is expected to be earnings accretive for both companies' shareholders and result in $1.6 billion in pre-tax cost savings. The new entity, Truist Financial, will begin trading on the NYSE under the ticker "TFC" and is expected to provide significant competition to other major banks.

title: Comerica moves to virtual tellers as US banks trim branches
summary: Comerica Bank is implementing virtual teller machines called "Banker Connect" in Michigan to provide customer service via video, reflecting a broader trend of banks streamlining operations and reducing physical branches. Other banks, like Fifth Third Bank, are also adopting new branch models, such as "NextGen" banking centers that eliminate traditional teller windows and offer a more modernized, tech-friendly experience. This shift is driven by declining foot traffic and a desire to blend digital and physical banking to meet changing consumer behaviors more effectively.

title: Bank of America opens Global Business Centre at GIFT City
summary: Bank of America has opened its Global Business Service Centre in India’s first operational International Financial Services Centre (IFSC) at Gujarat International Finance-tec City (GIFT City). This marks Bank of America as the first foreign bank to establish operations in GIFT City, occupying nearly 1 lakh sqft and planning to employ up to 1500 people. Gujarat's Chief Minister Vijay Rupani highlighted that the state attracted over Rs. 18,000 crore worth of FDI in the first three months of the current fiscal and plans to develop GIFT City into Asia's biggest financial technology hub, expecting to generate 1 lakh job opportunities.

title: Bank of America opens Global Business Services Center at GIFT-IFSC
summary: Bank of America has opened its Global Business Services Center at Gujarat International Finance Tec-City (GIFT-IFSC), becoming the first foreign bank to operate within the IFSC. This new center will enable BoA to raise debt in international currency and has already facilitated two Indian bond auctions. The bank encourages Indian companies to utilize this platform for bond auctions.

title: In brief: US platform Luma deploys LexiFi’s Instrument Box
summary: US platform Luma has partnered with French fintech firm LexiFi to deploy its Instrument Box, enhancing Luma's platform with advanced derivative technology for custom views, tools, information, and automation. This collaboration aims to simplify sales and provide ongoing support to users, following Luma's launch in mid-2018 with co-investors Bank of America Merrill Lynch, Morgan Stanley, and Navian Capital. The article also covers other significant news in the structured products industry, including Simon Markets' expansion into annuities, Nomura's new securities license in China, Eusipa's addition of Luxipa, F&G's new indexed annuity featuring BlackRock ETFs, and Maybank's deployment of Avaloq Banking Suite for its HNW clients in Singapore.

title: Bank of America Economists Are Still Bullish on ‘Risky Assets’ in 2020
summary: Bank of America Merrill Lynch economists are bullish on "risky assets" like equities and commodities for 2020, despite global trade war headwinds. They expect global equity markets to outperform bond markets due to a rebound in corporate earnings, especially in European and emerging markets, and a potential recovery for value stocks. While a "skinny deal" in the U.S.-China trade dispute is anticipated, analysts warn it's merely a temporary measure in a larger, long-term conflict, and slower consumer spending and non-farm payroll growth are also predicted.

title: Sezzle Boosts Lending Power
summary: Minneapolis-based Sezzle has significantly increased its lending capacity by tripling its debt financing facility to $100 million with new lenders. This move, made ahead of the holiday shopping season, will allow Sezzle to onboard more merchants and shoppers for its buy-now, pay-later platform by funding consumer purchases. The new agreement also comes with a lower interest rate compared to its previous debt issuance.

title: Banker of the Year: Citizens Bank's Bruce Van Saun
summary: This article highlights Bruce Van Saun's transformation of Citizens Financial Group from a struggling regional bank into an industry standout, leading to him being named American Banker’s Banker of the Year for 2019. Under his leadership, Citizens underwent a successful IPO and strategic repositioning, focusing on commercial and consumer lending, technological innovation, and improving company culture. The article details the bank's significant financial rebound, market share gains, and future challenges, such as cutting expenses and deepening customer relationships.

title: Rentokil Initial tops league table of UK's most popular employers
summary: Rentokil Initial has been named the best company to work for in the UK, according to data from Indeed, surpassing 2018 winner Apple. The pest control and hygiene firm was praised for job security, advancement opportunities, work-life balance, and positive culture. British firms, including several high street brands and financial institutions, dominate the top 25 list of private sector employers, with employees valuing good work-life balance and positive work culture.

title: Citigroup globally established in emerging markets
summary: Citigroup has a strong global presence, with over 55% of its revenues derived from outside the US, significantly differentiating it from competitors like Bank of America and JPMorgan. The bank concentrates on emerging markets, which constitute about 43% of its revenues, offering substantial growth potential while managing risks through diversified operations and targeting investment-grade multinationals and high-credit quality consumers. This global strategy provides Citigroup with an early-mover advantage and the ability to expand operations across various markets.

title: Rentokil Initial is ranked the best place to work in Britain in a survey by Indeed
summary: Pest control and hygiene firm Rentokil Initial has been ranked the best company to work for in the UK by Indeed, unseating last year's winner Apple. The company was praised for its job security, advancement opportunities, work-life balance, and positive culture, based on reviews from its employees. The survey highlighted that companies need to offer more than just attractive salaries to secure top talent in today's job market.

title: Charles Schwab’s purchase of TD Ameritrade would create asset management giant
summary: Charles Schwab is acquiring TD Ameritrade in a $26 billion stock swap, a move spurred by widespread disruption and the elimination of online trading commissions in the brokerage industry. This merger would create a financial giant with over $5 trillion in client assets, positioning Schwab to save billions and offset lost revenue, though it may face antitrust scrutiny. The deal is indicative of potential broader consolidation within the industry as companies adapt to lower fees and increased competition.

title: Charles Schwab agrees to buy TD Ameritrade for $26 billion
summary: Charles Schwab has agreed to acquire TD Ameritrade for $26 billion, creating a brokerage giant with 24 million customer accounts and over $5 trillion in client assets. This merger follows both companies' decisions to eliminate online trading commissions, a move that sparked a price war in the industry and raised questions about revenue replacement. The deal is expected to generate up to $2 billion in savings, although it may face antitrust scrutiny and concerns about reduced consumer choice.

title: If You Invested $1,000 in Berkshire’s IPO, This Is How Much Money You'd Have Now
summary: This article illustrates the immense power of long-term compounding by examining an investment in Berkshire Hathaway's IPO. It details how a hypothetical $1,000 investment in 1964, when Warren Buffett took over, would be worth millions today. The piece showcases Buffett's investment strategy, highlighting the significant growth achieved by focusing on high-quality businesses with strong management.

title: A10 Hires New CEO, No Word on Potential Sale
summary: A10 Networks has appointed Dhrupad Trivedi as its new CEO, nearly four months after founding CEO Lee Chen announced his departure. Chen will remain chairman of the board. The company has not provided an update on a potential sale, which it began exploring in July with Bank of America Merrill Lynch.

title: Bank takes more space at uptown tower as it plots growth in Charlotte region
summary: Fifth Third Bank has expanded its presence in its namesake uptown Charlotte tower, now leasing 100,300 square feet. This expansion comes as the bank plans for significant local growth in the Charlotte region in the coming years.

title: Bank of America Corporation
summary: This page provides an overview of Bank of America Corporation, detailing its four business segments: Consumer Banking, Global Wealth & Investment Management, Global Banking, and Global Markets. It highlights how Bank of America's performance is evaluated by JUST Capital, based on issues prioritized by the American public, and offers tools for companies to understand and improve their stakeholder performance. The article also explains how public polling drives the JUST Capital Rankings.

title: Why Bank of America’s commercial loan portfolio is diversified
summary: Bank of America's commercial loan portfolio is significantly diversified across industries, geographies, and customers to mitigate risk. At the end of 2013, commercial loans comprised over 40% of its total loan portfolio, with major concentrations in diversified financials and real estate. The bank's non-US portfolio is spread across various regions, with Europe accounting for the largest share.

title: Feds sign off on $66 billion BB&T-SunTrust merger
summary: Federal regulators have approved the $66 billion merger between BB&T and SunTrust, paving the way for the creation of Truist Financial Corp. The merger is set to close on December 6, 2019, and will establish Truist as the sixth-largest bank in the nation.

title: IBM And Bank Of America Are Developing A Financial Services-Ready Public Cloud
summary: IBM and Bank of America are collaborating to develop the world's first financial services-ready public cloud, designed to meet the highly regulated needs of the banking industry. This specialized cloud aims to help financial institutions transform their operations with improved agility, security, privacy, and compliance, going beyond the capabilities of general horizontal cloud solutions. Bank of America will be the first customer, leveraging IBM's deep expertise in financial workloads, security, and regulatory compliance to address critical industry challenges like cyber-crime losses and fines.

title: Investing for Income with Durable Dividends
summary: This article discusses the ongoing search for yield among investors, particularly with low interest rates and increasing negative-yielding government debt. It highlights the potential pitfalls of traditional dividend strategies, such as "dividend traps," and introduces a "Durable Dividends Strategy" that focuses on attractively priced companies with strong financial health and the ability to sustain dividend payments, as exemplified by the VanEck Vectors Morningstar Durable Dividend ETF (DURA).

title: Spain Overtakes U.K. as Europe’s Worst Stock Market After Vote
summary: Following a recent election and the prospect of a coalition with an anti-austerity party, the IBEX benchmark has dropped 2.5% this week, making Spain's stock market the worst-performing in Europe. Banks are leading the losses, contributing to a fourth consecutive day of decline for the broader index. This downturn comes despite an earlier rally that had Spanish stocks nearing their year's highs.

title: European banks are ‘too small to survive’: UBS CEO
summary: UBS Group AG CEO Sergio Ermotti states that European banks are too small to compete with their U.S. counterparts and require consolidation for survival and growth. He argues that too many banks in Europe cannot cover their cost of capital, making "critical mass" essential in the banking sector to remain globally competitive. Ermotti also suggests cooperation with domestic players in target markets to avoid high costs associated with gaining market share.

title: Everything So Far Has Failed: Why Exxon Mobil Is Being Taken to Court Over Climate Change
summary: Exxon Mobil is facing a wave of climate change litigation, with a New York trial being the first of its kind to target a fossil fuel company directly. The case, People of the State of New York v. Exxon Mobil Corp., focused on alleged securities fraud regarding Exxon's representations to shareholders about climate risks. This litigation, alongside similar cases in Massachusetts and other states, aims to hold the fossil fuel industry accountable for contributing to the climate emergency and for misleading the public about scientific consensus.

title: BMO Harris plans downtown Sarasota move next year
summary: BMO Harris Bank is relocating its main Sarasota office to The Mark, a new mixed-use building at 1400 State St., by November 2020. This move signifies an upgrade to a more modern and visible downtown location for the bank, which reported $266.5 million in deposits. The article also touches on Bank of America's wage increases and a recent, unusual cluster of three U.S. bank failures.

title: Improving Mortgage Customer Experience With Digitalization
summary: The mortgage industry has historically neglected customer experience, leading to frustration and disengagement among borrowers. This article highlights how digitalization and fintechs are transforming the mortgage process by streamlining applications, reducing costs, and improving customer satisfaction, forcing traditional banks to adapt or lose market share. It details several grassroots customer issues and how technology-driven solutions are addressing them.

title: Bank of America continues flurry of new Houston-area branch openings
summary: Bank of America has been actively expanding its presence in the Houston market throughout 2019. The bank opened six new financial centers and renovated five existing locations, with plans for two more new branches by year-end. This expansion highlights Bank of America's continued investment in the Houston area.

title: Bank of America ramps up timeline for $20 an hour minimum wage
summary: Bank of America Corp. announced it will raise its minimum wage for hourly employees to $20 by the end of March 2020, which is a year earlier than initially scheduled. This move sets Bank of America apart from many other large banks, which reportedly offer lower starting salaries.

title: Bank of America, IBM combine on financial-services cloud project
summary: Bank of America and IBM have partnered to develop the world's first financial-services public cloud, aimed at helping banks and IT vendors comply with industry regulations. This platform prioritizes data security, resiliency, privacy, and customer information safety, with Bank of America being the initial collaborator. The goal is to eventually open this secure cloud platform, built on IBM's Red Hat OpenShift, to the entire banking industry.

title: IBM In Deal With Bank Of America For Financial Services-ready Cloud
summary: IBM is set to launch the world's first financial services-ready public cloud platform in collaboration with Bank of America. This platform, built on IBM's public cloud, aims to provide regulatory compliance, data security, and privacy for financial institutions, with Bank of America expected to host key applications. The initiative invites other financial services institutions and technology vendors to join, provided they comply with the platform's policies.

title: IBM, Bank of America Team Up on Public Cloud Aimed at Banks
summary: IBM and Bank of America have partnered to develop a public-cloud computing service specifically designed for banks. This new service aims to address the banking sector's stringent regulatory and compliance requirements, which have previously made banks hesitant to store sensitive customer data in cloud environments. Key features include automated security tools and advanced encryption to prevent unauthorized access.

title: Sallie Mae expands into cards amid dearth of competition for student credit
summary: Sallie Mae has launched three cash-back credit cards targeting students and recent graduates, capitalizing on reduced competition in the student credit market after the 2009 CARD Act. This move aims to promote financial responsibility but raises concerns about potentially increasing debt for students already struggling with loans. The company emphasizes its commitment to responsible lending and has implemented measures to address loan defaults, despite critics' worries about the expansion.

title: Woman Says Scammers Drained Her Account Through Zelle, But Fifth Third Bank Told Her They 'Can't Prove Anything'
summary: A Vernon Hills woman, Deborah Steidl, reported that scammers drained $2,540 from her Fifth Third Bank account using Zelle. Despite her claims, Fifth Third Bank initially denied her fraud claims, stating "we have determined the transaction is valid," leaving her without recourse until a later update confirmed the money was refunded. The incident highlights potential vulnerabilities with Zelle and public computer use, though the exact method of the scam remains a mystery.

title: As JPMorgan Chase expands in Minnesota, exec says there's no rush to get big
summary: JPMorgan Chase is taking a long-term, measured approach to its expansion in Minnesota, focusing on sustainable growth rather than rapid market share acquisition. Despite the market dominance of local banks, the company believes its retail presence and technological investments will help it build a strong commercial banking business. A top executive stated the bank views its presence in Minnesota with a 100-year horizon, prioritizing client value and optimized financial profiles over short-term gains.

title: Bank of America may be as profitable as J.P. Morgan in two years, analyst says
summary: Edward Jones analyst James Shanahan suggests that Bank of America could achieve profitability similar to J.P. Morgan within two years, making it a better investment over the next few years. He attributes this potential to Bank of America's record $7.6 billion in share buybacks in Q3 and significant investments in technology, which are expected to boost earnings performance and market share. Share buybacks contribute to higher earnings per share and improved returns on equity.

title: IL&FS raises ₹806 crore through sale of wind assets to Orix
summary: Infrastructure Leasing and Financial Services (IL&FS) completed the sale of its 51% stake in seven operating wind power assets, totaling 874 MW, to ORIX Corporation of Japan for ₹806 crore. This marks the first asset sale closure for the bankrupt group, enabling full repayment to lenders. ORIX now holds 100% ownership of these assets, after previously owning 49%, and the entire debt of ₹3,500 crore in the seven SPVs will remain under ORIX's ownership, ensuring no haircut for lenders.

title: Bank of America Tower, Camden apartments, parks among finalists for ULI Houston's annual awards
summary: The Houston District Council of the Urban Land Institute has announced 10 local projects as finalists for the 2020 Development of Distinction Awards. Among the finalists are the Bank of America Tower by Skanska USA and Camden apartments, along with various parks. These projects represent significant developments in the Houston area.

title: PNC to move into new local HQ as it expands in Boston
summary: PNC Bank is planning to move into a new local headquarters in Boston as part of its expansion efforts in the city. The regional president of the Pittsburgh-based banking giant discussed PNC's local hiring and philanthropic plans, as well as its strategy for retail branches in the area. This move follows previous announcements regarding PNC's decision to open its first retail branches in Boston and establish a regional president for its expansion.

title: Bank of America’s Wide Reach Pays Off
summary: Bank of America's strategy of deploying bankers across the country to engage with smaller businesses is yielding positive results, particularly in loan growth. The bank reported a notable 4.6% increase in total loans from the previous year, surpassing competitors, with commercial lending being a significant driver, growing by 7%. This performance suggests that targeting "flyover banking" is proving to be a successful approach for large lenders like Bank of America.

title: The commercial real estate media source.
summary: Annemarie DiCola, CEO of Trepp, hosted a CREW New York coffee meeting focusing on finance, investment, and capital markets in commercial real estate. The event was attended by numerous women in real estate from major financial institutions, including Societe General, Credit Agricole, Bank ABC, and Arbor Realty Trust. Attendees discussed finance, investment, and capital markets within CRE.

title: Citigroup names global co-heads for its equity capital markets business
summary: Citigroup Inc. has appointed Douglas Adams and James Fleming as global co-heads of its equity capital markets business. This move comes as the equity capital markets face a potential slowdown following recent unsuccessful IPOs and disappointing debuts, including WeWork and Peloton Interactive Inc. Adams previously co-led the North American ECM business, while Fleming was co-head for EMEA.

title: Stocks close higher, end two-day skid as China-U.S. trade talks come into focus
summary: Stocks closed higher on Wednesday, ending a two-day decline, as investors anticipated a de-escalation of trade tensions between the U.S. and China with high-level talks scheduled to begin Thursday. Additionally, investors focused on the minutes from the latest Federal Reserve meeting, amidst growing expectations for further interest rate cuts. The market's upward movement was driven by optimism surrounding these upcoming trade discussions.

title: Bank of America's Hunt Valley office sells for $99.3 million
summary: The Bank of America building in Hunt Valley has been sold for $99.3 million. This comes as Bank of America plans to hire 600 new employees by 2020 for the 377,332-square-foot tower.

title: G.M. Strike’s Economic Toll Is Showing: ‘I Might Lose the Business’ (Published 2019)
authors: Nelson D. Schwartz and David Yaffe-Bellany
summary: The ongoing General Motors strike by the United Auto Workers, now in its fourth week, is severely impacting businesses across the industrial Midwest, including auto parts suppliers and shippers. Many companies are facing layoffs and financial distress, with owners fearing business closure. This economic blow has significant political ramifications for the region, which is a key battleground in the upcoming 2020 presidential election.

title: HP’s Ink Business Used to Print Money. Now It’s Running Dry
summary: HP's lucrative ink business, once its financial lifeblood, is facing significant challenges due to changes in the market, including customers buying off-brand cartridges online. This has led to a major restructuring announcement by HP, including workforce reductions and a new strategy for its printer product lines. Despite these efforts, investors appear skeptical, as evidenced by a share drop and analyst downgrades.

title: 8 Ways To Make Your Money Greener
summary: This article outlines eight ways individuals can make their financial choices more environmentally friendly. It covers options ranging from switching to socially responsible banks and investment funds to making conscious decisions about credit cards, shopping, travel, carpooling, and charitable donations. The piece emphasizes how individual actions, when taken collectively, can have a significant positive impact on climate and social justice.

title: Car-Mart amends loan agreement, adds 2 lenders
summary: America’s Car-Mart Inc. has amended its loan agreement, adding BMO Harris Bank N.A. and Wells Fargo Bank N.A. as new lenders and solidifying commitments from existing partners. This new agreement extends the revolving credit facilities to September 30, 2022, increases total permitted borrowings to $241 million, and expands the accordion feature to $100 million. The company's CFO, Vickie Judy, stated this strategic move will enable Car-Mart to continue its growth and focus on customer success.

title: Bringing in experience: A local bank is hiring executives from much larger banking competitors
summary: A local bank is actively recruiting and hiring executives from significantly larger banking competitors. Featured executives include Barbara R. Cottrell, Ahmed El Nokali, and Vincent J. Delie, Jr., who are making the move to this local institution. This strategic hiring indicates a push to bring in experienced talent from top financial firms.

title: America’s Car-Mart, Inc. Enters Into New Loan and Security Agreement
summary: America’s Car-Mart, Inc. announced a new Third Amended and Restated Loan and Security Agreement effective September 30, 2019, replacing its previous agreement. This new agreement includes BMO Harris Bank, N.A. and Wells Fargo Bank, N.A. as new lenders, increasing total permitted borrowings from $215 million to $241 million, and extends the revolving credit facilities to September 30, 2022. The company's CFO, Vickie Judy, stated that this agreement will support continued growth and customer service.

title: Industry Focus: Bankers
summary: This article summarizes a roundtable discussion among Nevada banking executives about economic trends, regulations, and technological shifts affecting the industry.
